description:
One of my favorite ice cream places

So, so, far....but so, so, delicious

$3.50 for a 3oz (1 flavor) and that's even plentiful for me

Toasted almond, Vanilla Custard, Green Tea flavors are a.m.a.z.i.n.g

Parking is do-able but can get tough

Must stop by if you're nearby!
author: Yeanne L.

description:
I worry when I go to places that have a nostalgia/throwback/old school vibe, that they are relying mostly on appearances to try to signal authenticity and quality. I suspect this may be the case here. 

With most ice cream places, I hope to see a balance of classics and bold/unusual flavors on the menu. Here, as you might expect based on appearances, the menu options are not too out there. As far as the ice cream itself, the bases all had a bit muted flavor and possibly too high fat content, leaving a 'fat film' sensation in the mouth. I tend to not like talking about service in reviews, particularly if the food was great, but I was surprised after I left with my cone that I was given the wrong flavor - I would think an ice cream place leaning in to nostalgia vibes would want to get great service down cold
author: Neal B.

description:
We ordered a double-small scoop of peach + chocolate chip cookie dough.  Both were delicious, and the peach was surprisingly not at all sour.  

We also bought a 1/2 gallon of coconut ice cream to go.  Unlike other places, this coconut ice cream actually contains ample coconut flakes, which makes the ice cream richer and less dependent on flavoring.

We'll be back, Swensen's!
author: Colette C.

description: In the middle of our exploration of San Francisco we stopped by for some cream. I ordered the cookies and cream with the chocolate dip and it was bomb.com. Come through and get that delicious cream.
author: Michael A.

description:
We came in after dinner on a rainy Friday night and there was no wait. My fiance heard about their sticky chewy chocolate flavor so we shared one scoop of that on a cone. Talk about great classic chocolate ice cream but yes, a little stickier and chewier. It wasn't like a caramel sticky but like a thick creamier consistency that worked really well with the rich chocolate. The guy broke his first cone trying to get the huge scoop to stick on. The scoop was only around $3 which is a steal in SF! Will definitely come back to try other flavors.

Note that it is pretty hard to find parking in the area. We walked up Lombard street to get here from our parking spot (wonderful view at night though).
author: Christine L.

description:
CASH ONLY. Swensen's... Swensen's totally looks and feels like an old school creamery. Perched atop the Russian Hill neighborhood is this cool creamery. 

Greeted by a gentleman who answered a couple quick questions about flavors. 

I went with :
Toasted Almond- Very good and different
Marble ?- Very good as well

So many good ice cream spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.


Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 
I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Chocolate Covered
5 Smitten Ice Cream
6 Teuscher Chocolate 
7 The Ice Cream Bar
8 Coletta Gelato
9 Cako Creamery
10 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
11 Bi-Rite Creamery
12 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
13 Swensons
14 Mitchells Ice cream
15 St. Francis Fountain
16 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
17 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
18 Recchiuti Confections 
19 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description: One of my favorite ice cream spots in the city. You can always expect to get the best, their ice cream is absolutely delicious. If you are in the neighborhood and have a craving you must stop by.
author: Roman L.

description:
This is a cute ice cream place. There are so many different flavors so be sure to sample a lot of them. I samples Turkish coffee and loved that one but I highly recommend the sticky chewy chocolate flavor! They even have different size cones. 

Also it's cash only!
author: Camila V.

description:
Came here and tried a couple of flavors. Tried the cookies and cream, lychee,  chocolate, Carmel fudge. Ended up with the cookies and cream as I felt like most of these were pretty thick and this was the creamiest of the bunch.

I think if you prefer ice cream to be a little firmer and less creamy this place will be great for you.
author: Victor D.

description:
Came here on a classic San Francisco night, through Karl the Fog and up a deceptively steep hill. After walking from Telegraph Hill we were relatively out of breath and ready for our ice cream. 

We went into the shop thinking we were going to split a sundae, but we ended up liking our individual flavors we sampled so much that we decided to just get a scoop each. With the prices being relatively cheaper than most popular spots around town (around $3.50), we were really happy with what we got - the black raspberry and the caramel marble. Both were almost like an incredibly rich and creamy vanilla swirled with black raspberry and caramel syrups respectively. In fact, the ice cream was almost so creamy that it reminded me more of a custard than ice cream. 

In terms of the shop itself, there isn't much in the way of decor or seating. The ice cream is definitely better than the shop itself. To eat your ice cream you have to stand around the outside of the shop - not ideal on a chilly night.

I had no idea this was a chain before seeing all these other reviews, so I can only hope that the other locations are as good as this one. As long as we can brave the hills again, we'll definitely be back!
author: Jenny D.

description:
I was making my way to Lombard Street without a mission, and lo and behold, I walked into Swensen's Ice Cream shop.  It's an old-fashioned ice cream shop that serves some deliciously unique flavors.  

They had me at Lychee, one of the most unique flavors that I'm always on the lookout for!  

They let me sample a few different ones, and I ended up with lychee (duh!) and the Sticky Chewy Chocolate.  

I kind of got the feeling that the Russian Hill locals come just as much as tourists. As I was leaving, a sweet little old man told me I picked the wrong flavors and told me to try a different chocolate one.  When it comes to ice cream, it absolutely IS important to try all the chocolate flavors, so I was glad he schooled me!  But I did like the ones I picked the most.

Final verdict: Totally great surprise.  Worth the pit stop and a great way to enjoy Lombard Street ice cream in hand!  Loved the old ice cream shop feel and the unique flavors!
author: Liza K.

description:
Yum yum yum, this is the perfect corner ice cream shop! 
Service is fast and friendly, selection is large and ice cream is super delicious. 

I'd definitely get the thin mint and cookie dough, they are amazing. They were really nice about giving out samples, and the line still moves quickly. Milkshakes take quite some time, but they are thick and worth the wait. 

Ideal little spot to walk to after dinner!
author: Sam S.

description:
Really good quality ice cream! Very difficult parking, and no place to sit inside, but once you start eating the frozen deliciousness, you sort of don't care.

They have some interesting flavors that I haven't seen elsewhere, particularly when it's not the season. We tried several different flavors and all of them were great.

Of course I loved the company I was with, which made this place even more special.
author: Greg H.

description:
My friend and I ate near Washington Square and decided to come up here for some Ice Cream, seeing as all the reviews on Yelp. Even though it was only about half a mile away, the hike up the hill to get it made it quite a long hike! Still I was excited to see what all the hype was about.

This place only takes cash, and a single 4oz scoop is $3.75. I got one of those with the Sticky Chewy Chocolate flavor, on a cone, and it was okay. The ice cream itself was pretty good, in the sense that texture and creaminess of it was on point. But beyond that, the flavor was rather boring.

The chocolate just tasted of a generic chocolate, it didn't even have anything that made it stand out, and the chocolate itself reminded me of the ones from those giant buckets tubs of ice cream. Outside of the texture and creaminess, the ice cream just wasn't all that good.

They have a few interesting flavors too, like Lychee and Matcha, which I wouldn't expect it an ice cream parlor like store, but otherwise the place is kind of run of the mill for me.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Awful customer service! I walked in and all THREE of the employees just stared at me!! No one asked me the standard questions like, "How are you?" "Do you have any questions?" "Let me know if I can help you." Did not feel welcomed at all. Instead, more like an intruder into their work establishment forcing them to actually work!

Come on guys! Ice cream is suppose to be a treat, a fun experience. Don't make people feel like they are a nascence. 

Sorry, but won't be coming back.
author: Brooke H.

description: Great classic scooped ice cream! My friends and I came here after having ramen at Japantown. We came during a weeknight and there was no wait at all. I would say Swensen is a classic ice cream shop that does ice cream right. There's no fancy flavour such as Ube or Unicorn or anything like. It's straight up classics such as Vanilla, Chocolate, caramel and etc. I ordered a 2 scoop with Vanilla and Sea Salt Caramel. It was the best scooped Ice cream I've had in a while. The ice cream was soft and milky. You get a pretty big scoop for your order too! I would definitely recommend Swensen's to anyone that is nearby there and give them a try! You won't be disappointed.
author: Eddie T.

description:
For being the first ever Swensen's location, this place was a lot less touristy than I thought it'd be. It's at the top of a huge hill (probably contributing to the lack of tourism), and by the time my party of four saw the light at the top of the mountain, we were sweating and ready for some deliciously legendary ice cream. 

The store is cute, and feels really vintage - 50s hip. The flavors were classic. I ordered the thin mint ice cream (which ended up just being like mint chip ice cream). It was really good, really refreshing, and had chocolate shavings evenly churned through. But overall, I wasn't too impressed. I guess the it just didn't live up to the hype. The staff seemed tired and to be honest, we felt a little unwelcome. 

It was good ice cream, but I won't be making the hike back any time soon.
author: Waverly R.

description: I had just dropped my dog off at boarding before vacation and I was very bummed out so I decided I needed a treat. I stopped at Swensen's on my walk home and got a double scoop cone of coffee and toasted almond. Ice cream stills makes one happy - even an adult who is dropping off her puppy.
author: Danielle S.

description: got the caramel turtle fudge  such a good date spot even at 10pm and ice cream was delicious
author: Soojeong H.

description:
Was craving a sweet treat after eating at House of Prime Rib and saw that Swensen's was within walking distance. Once we walked in, we were welcomed by the friendly staff who let us sample a number of different flavors before deciding what to order. 

I was ecstatic to see that they had Green Tea Ice Cream on their menu and of course I had to order it! The Green Tea Ice Cream with a Sugar Cone was delicious and perfect for a rare scorching hot sunny day in San Francisco. Getting Swensen's was the perfect way to end the day while strolling around the neighborhood and enjoying the scenic views of the city. I can see why this ice cream shop is such a stable!
author: MyTien P.

description:
I just HAD to try Swensen's because not only is in my hood (well in my hood but it feels oceans apart because of the dang hills), but I just had to stop by and taste all the nostalgia and memories that fellow Yelpers were smotherin' about.

This place is legit historic and an absolute fiesta in my mouth. I've only had the cookies and cream and lychee flavors...both were utterly delicious. The cookies and cream was especially fantastic because it had actual large cookie CHUNKS. I was literally engulfing whole pieces of oreo cookie and it was a dream. The Lychee was also a more exotic choice but just as delicious and very refreshing and had lychee fruit flesh in it. Is it weird to use flesh when speaking about fruit? Ha.

I am filled with overwhelming joy and internal tears of satisfaction when I come here, order a scoop (or two) (or three) on a cone, stand outside the premises,  hold my cone with two hands (never one) and transform back to a time when I was a litte kid with no pretenses about anything or anyone. Those were the dayz! Let's keep screaming for ice scream and never ever grow up.

Deal?
author: Connie M.

description:
After eating at Zarzuela, my wife decided she wanted dessert across the street. 

We wandered over and observed the menu. Many choices for the sweet tooth. 

She got the thin mint and I got the lemon custard.

One word..delish. It was some of the best ice cream we've eaten in ages 

I'd love to go back during the warmer months 

Recommended
author: Timmy T.

description: Soooo good! Got the waffle cone Sunday w choc and Mint chip whip cream and sprinkles and ate the entire thing!!
author: Tracy M.

description: Like these old fashioned ice cream parlors. Brings me back to my childhood. I got a scoop of the caramel turtle fudge. It was really good. I also tried the lychee sherbet. It was fresh and light bit I was looking for something creamer so maybe next time. My bf asked for a strawberry sundae.  I think he was expecting vanilla ice cream with strawberry topping. Instead he got strawberry ice cream with chocolate sauce, nuts and whipped cream. He still ate it, just slightly disappointing. Will be back to satisfy my ice cream craving.
author: Alison W.

description:
After having dinner I saw a a huge line, and people coming out with ice cream, didn't think it twice and went to see what it was all about. Surprisingly even though the line was long the wait was no more then 5 minutes. 

I ordered the strawberry sherbet, absolutely delicious! Definitely recommend it!
author: Cynthia A.

description: This place has vast selection of ice cream and milk shakes. Very nice! Doesn't accept cards, cash only.
author: Nick B.

description: Still a classic. We take the kids here every few couple of months. A real treat. I remember this place as a kid and even the one in Dublin which is now long gone. 70s decor is epic.
author: brian k.

description:
Lemon custard was just how I remember it, must try. Unfortunately, there's no where to sit and enjoy your ice cream. We return for sure. 

Lemon custard 5/5
Sticky chewy chocolate 4/5
Service 5/5
author: Nicole J.

description:
We drove by and were SHOCKED to see a REAL LIVE SWENSENS!!!  This is the very last store in existence.  We HAD to go get us some SWISS ORANGE CHIP.  It was better than we remembered.

The manager was super helpful and triple wrapped our 1/2 gallon up for our hour drive.
author: R R.

description:
I was extra excited to see the rarely achieved 4.5 star yelp rating, and I'm probably gonna be crucified for this, but it wasn't very good. For all the ridiculous food trends and sky high prices, if there's one thing SF does right, it's ice cream. I guess I've been spoiled by all the gourmet scoop shops, because Swensen's tasted like generic grocery store ice cream to me. Like if someone brought it to me as an offering, I'd easily refuse and save myself the calories. I sampled several flavors and didn't love any of them- what's up with the green tea that looks unnaturally green but tastes nothing like tea? Ultimately, I settled on the choc chip cookie dough because it's the safest option.

Things I did love about Swensen's:

1. Customer service: I got trolled quite a bit by my server, but that seems to happen to me everywhere in life. I asked if I could sample flavors and he said no with such a straight face that my girlfriends took him seriously. But he turned out to be super nice and I do enjoy friendly banter.
2. It's simply an SF institution, having been around for decades and still going strong. I appreciate that they stayed true to their old school vibe all this time, and it's apparently famous enough that a group of tourists asked us to take a photo for them outside in front of the sign. I was volunteered as tribute as I'm apparently "the best at taking photos." But also one guy asked me if he looks fat in the photo, and that's just not within my control, dude.
3. Prices are CHEAP. The small is a generous scoop for only $3.40, although it's a little annoying that they only accept cash. For comparison, one small scoop at garden creamery is $4.25, but tbh my wannabe boujee ass will pay the extra dollar for better quality.

I'd usually even come back and just not order anything if someone suggested it for dessert, but given that there's not any seating or space to hang out, I'd deffo veto it.
author: Karen S.

description:
The strawberry flavor was different from average strawberry ice cream out there, because the ones here have huge chunks of real frozen strawberries. I recommend this flavor if you like something sweet and refreshing. 
I also had the Mocha chip (I don't recall the exact name), which was okay. I thought it had too much chocolate chip, which I got tired of when I got through about half the scoop. 

Both flavors were not too sweet, which is to my liking as I don't have a crazy sweet tooth. On the other hand, my boyfriend who does like super sweet stuff, said the chocolate flavor wasn't as thick and rich as he likes it to be. 

Parking: Street parking. There were two 10-minute reserved parking only for Swensen customers, which I appreciated. Otherwise, there were street parking all around the neighborhood, which I'm guessing could become a bit of struggle in busy times due to other restaurants and shops on the street. 

Seating: No seats. Small shops with the cashier counters only.
author: Jaeryeong Y.

description:
Swensen's is a name I'm familiar with on a national basis, so I was curious to see what their original shop looked like.

It's a relatively no-frills venue at the corner of Union and Hyde that hearkens to the soda fountain days of yore. It offers several dozen flavors of ice cream, plus sorbets, floats, and sundaes, all at reasonable prices compared to trendier places like Humphry Slocombe or Bi-Rite. The ice cream is fairly good - then again, who can complain about ice cream?

While there's no space to linger around inside, its location right along the cable car line makes for nice, touristy people-watching as you slurp away.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I always love stopping by Swensen's if I'm in the area. The 3 times I have been here, the service has always been excellent, the ice cream has always been tasty, and the lines usually don't exist. Yesterday, there were about 5 people in line and the line moved quickly because there were 3 different people working behind the counter. 

I always get a single scoop of the Toasted Almond. Le bf really enjoys the Sticky Peanut Butter ice cream. 

This is definitely a place you need to stop by for ice cream. You won't regret it.
author: Carolyn Z.

description: This is the best ice cream in San Francisco--possibly the world. Amazing price, quality is top notch, and it has the feel of an antique ice cream shop. I crave the peanut butter flavor more often than I'd like to admit!
author: Leah H.

description: Always awesome. This time we had thin mint, strawberry, toasted almond and cookie dough and all were excellent. We only wish we had room for more!
author: S C.

description:
It was enjoyable and very light for a hot day in the city. My fiancé really enjoyed the lychee ice cream. Probably best one we tried in the city so far

Flavors we got : lychee and cherry
Time of day: 1:30 on a Saturday
No seating
Wait time: about 5 minutes
Parking is very limited and only street but we got lucky
author: Brett H.

description: It is kind of small inside and there is no room to sit, but the ice cream is yummy. My favorite is the Turkish coffee.
author: Brian F.

description: Always a nice generous scoop. Lots of flavors to choose from.
author: Gary W.

description:
Amazing Ice Cream for a hot or cold night!

I've passed by Swenses's numerous times, but never got the time to stop in and try it, and boy was that a mistake on my part! 

Every flavor looked and sounded very delicious! The employees were very helpful and didn't mind you trying multiple flavors! I got a scoop of pumpkin and cookie dough. MMMMM

The price isn't bad at all for the amount of ice cream you get for it!

I will definitely be coming back here again!
author: Michael T.

description:
The best old fashioned ice cream shop ever! No seating here and cash only. I've tried a few of their flavors but their cookies and cream is THE BEST. I usually get a quart if this every week.

I've also tried their half gallon but that doesn't soften as evenly when you take it out of the freezer so i'd rec the quart size if you decide to go with the bulk size.
author: Jasper L.

description:
Ordered a lychee and thin mint flavored ice cream.
The lychee was super rich and even had lychee bits in it. Love that it didn't taste fake at all.

The thin mint was really minty and yummy with the chocolate bits! Highly recommended ice cream place if you're in the area! 

** Not a place to hang out and get together with your friends, there's no seating and very small.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Located in a primarily residential area and outside of the SF neighborhoods I usually frequent, it's taken me a while to make the trip to Swensen's.

We finally made the trek on a Sunday afternoon and luckily we scored a parking spot across the street right as we pulled up. In walking around a little while eating our ice cream though I can imagine parking is challenging more often than not.

Since it was our first time visiting, we wanted to sample several flavors and the scoopers were really cool about it. I tried Lemon Curd, Black Raspberry Marble, Fresh Banana, and Sticky Peanut Butter. Lemon Curd was good and I was surprised they had it because it's not common to see lemon ice cream flavors in the Bay Area, but I opted for the latter two.

Ice cream was flavorful, but the banana was lacking a creamy texture and the peanut butter in the Sticky Peanut Butter were large chunks in a chocolate base rather than swirled throughout.

An ok pick if you're in the area with cash on hand, want interesting flavors and reasonably priced scoops, but wouldn't go out of my way again.
author: Lindsey C.

description:
This place simply is wonderful
Old world ice cream parlor feel. Great flavors and service 
Must try the Swiss orange chocolate. It's everything you can dream of and more. 
And I can't wait to October to try the pumpkin Ice cream. .
author: David C.

description:
Old school ice-cream spot with a huge selection of flavors. 

If you have a chocolate obsession like me, then you won't be disappointed with the Sticky Chewy Chocolate.  

Cash only - I only had $3 but my ice-cream was $3.40, but they let the $0.40 go.  Thank you!!
author: Christine A.

description: Decent ice cream with TERRIBLE customer service. One of my best friends lives near Swensen's and every time I've been the employees just stare at us and don't say one word... not even the price we owe... NOT. ONE. WORD. I'm not one to write reviews, but someone needs to train these people. Sorry but I'll be walking another 30 steps down the street to Loving Cup for now on.
author: Megan J.

description: Good ice cream. Cash only and used the same gloves to take our money as to scoop our ice cream. Always loved this place but seems like it's seen better days.
author: Robyne M.

description:
Ice cream is a rare indulgence, but if I'm in the area finishing up a sushi meal at Elephant Sushi or Okoze, I'll feel good enough about my food choices to indulge in an ice cream cone at Swensen's. Last night was one of those times.

I ordered a single scoop of toasted almond dipped in chocolate, and it was divine. The total came out to less than $8 for two ice cream cones!

My other favorite here is the pumpkin spice ice cream when pumpkin is in season.

My only complaint about Swensen's is that it's not a place where you can stay and enjoy your dessert. You're in and out and left to stand on the sidewalk to eat your ice cream or walk home while you're still trying to finish your ice cream. I wish they had some benches or chairs outside.
author: Grace C.

description:
Yummy, traditional ice cream. 

I got the cookies and cream in a cone and was extremely satisfied.
author: Michelle B.

description: Hands down the best ice cream I've had in a very long time!! Serve with a smile it was as if I took a step back in time in the middle of the city. Loved it!!
author: Bryant K.

description: Swansons is decent, good ice cream, though the flavors we tried weren't all outstanding. We had turtle, vanilla custard, and chocolate. The vanilla custard came in below par for custard - it was missing the density of a good custard. The turtle was okay, but only just okay. The chocolate was excellent. Dark and gritty and rich.
author: Ryan M.

description: I've been eating their ice cream for years but it's gone down hill- ice cream isn't as good as it used to be. There are not bathrooms & parking is very tricky.
author: Toni T.

description:
Never got to try it. Didn't NOTICE any "cash only" signs as I walked in, and weren't looking for any, but was told by the help after he made my double scoop waffle cone, handed it to me and I pulled out my debit card that "we're cash only". I replied, "Sorry", handed it back to him, and walked out. Hope he enjoyed it.

Based on the other reviews I've seen, it appears their ice cream is "just ok".  Mitchell's Ice Cream, which I HAVE eaten, is excellent... and they got out of the Stone Age and started accepting debit and credit cards a long time ago.
author: Pablo J.

description:
CASH ONLY! The ambiance of this place reminds me of a hybrid of a children's candy store and an antique store. I came in, super excited to see all the flavors. 

Got to try: lychee, peppermint stick, lemon custard, mocha fudge. Ended up getting:
1 waffle cone ($1 extra) with Sticky Chewy Chocolate and Thin Mint // $6.95 total.
+"Sticky" series is popular! And popular it should be! Delicious texture, abundance of chocolate. 
+Waffle cone isn't sweet but I love the thickness of it! 
-For thin mint, I was hoping for a girl scout type of feel, which actual chunks of thin mint or something. Alas, it is a very basic mint chip but still delicious! 

Pros:
+Great service. They give you hefty portions for sampling!
+Greta portion size! 
+Cool flavors! I love the old school feel and their versions of the classics. 
+Super creammyyyyyy. Yum! 

Cons:
-Not as "texture-y" as I like. I love having chunks and pieces of stuff in my ice cream. 

If it wasn't for the missing chunks (or more like non-existent chunks) I would totally give it a 5 stars! 

PS: If you're a regular and know what flavors you like, they also sell half gallons/tubs of their ice cream!
author: Hurjane V.

description: This place rocks! I like a good old-fashioned ice cream shop. This place has a wide variety of flavors. They even have a little Asian touch with mango and lychee. There were so many good flavors to choose from. I ended up with "fresh banana" and it was delicious. It had the perfect consistency and creaminess. I had it on a cake cone. I would come back to this place, but you have to go up the hill and I do not live in this part of town at all. But if u are around here, definitely have a scoop at Swensen's. Not too expensive.
author: Denise C.

description: chanced upon it and drove there 3 times during our 3 days vacation. love the selections and the ice cream... yummy !!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
LOVE the Toasted Almond ice cream here. It's THE best flavor at Swenson's!! Basically, my brother and I grew up on this. Our uncle used to stop by Swenson's once every few weeks to grab a gallon of the Toasted Almond ice cream...and it's still my fav til this day. I don't get anything else here :)

Few things : (1) Parking is SHITTY. Nearly impossible majority of the time...soo be prepared for that; (2) it's CASH ONLY...soo if you're trying to impress a date, don't forget the cash money; (3) they've got some kind of reward/free ice cream situation?! Not entirely sure how in the world it works, but the last time I stopped by, my friend and I "won" our ice cream bc our receipt printed out w a stamped star on it????? I think??? Wasn't clear on what happened. But yayay free ice cream!

Basically, 5 stars for the nostalgia. Will never be here unless I'm in the area. And happen to have cash on me.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Somethings never change!

....And that's a good thing.

Swensen's Ice Cream is still awesome. Still serving up unique flavors. The ice cream is still rich, smooth, and delicious. Portions size is still great.

The owners are great funny people that are hard working.

Tourists should definitely check it out....Cash only.

Still lines out the door too!

Taste a bit of SF history!
author: David G.

description:
Swensen... the ice cream shop that launched a thousand ice cream shops... well more like a couple hundred. 
After dinner, Mr. Joy said he wanted to get something sweet close by. Somehow, we ended up at Swensen's from across the city. Well, it was unusually warm, so maybe the weather and the full moon was making us do weird things. Perhaps this picturesque, old-school classic of an ice cream parlour was calling our names. 

There were already quite a few people there. The shop is pretty small, so the line easily goes out the door, but the line moves pretty fast so it helps to know what you want ahead of time. Most people took their orders and went on their way. Some people were enjoying their ice cream on the sidewalk. 

They have a list of flavors on a menu board with very tiny print. 
I tried the Sticky Chewy Chocolate and it was very good. I don't usually go for chocolate-y flavors, but after hearing many good things about it, curiosity won me over. It tastes like fudge if fudge were transformed into ice cream and does have somewhat of a sticky consistency. 
I think I need to try the regular Chocolate & the Sticky Chewy Chocolate simultaneously, just for kicks.

I appreciate that Swensen's has maintained its '50s diner charm for decades. Plus their prices are very affordable compared to most ice cream shops. A small is $3.40 and it is a very generous sized scoop. However, they really need to get a credit card terminal. Cash-only businesses are an inconvenience. Considering Swensen's is an international success with hundreds of locations, I think they can handle the processing fees.
author: Joy W.

description: Cash Only: good ice creams service also good, no place to sit but they reserved spot for your car lol. Well just average ice cream flavors.
author: Jerry B.

description: I was out for a late night walk while visiting the city and came across this little place.  It was the perfect cap to a great day.
author: Nick S.

description: Love swenson's mocha chip. So good!
author: Taylor J.

description:
Been chilling here (pun intended) since 1946, and it seems like that haven't changed much in the last couple of decades, seeing as how they had already mastered the art of the classic ice cream.

Swensen's is pretty much the pinnacle of the old timey ice cream shops in the bay area, perhaps because it has more history/success in the city than any other. Anyways, atop one of the highest hills in the whole city, when walking this city, this ice cream shop is not for the faint of heart. It can definitely be a trek to get there, but once you do, the reward for accomplishing this quest is great. Yes, soft, cold, melty ice cream that's to be sloppily eaten and engorged upon with an unrelenting vigor. Unlike the other ice cream shops around the city, Swensen's doesn't have too many unusual flavors, but it mostly just focuses on traditional flavors and tries to keep the quality of these select few flavors creamy, and delicious. 

As for the ice cream's consistency, it's a little bit melty and softer. And while it wasn't soupy melty, it was definitely melting fairly fast when eating it (which was in like 50 degree weather by the way). Because of this, eating it reminded me of a lot of older movies that featured older timey ice cream shops. You know the ones where the children have ice cream all over their face, and you think to yourself, "Dear Lord child! Try to get more of the ice cream in your mouth as opposed to the rest of your face." I totally thought this was more of a hollywood trope to make the child seem adorable. In reality, and specifically at Swensen's, this shizz actually happens- and specifically to me. Chocolate was all up in my business as I tried to engulf the cone before it melted all over my pants. There were spots on my nose, drips on my arms, and an ample amount all over my cheeks. Luckily for the last one, my beard was able to cover up most of this, but upon entering a bathroom next, I was able to see the extent of the damage this single cone could cause. So be careful when eating this on a sweltering summer day. Things could get a little bit messy.

Overall the place it really solid, but it certainly isn't perfect. The very few things that keep it from getting the 5th star are: a little too melty in colder weather, and there are more exciting flavors to be found around the city. But if you're looking for a classic ice cream cone, then Swensen's is a solid (well melty solid) choice.
author: Daniel Z.

description:
My roommate and I both agree -the best ice cream ever! Very old school, old fashion and very creamy. Doesn't melt too fast.

Gotta get the peanut butter!
author: Ken W.

description:
This ice cream is rather tasty. I tried the cookies and cream and it tasted like how I wanted. It was a good balance of vanilla ice cream and cookie. 

This ice cream was a bit darker than the usual cookies and cream though. It's also not smooth like liquid nitrogen ice cream but I'm not too picky about ice cream.

There is basically no seating area. It's definitely a grab and go ordeal.

Also bring cash.
author: Danielle C.

description:
I been coming to Swensen's since grade school. Been forever. They don't have special flavors but they have really good classics. They have at least 20 classic flavors to choice from. Staff is always friendly and nice. Neighborhood gem. 

My favorite is the **VANILLA CRUST and **TOASTED ALMOND. Very smooth and not super sweet. 

If you like peanut butter, you must get the **Sticky PEANUT BUTTER. Omg, so flavorful. Really good but it's way strong to eat a single myself. But its really good.
author: Sandy B.

description: Amazingly delicious homemade ice cream.   Staff was very friendly amd they are open late.  Right on trolley stop
author: Joe S.

description: The Sticky chewy ice cream is worth the trek there. The leechee one was bomb as well!
author: Neha D.

description: This takes me back to my childhood.  The only other location that I have ever seen or visited was way back when I was a kid and it was in Los Angeles.  It was a fave spot of mine and my family's.  This is a simple ice cream shop that makes their own ice cream on site.  They are behind in the times, meaning they are a cash only establishment.  They have a pretty large selection of flavors and one of my favorites is the Sticky Chewy Chocolate.  There isn't any space in here to hang out but it's a nice place to stop and grab a cone and walk around the Russian Hill area.  Parking is scarce and it's not far from the Ghiradelli Square but in my eyes, this is even more a treat than anything from Ghiradelli.
author: Chris C.

description:
I love this place!  I've been coming here since I've moved to the city about ten years ago and it never disappoints.  I look forward to new and exciting flavors and some old classics.  It's a small mom & pop joint that's a gem.  Oh sure there are a handful of hipster ice cream places that's popped up in the city since that are just as good but Swensen's is just one of those special places for me.  Maybe it's their location (on top of the hill with the cable car coming and going all day), their small, warm and quaint mom and pop feel of the place, or just the amazing ice cream flavors they have.  Who knows.  I just know that every time I go I feel comfort and warm fuzzy feelings of someone familiar.

The only thing missing here is a place to sit and savor every bit of your treat.  What do we have to do to have a parklet built right in front so we can enjoy our ice cream while watching tourist ride the cable car up and down Hyde Street? A girl can dream can she?
author: Naty D.

description: Ice cream is so good here. I used to live down the block and would come here for a late night treat! Green tea is my favorite, also love Sticky Chewy Chocolate and Coconut is delicious as well! Cash only. Usually no wait and they open late. Love this place!!
author: Rebecca W.

description:
Such a nostalgia-inducing old fashioned ice cream shop. Their cookies and cream flavor tasted like childhood--creamy, chock full of cookies, and perfect with a sugar cone. It totally made my day (and my giant "small" was $3.40. How is this possible in San Francisco?).

Swensen's is absolutely worth the trek to Russian Hill and the annoyance of making a quick stop at the ATM.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Bring back childhood memories, over 50 years!!!!....Still the BEST ice cream in the City.
As a kid, had a paper route on LOMBARD ST.,with my brothers. As a treat, after work,
We would always drop by at SWENSEN for ROCKY ROAD ICE CREAM!  
Was by there recently, still the same old place.......memories!,,,Still the BEST

Also, been to the  SWENSEN in Bangkok, Thailand
author: Bill W.

description: I've been visiting this place in San Francisco since I can remember. If you are a chocolate fan you must try the sticky chewy chocolate. It is the absolute bomb. They have so many other exquisite flavors I could just go on. This is the original Swensons and I believe the ice cream is still made on premise. It's delicious and if you visit San Francisco it's just up the way from Lombard Street. You owe yourself a stop and a treat!
author: Robert C.

description:
Awesome. Terrific choices and wonderful
Creamy intense flavors.
We had Peppermint stick , black raspberry marble and a marble Fudge all of which were terrific... nice to NOT have a line at 8pm on a sat night in the summer for 45min typical of Bi Rite or Mitchell's too...
author: A K.

description: VERY good!  GREAT selection of flavors. HIGHLY RECOMMEND the Sticky Peanut Butter in a hot fudge sundae.  Great place to stop if in and around Lombard Street (just down the hill).  No bathrooms in this area.  Prices are reasonable for good size scoops.  Worth a try.
author: David L.

description:
I guess it depends on your palette? 

If you're from Minneapolis and love, love, love Sebastien's in uptown, you'll find Swensen's completely lackluster.

Sebastien's has creamy, rich, flavorful ice creams and is such a delightful and super fun experience with their awesome staff!

You'll find Swensens is the opposite, dull, flavorless, boring ice cream with staff that also reflects that same dull, boring, aloof attitude. Who knew ice cream could make people so sad?

If you prefer cardboard box tasting ice cream, this is the place to do it.  Definitely skip this on your SF trip please, not worth it.
author: Siobhan W.

description: Creamy, tasty, cheap old school ice-cream. Have been going there for many years and the flavors nd prices haven't changed at all.
author: Abhijeet T.

description: Had the Swiss orange chip and sticky chewy chocolate flavors. Both were excellent, but very melty! Service was good and quick.
author: Carrie L.

description:
My go-to pick: Turkish coffee and green tea.

Both flavors aren't bitter nor are they overly sweet. There have been places that make green tea ice cream either way too bitter to capture the tea taste or too sweet that it doesn't taste an ounce like green tea. Swenson's isn't one of them, theirs taste legit. For chocolate lovers, I recommend the sticky chewy chocolate. 

Parking in this area can be a pain and i usually see cars stopped in front, they get their ice cream then they bounce.
author: Eva O.

description: Neighborhood favorite. Nothing too too special. Solid flavors but pretty plain. The cone was very crispy even by the end so that was nice
author: Song K.

description: still one of the better ice creams in SF, great selection of dense ice cream that's not whippy. like i said before people are enamored by the trendy new spots that they forget about the ones whose been there forever. its always fun to walk in and take our scoops to a nearby stoop and wait for the trolleys to pass by.
author: NYSD G.

description: Yummy ice cream away from the buzz of crowds but still along the cable car line. I had a lemon custard ice cream that was so yummy and smooth! If you're in the area, hit this place up! CASH ONLY, if I remember correctly!
author: Lauren M.

description: Good,  but not as good as baked Bear of sf.  Maybe because I got cookies n cream instead of what they're famous for and that is the sticky chocolate ice cream
author: Romeo RJ A.

description:
First off, I would like to credit The Bachelor show for introducing me to Swensen's. Haha does anyone remember Ben F's season where he took a girl to a date at the City Hall & Swensen's? 

Anyways, last night I got to try this place with my boyfriend. We found a parking spot nearby the store luckily. There was a small line, but it moved rather quickly. Yes! Bf got the banana & strawberry while I had the sticky chewy chocolate & cookies-n-cream. Soooo delish. I really loved his flavors more cause there really tasted like the actual fruits. Refreshing! I like mine too. What girls doesn't chocolate riiight?? ;)

Cash only. Cute yummy ice cream place indeed. Can't wait to return again! ^__^
author: Amy C.

description: Tiny spot, and CASH only. Their cookies n cream is delicious! Love this place and visit every time I'm in SF. Highly recommend it! Creamy and smooth texture.
author: R S.

description: Good, but not amazing! Staff was helpful, i think i tired over 6 flavors and they recommended i get the pint since I wanted at least 4 flavors (more economical, even tho it broke my heart having to throw out ice cream). I loved the sticky peanut butter, but wish they would've told me that the sticky peanut butter had a chocolate base, cuz then I would've probably not ordered the sticky chewy chocolate as well. The other 2 flavors I ordered was the peppermint stick and bordeaux cherry, both were great the first bite, but couldn't eat more than a few bites... I also tried the caramel turtle, but it was way too sweet. The server scooped almost 18oz into the pint container, i was sooooo happy! I finished more than half (both the peanut butter and sticky chewy chocolate were completely gone). Overall, good ice cream, but wasn't blown away...
author: Jenny Z.

description: I tried a few of the ice creams here and ended up getting the thin mint. The ice cream was solid, but not somewhere I'd go out of my way for. I also tried the turkish coffee, the green tea, and the sticky peanut butter. The green tea and turkish coffee are both quite strong, so if you like those stronger flavors, then definitely check it out.
author: Kavita P.

description: My rental on a recent biz trip was one block from this place...that was the bad part of the trip. I shouldn't be eating incredibly smooth, deeply flavored incredibly good ice cream every evening. But I did. And I was happy. Sticky Gooey Chocolate almost had me come back for another...in the same night. Jump of the cable car in this great Russian Hill icon and enjoy some really good ice cream.
author: Michael S.

description: My son, who is 7 yrs, says "I love your ice cream place!" My daughter, who is 10 years, says 'they are really kind and makes sure everyone is noticed and they have hundreds of flavors and they are all delicious!!" And I simply love this place that I've been going to since I was a child. My favorite flavors are lemon custard and sticky chewy chocolate.
author: rosita t.

description:
This place is delicious, we love the ice cream here!! The sad thing is the parking .. but that is not the ice cream shop's fault,... as it is located in SF, where parking sucks

We love the flavors!!
author: Roland B.

description: Walked up the hill from lunch and had to stop in for an impulse treat. Sticky Peanut Butter was deelish!
author: Jason W.

description:
It doesn't get more awesome than this Russian Hill, San Francisco gem.  A real institution that nails it, and doesn't even try.  Look, they haven't even CLAIMED THEIR BUSINESS!  They make their own ice cream on site.  They don't take credit cards.  They don't have an interior designer.  They don't have a flavorist that advises them on which flavors will be on trend in 18 months.  Forget about social media!  They have none of this, except exceptionally delicious, well aerated and turned ice cream, with the correct flavor load, and density, and ingredients your grandmother will know.  (Sorry, essence of corn, there is no place for you here.)

They have famous flavors like Vanilla, Rocky Road and the like, but pepper it up with peach, lychee, black cherry, oatmeal, etc.  Quick service, and usually packed, but not obnoxiously so.  Clients are happy, excited folks from the neighborhood, kids that grew up that want to take their own kids to a fond place, and professionals exploring Swensen's.  Enjoy it while it lasts, because ice cream tastes better before it melts.
author: A A.

description: If you know me you know I luhh me some ice cream. I use come by this spot when I was in the city all the time. It's cute & old school & you got options girl! I personally like the quality and flavor of the fresh banana ice cream & haven't tried anything else YET... but I will when I am ever back in the area.
author: Roxanne A.

description:
i was craving ice cream, so i decided to order a small double with black raspberry marble and green tea. you're probably thinking that those two flavors are a strange combination, but not for me! i absolutely love green tea and anything berry flavored. the black raspberry marble was really delicious and sweet! the black raspberry syrup was the "cherry on top" of the ice cream for me! the green tea ice cream was really good too.

notes: cash only! they don't allow for two flavors for a single scoop (other ice cream shops do). the ice cream here is kind of expensive, but it's worth it for the quality. if you like old school ice cream parlors, then this is the spot for you!
author: Sylvia H.

description:
This place is a gem! Located just 2 blocks down from the top of the famous Lombard Street, this ice cream parlor has some of the freshest ice cream I have ever tasted! Check this place out after the long climb up Lombard street! This place is CASH ONLY, so be ready for that. 

The ice cream is so fresh and the building has such a nostalgic feel! Prices are great! Quality is better! I love this place!
author: Mitchell B.

description:
Black marble raspberry and vanilla custard are delicious! Unfortunately no real fruit in the black marble raspberry. Lots of flavors and the owner has a big sense of humor which is a plus! The small sizes are more than enough for me. 

Cash only! This place is cheaper compared with other known ice cream establishments. Ice cream was definitely good however my favorite ice cream joint in SF lies with Bi-rite creamery!
author: Susan M.

description: Best ice cream in The city ! I love the orange Swiss flavor Reminds me of the holidays. Very rich!
author: Victoria G.

description:
Seriously, who doesn't like ice cream?  What better and more strategically placed shop to get some ice cream other than Swensen's?  I didn't see anywhere else and I wasn't about to keep looking after walking close to 10 miles around town up and down hills so this was the place.

Swensen's has a bunch of options to choose from so it took me a few minutes and some advice to make a choice but I ultimately landed on 8 ounce ($5.95) of the "Sticky Peanut Butter" and "Turkish Coffee".  I feel that I chose wisely.  Both were delicious but I definitely favored the Turkish Coffee. 

Not much to say other than that. It's ice cream and it's good ice cream.  You're pretty hard-pressed to be disappointed by anything they have here but hey, anything's possible, just highly unlikely.
author: Jeff S.

description:
The ice cream is good quality - smooth, not too sweet, locally made. Good amount of flavors to choose from. Mainly the classics so you won't necessarily get any of the different or unique flavors here. I got the peppermint ice cream and it had the right amount of mintiness. 

Its pretty small inside and definitely no sitting room. You'll probably have to stand outside or walk the hilly streets of SF (probably less regret that way). Service was good - allowed us to try a few flavors. 

Based on the reviews, I expected greatness. Don't get me wrong, it is good ice cream but no different than your local/average ice cream shop. I personally wouldn't go out of my way to come here. If you're in the area and want dessert, its a good place to stop by.
author: Krishna S.

description: Great ice cream from days gone by.  If one wants to talk about making America great again, look no further.  We are not talking about turning back the clock on all of the advancements we have made in terms of race, gender, the environment, etc.  We are talking about great ice cream served by friendly people.  I had the Turkish Coffee cone.  Spectacular!
author: Derald C.

description: Old school ice cream parlour minus the table and chairs. I grew up at this ice cream shop and still visit to this day. My fav flavor is Lemon Custard (it's back after a short but long disappearance) along with peppermint stick, Turkish coffee, thin mint. No major designer flavors or gastronomical delights just old fashion ice cream. A local and tourist favorite. This is the original store that opened in 1948 so visit and partake in this iconic and local FAV.
author: David H.

description:
Old school ice cream shop w/ mostly traditional flavors. Prices are cheaper than most ice cream shops these days w/ a small being $3.75.

Had the Thin Mint and it had no mint flavor despite the fact that I was constantly scooping up chunks of mint. Really bland.
author: Julie L.

description: Omg the flavors really come through! We tried a bunch of the flavors and finally ended up getting a single serve of the Swiss orange and a single serve of the cookies and cream, in a waffle cone and chocolate dipped the ice cream. So much good stuff. At $11 in all.. the perfect end to the weekend.
author: Louisa D.

description:
Feels like an old fashioned ice cream parlor. There's no seating in Swensen's but the area is nice to walk around. Stopped by on a Friday night and there was no wait and the service was very quick. 

Got the single scoop of cookies and cream in a sugar cone for about $4. I love that there were entire chunks of Oreo in it. My boyfriend got the double scoop of thin mint (mint chocolate chip) and sticky peanut butter. It was all so creamy and delicious! Some of the best ice cream we've ever had!

Apparently if a red star gets printed on your receipt randomly you get $5 back from your order! That happened to us and it was a nice surprise!
author: Linda X.

description:
I know hipsters will disagree but Swensen's Sticky Peanut Butter ice cream is the best!

Definitely worth the drive; cash only.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Whenever I am in The City, I always try to make it to Swensens. I mean, what can I say, ice cream is one of my favorite treats and Swensens is one of the best! This is a cute little shop that has an old time feel to it. The service is always top notch. They are very polite and sweet to fit the theme. 10/10. 

Now the ice cream. They have so many flavors! Each one I have tried is amazing, but I always get the cookies and creme because... well you can't beat a classic. Also, please do yourself a favor and for a couple extra cents, get it chocolate dipped. It elevates the experience that much further, and once I tried it, I will never go back to just naked ice cream. That girl needs a dress so she can be beautiful.
author: Kiara C.

description: Solid basic flavors. Not as thick or creamy as salt and straw or Hagar daz. Cash only.
author: S W.

description: I looooove Swensen's ice cream. It is such an adorable ice cream spot in a really cute neighborhood. I love everything about it. I had thin mint and caramel turtle fudge in a waffle cone - I wish I asked to have thin mint as the first scoop and caramel turtle fudge second. Caramel turtle fudge is very sweet and rich and thin mint has a really clean, refreshing flavor with really little chocolate chips - so good. I would definitely come back.
author: Valerie L.

description: Delish ice cream, but don't plan on staying to eat it. The inside is very small and no room for seating. The waffle cone is worth the extra dollar. Tried the mocha chip and was not disappointed. Cash only.
author: Bianca H.

description:
A MUST-TRY near Fisherman's Wharf!!! You will need climb a few giant hills....but totally worth it!!! 

FOOD: I got a single (4oz) of sticky chewy chocolate, which came on a waffle cone for $3.75, and I enjoyed every lick of it. The ice cream was VERY CREAMY and the chocolate flavor was very thick, unlike other ice cream places where the flavors are more watered down. The serving size was HUGE too - it was as HUGE scoop and it was seriously GOOD.

SERVICE: The staff didn't seem too enthusiastic to be there, even though they gave me sample flavors. However, the owner, who is this middle-aged Asian male, was. He seemed pretty cool and joked around with me. 

SETTING: If you are coming by muni, it's most likely that you'll be climbing a FEW GIANT HILLS before you get here. BUT WORRY NOT. It's totally worth it. One downside is that there is no places to sit in the shop, which is fine since there are many things to see in the area, so why not just take a stroll? 

PRICE: Giant serving for less than $4 with a waffle cone?? Great pricing in SF!!! Other places I've been to usually charge more than $4 for this amount. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: I like my chocolate ice cream to be very chocolatey and they did it! Coming back again to try their other flavors.
author: Wendy F.

description: Swensen's is still the #1. Great place for an afternoon treat. Will certainly be back again.
author: Paul E.

description: Solid ice cream place! The inside is older which gives the feel of an old I've cream parlor. Sundae was V good and in our favorite part of the city! The employees weren't super nice and cordial but the ice cream was good.
author: Susannah H.

description: I don't like the service especially because they don't accept cards only cash, had to go across the street to get cash paid. Overrated on the reviews and the ice cream didn't like none of it, the kitchen was dirty and the employees were so rude.
author: Landy K.

description:
While I loved their toasted almond scoop in a cup I just don't see the fascination overall.  Yes.  It's supposedly all made on premises & it did taste great, but not sure it's worth $3.75/scoop.  The shop is in a very prime location being on a busy corner on Hyde St. just in front of the cable car stop so it gets loads of traffic.  We spied the ice cream shop from diagonally where we sat at Zarzuela.  The shop had continuous queues.  Even many Zarzuela patrons (including us) crossed the street after dinner to get ice cream.

I know I can get a cheap quart of Safeway ice cream for way less than a scoop of Swensen's; and more strangely Safeway ice cream these days tastes quite excellent.  But since the shop was there & we just had to join the queue and see what all of the fuss was about.  Consider it a 'been there/done that' type of outing.
author: Luisa T.

description: This is the best ice cream I have EVER had I've gone here multiple times and every flavor is phenomenal! I would recommend to anyone who is in the SF area
author: Cali S.

description:
I tried ice cream from Bi-rite, Humphry Slocombe, and Swensen's on my recent visit to SF, and Swensen's was hands down my favorite. All these ice cream shops offer different types of flavors, so it may depend on what kind of flavor you're looking for. Swenson's has classic flavors as well as some unique flavors but overall seems like a place for simple old-fashioned ice cream. Cash only!

I sampled the mint and black marble raspberry here and the black marble raspberry won me over. It had the perfect texture of just enough cream, but not too creamy that it would melt fast. I could taste the dark chocolate with raspberry. Neither was underwhelming, nor overwhelming. I like how they offer different size waffle cones so you get to enjoy it in a cone, whether you want a mini one or huge one. I'm drooling just thinking about it.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
The ice cream was alright 
Not worth $7 for like 2 scoops 
And The workers didn't have the best customer service
author: Marcus J.

description:
Great place come on in!! No, I'm not a dentist looking to fill your cavities from this place and profit - I just think you would enjoy the vibe here.

Well this is a popular spot - lots of tourists and regular locals from what I can tell. Sugar and fat - popular appeal... no wonder.

Its the kind of place to go after dinner when you still are not ready to return to your home. 

Now in May things are heating up. Its no wonder this place is happening. 

Like I said come on in. Good for your taste buds, your dentist, and the economy.
author: Stefan T.

description: Incredible old school ice cream. Excellent selection of flavors. If you're like me, it will remind you of your childhood favorites. Definitely a great spot for dessert!
author: Justin J.

description: The sticky chewy chocolate was really good, especially for the price.  The lemon custard was also pretty good, though it was a little on the tart side.  The staff was also very friendly and the overall vibe of the place was welcoming despite the cramped size of the shop.
author: Tiare M.

description: A true San Francisco gem.  Cash only and well worth the sacrifice of finding parking.  Strawberry is delicious and banana ice cream- heaven.
author: Regeena E.

description:
CASH ONLY, but I never seem to have cash when passing by Swenson's until now. 

They have the widest range of options (20 + flavors). Even green tea flavored ice cream!! This isn't even in Chinatown! All other flavors I've tried so far were good: Rocky Road, Coconut, Mint Chip, Coffee, Toasted Almond.

The pricing is strange, so the pint is probably the best bang for your buck and gives twice as much as a single or double scoop for maybe 70 cents more.They let you choose multiple flavors for the pint sized tub, which is just really awesome.
author: Shelley C.

description:
Saw a sign tonight saying they're open on Mondays now- great news for those of you like me & crave icecream every day of the week!
This icecream is GOOD. I love the peppermint stick flavor because it reminds me of when I was a kid and would eat peppermint icecream around Christmas time. 
It is cash only as others have mentioned, so don't forget! No seating inside either; definitely a grab and go place. Take it to go and stroll down Hyde, Polk, or Union.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Delicious local ice cream! 

This place is a great gem. The ice cream is handmade and the staff are friendly. They carry the usual flavors but my favorites are green tea and lychee. Lychee is a flavor that I can't buy in stores and here, it's a great balance of creaminess and fruitiness. The green tea has a strong tea flavor that a lot of store bought versions mask with sugar. Everything is rich and delightful!
author: Tina Y.

description: It's really the ambiance of this long time running ice cream shop that makes the experience (a date spot in tales of the city!). Ice cream is pretty traditional in texture and flavor- which can refreshing among all the shops pushing flavor profiles to the edge.
author: J K.

description: Swensen's has been my favorite ice cream shop since 1992.  Extremely rich and creamy flavors.
author: Rahim R.

description: Oh my gosh, the ice cream here is great! I got the caramel marble one and it was just dripping in caramelly goodness. Yummm. It's creamy without being too thick. The flavor is strong, which I love. I am not usually a fan of ice cream, but Swensen's is great. No wonder the line is ridiculously long and people pound on the glass once it's closed LOL
author: Jenn T.

description:
This place is adorable and delicious.  In the middle of a residential area.  Parking was pretty competitive, good thing we didn't come at a "getting-off-work" time.  We walked in and there was a huge group of people.  I thought we would have to wait forever, but they told us they were all ordering together and to go ahead ... our lucky day!! 
Again... wanting to order like 10 things and needing to limit to 2 is not my strong suit.  They didn't seem to offer samples so that made it even harder. It's such a commitment without even trying the flavor to make it 50% of your order!  Ugh...  I can't even recall what I got.  I'm not a chocolate fan.  I think I got like a pecan and wanted the green tea but ended up with something I know I liked less than I would have liked green tea.
This place has clearly been around forever and should continue to be.  Prices were not bad.
author: Kelley S.

description:
SWISS ORANGE CHIP ... I can't live without you. I've been going here since I was a kid. No one does the SOC like Swenson's. The tangy orange (actual orange peel flavor) and the dark chocolate mini CHIPS... like real MINI CHIPS. We call em 'seeds. And they are not damn flecks or crumbs of chocolate. Dreyers and Fentons used to have the seed style choco chip but stopped doing that many many years ago. Three Twins is doing a similar flavor called Chocolate Orange Confetti (confetti meaning itsy bitsy flecks of chocolate). 

All pale in comparison to my beloved first love Swiss Orange Chip. I heart you SOC.

Keep doing what you are doing Swesons on Hyde forever and ever.
author: A L.

description:
Even though I've lived in the city all my life , this is my first time ever going to swensens. It's quite a trek from boboquivaris but it was worth it. 

Tried the cookies and cream and thin mint ice cream. For a small double it was a pretty generous portion. The cookies and cream was definitely delicious, ample cookie chunks and the vanilla ice cream was delicious! Thin mint was ok for me. I was expecting a bit more mint flavor but it was good, but I did have a overload of mint chocolate. It got to be a bit much as I kept eating. 

Overall, it's a nice little ice cream shop, if I'm in the area again I would stop by for some more ice cream!
author: Stella J.

description:
Atmosphere: this place is small! Don't expect to sit and eat your treat. Instead, get your cup or cone and take a walk around the lovely neighborhoods.

Service: friendly and quick. They do work fast because the line can build up quickly, but you won't be waiting long.

Ice cream: I tried the mango and black raspberry marble. So creamy and delightful--you can easily see why this is different from grocery store ice cream and why they're so popular. I can't wait to try more flavors.
author: Susan G.

description: This place was excellent! I loved the old-timey vibe and the ice cream was delicious! We ordered the green tea and sticky peanut butter flavors (chocolate with peanut butter swirls). Will definitely be back.
author: Danielle P.

description:
I've been enjoying Swensen's ice cream since I was a kid. Way back in the 80's, there were Swensen's everywhere - I read that at their peak, there were over 400 stores. However, the founder always kept control over the original store on Hyde street, and it was always a lot better than the franchises. Now, all the of the franchises are long gone, except for a bunch of locations in Asia, but the Hyde street location keeps chugging on, with virtually nothing changed (except for the prices) since I was a kid. 

I love chocolate ice cream, and Swensen's Sticky Chewy Chocolate is the best. It tastes exactly as the name, and it's definitely worth the steep hike up Russian Hill for a scoop.
author: Allen T.

description:
I felt like one of the many tourists standing in line to try this place.

My brother and I sadly concluded that it tasted like overpriced carton ice cream, with a 20 minute wait on a hot day.

I had the coffee ice cream and fresh banana ice cream sundae. I asked for very little whipped cream, and no cherry.

Instead I got EXTRA whipped cream, and I think she topped it off with a cherry just to piss me off.

My brother had the mint chocolate chip ice cream. He said it tasted like a cheap breath mint.

And that's not a compliment.

I guess I'm giving this place 3 stars because it's apparently homemade.

But homemade doesn't necessarily equal good.
author: Jack R.

description:
This is the ice cream shop on this side of the 7x7.
Is it better than Bi-Rite or Mitchell's or Humphry Slocombe or Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous?  Not necessarily.  But it is an institution in its own right, & comparing them is like comparing apples to oranges.

This is the very first Swensen's, the original.  It's smaller than a studio apartment in SF.  Yes, this is an exaggeration, but only a mild one.  It's tiny.  

Nothing fancy, no frills.  All the staple flavors, w a few twists, like cantaloupe or reversible chocolate (?!).  Being a coffee fan, the Turkish coffee intrigued me.  That got me wondering, why do I never see Vietnamese coffee ice cream anywhere?  And I also noted the vanilla custard.  I'm not a vanilla person, but I love custard.  It's on my list now.  They also are current w the times; there's green tea too.  I love all things green tea. 

We ordered a thin mint milk shake to share.  Of course it was good, & it took me back to having Shamrock shakes as a kid.  Memories.

I hadn't been here in several years.  But I was greeted w a smile, a nod, & a greeting from one of the staff as soon as I walked in.  Nice.

Totally solid.

3 1/2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Such a cute place for date night. So many great options around for dinner. This place is nostalgic and super cute. I'd say pick a date night somewhere close by, and walk here after. The ice creams are super creamy and flavorful. 

I ordered the coconut and the bf ordered the coffee. I'd definitely get the coffee next time. Talk about burst of flavor!! Yum. Definitely a fan.
author: Marlene T.

description:
Swenson's is an old-fashioned ice cream parlor, perched on a corner in Russian Hill, that's been around for generations. They're a great neighborhood staple with classic ice cream flavors and signature ones as well, including Swiss Orange Chip and Sticky Chewy Chocolate. My personal favorites are Turkish Coffee and Bordeaux Cherry. The ice cream is smooth and creamy and...good, but overall I'm not really too impressed. I feel like I could get the same quality with Haagen Daaz. I might just be spoiled with the likes of Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe, and it might be unfair to compare them with a gourmet shop, but when you're paying the same price? I can't help it. One scoop at Swensons is $3.55, which is actually more expensive than Bi-Rite, and you can't even get more than one flavor at Swenson's unless you upgrade to 2 scoops.  

I like the look and feel of the shop and the staff are very friendly and are generous with their samples. What I don't like is they're  a cash only spot and there are no seats or tables where you can eat your treat. No bathroom either. Just a lonely water fountain. Parking is very difficult out here, and with no particularly amazing standout flavors, Swenson's is not a destination spot for me. With that being said though, if I'm in the neighborhood for dinner, I still swing by every once in awhile.
author: Deanna Y.

description:
Two words: mocha chip!

I love going here for a neighborhood treat.
author: Betty W.

description: Peach plus green tea = AWESOME!  One of the best ice cream places in SF, and the employees are cool and helpful.
author: Tom T.

description:
When it comes to ice cream, the servers count - big time.  The whole crew was no energy, no smiles, no fun. This killed any classic, old school vibe. The blame falls on management.

The ice cream itself is solid.
author: XManLA X.

description: Ice cream was so good! Great service. Line goes fast, even for 9pm on a cold windy SF night, there was a line out the door to the curb. Had the cookies and cream and cookie dough ice cream on a plain cone. Waffle cones run out early. Cookies and cream was my favorite flavor. The texture of the ice cream was super creamy- just the way I like it. Keep it up swensens!
author: Linda H.

description:
Oh, Swensen's. I grew up on you, but those were simpler times, when a scoop of chocolate chip cookie dough or even a humble vanilla were enough to keep me satisfied. Now, I've grown up, and San Francisco has changed my taste buds into ones that require only the most fascinating (and over-priced) flavors out there.

Price-wise, this place definitely isn't cheap, despite the fact that most of the flavors are pretty standard. I think it was ~$4 for a single scoop in a sugar cone, which is (even by SF standards) outrageous.

Flavor-wise, our experience fell flat on its face. Nothing was BAD, but nothing was memorable, either.

THIN MINT
Tasted floury/chalky, as I'm guessing they literally ground up thin mint cookies to put in the ice cream. Honestly, my least enjoyable cone in a while, and pretty disappointing. Hardly any flavor.

TURKISH COFFEE
Nothing to write home about, not bad, but pretty average. I've had better versions (Santa Barbara's ice cream company makes a mean one!)

I guess 'average' would be the finishing word for our experience, unfortunately. I'll admit it, my city raised me to be a snob about this sort of thing, but if I'm ordering old favorites, I expect them to at least be good.
author: Claire S.

description: Ordered the chewy chocolate single scoop. Nothing out of the ordinary, but good textured and flavoured ice cream. Good assortment of flavours.
author: V T.

description:
In a city where tech is king, and innovation is the name of the game in almost every industry, it's refreshing to have a no-frills, down-home, low-key ice cream parlor like Swensen's. 

They've got a great selection of your basic favorites (mint chocolate chip, cookies & cream, chocolate, etc.), along with milkshakes, sundaes, and pints to go. I'm a big fan of the MCC and the sticky peanut butter, with chocolate jimmies, of course.

Note that Swensen's is cash only. There's an ATM in the market across the street if you're out.
author: Audrey A.

description: This place definitely has the feel of an old school ice cream parlor. A short walk off beaten path for many tourists, this shop offers a large variety of high quality flavors at a good price.
author: Noah P.

description:
During my trek through San Francisco, I found myself outside Swensen's and decided that I needed ice cream. It had a nice old fashion feel and a wide variety of flavors to choose from. I settled on caramel marble and I am thankful that I did. 

Hands down the best use of caramel I have ever had. Is anyone else upset when caramel is way to hard? Or it's basically liquid? Well, Swensen's did it right and every bite was delicious. For anyone looking for some old fashion comfort, look no further.
author: Sarah Z.

description: Ice cream is fine, but several times now the texture has been off and there are large ice crystals. Also cash only is annoying.
author: Robin B.

description: Pretty standard ice cream place- it's not terrible but it won't change your life. I'd place it with Fenton's, Loard's, etc. in terms of types of ice cream places- old-school creameries that do a few things really well. I liked the atmosphere, though it was a little small on the inside. They let you taste multiple types of ice cream, which is nice. Cash only! Keep that in mind.
author: Samir K.

description:
So happy to have found this place in San Francisco. I was so sad when Swensen's closed their SoCal establishments over twenty years ago. 

They had my all time favorite ice cream, Swiss Orange Chocolate Ice Cream! Heaven!!! 

Parking is horrible as you have to find street parking. This original Swensens's is  in a busy neighborhood but the ice cream was worth the hunt for a parking space.
author: Corrine W.

description:
Some of the best ice cream from classic sundaes, floats, malts, splits, waffles to exotic flavors like green tea, lychee etc.. you name it. Ice cream concoctions like no other. The nice staff makes it even better. 

We got the chocolate dipped cookie n' cream and caramel marbled ice cream on a cone. So So GOOD! 

This isnt like the Swenson's ice cream restaurant in Asia with there is table style dining but that doesn't make it any less delicious.
author: Andrew V.

description:
My kid wanted ice cream while we were at Pier 39. It was over 5 dollars for a scoop. All of the nopes in the world went off in my mind and I decided to take him elsewhere. My girlfriend found this place and we decided to give it a shot. The shake I got was awesome (neopolitan ftw), I also tried my girlfriends mango ice cream which was sooooo good, and my kid finished his mint chip in minutes so I guess he liked his enough!

It's a perfect hole in the wall. Reward yourself after climbing Lombard st or make our mistake and do it before Lombard!
author: Matthew J.

description:
Our friends who live in SF highly recommended Swensen, so we all went together to try their ice cream during a weekend. Parking can be a pain, we found a spot after circling around quite a few times.

After sampling a handful of flavors, we settled on Black raspberry marble, Turkish coffee and Caramel turtle fudge. Black raspberry marble was my favorite choice. The others were good, I wasn't over the moon with them.

I'll stop by again when I am in the neighborhood, but wouldn't make a trip just for Swensen. Mitchell and BiRite are still my two favorite choices in the city!
author: Anu M.

description:
CASH ONLY!

Get the hot fudge sundae with french vanilla custard ice cream + toasted almond ice cream. PERFECTION.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Oh sure, I know Swensen's, the international chain that feels like a mom-n-pop spot. It's been on that corner of Hyde and Union on Russian Hill since the Truman years, and the tiny place still has a touch of the old-fashioned parlor about it (photo: http://bit.ly/14EBMfh). Not too surprisingly, it's a magnet for young families on an unusually warm Saturday afternoon. Jamie W. and I were trying unsuccessfully walk off the gigantic pot stickers we gorged on a couple of hours prior at U-Lee (review: http://bit.ly/11V65wk) when we came upon the short line at Swensen's. An ice cream cone felt like the right thing at the wrong time, which is fine by me since two wrongs don't make a right anyway.

Paralyzed by the number of flavors on the overhead menu, I impulsively ordered a $4.50 Double Cone of Peppermint Twist and Turkish Coffee (photo: http://bit.ly/11V5RVZ). The peppermint took me back to those golden days of my early childhood in San Mateo when I pulled at my mom's pocketbook at Shaw's on El Camino to get her to buy me a peppermint cone. Now I pull on Jamie's shirt to get his permission to imbibe more calories, dairy no less, and I still get that glare of disapproval that I got from my mom followed by the inevitability of the cone. Must be my charm. Anyway it hit the spot, and I had no problem licking it on the street and letting it drip on the sidewalk. How old am I? Oh who cares.

ICE CREAM - 4 stars...old-fashioned creamy goodness on Russian Hill (photo: http://bit.ly/1271mqc)
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...tiny spot, no seats but still very Eisenhower-era
SERVICE - 3 stars...they scoop 'em with no fuss
TOTAL - 4 stars...ice cream before it got all organic and eclectic
author: Ed U.

description: Ehhhh. I wasn't super impressed, despite the allure of the line out the door and the old-schoolness of this joint. My peppermint ice cream tasted alright, but I could compare it to the Dreyer's I can get at Safeway. The boyfriend got peach and couldn't even finish the entire thing. This is probably mostly due to his inability to choose ice cream flavors, but I think good ice cream parlors have the power to make anything taste good (olive oil ice cream at Humphrey Slocombe, anyone??). The prices are decent, but it's cash only. Count your change - if I hadn't, I'd be short a dollar.
author: Sophie W.

description: I was really looking forward to coming here based on all the raving reviews on Yelp, but I found the ice cream pretty underwhelming. The flavors that I tried were really bland and the consistency of the ice cream was pretty icy. I settled for the green tea flavor since I couldn't choose one that I liked and I felt bad for trying so many flavors. I ended up tossing it right after I left the shop :(
author: Jillian L.

description:
Upon entering, a lady walked out saying 'i'm usually not one to go for chocolate, but this flavor is out of this world!' And out of this world it was! The sticky chewy chocolate was sooo rich and creamy, and definitely had a 'chewy' aspect to it, almost like that of fudge. This flavor is definitely for those chocoholics and brownie-holics out there, but maaay be a bit too sweet for others! I indulged and got that flavor would the thin mints flavor which went nicely with the chocolate. I wish the thin mint had more of the chocolate texture of the cookie instead of just chocolate chips, but the flavor was pretty good. 

**Cash only!
author: Kim D.

description:
When you walk into the Swenson's shop, you become a kid again. This is the cutest old-fashioned ice cream shop that has thankfully survived to serve generations of neighborhood San Franciscans and visitors. Besides that, who wouldn't drool over the list of the classic American ice cream flavors?
Today when I swung by the shop, there was a line out of the door. A big family of 5 were each ordering walk away sundaes in waffle cones. Mmmm, they looked so good!
I do think the two best flavors are Sticky Chewy Chocolate (very rich and chocolate mousse-like) and Mocha Chip (more chips than your average bear).
