During the holidays, they have classic flavors like Egg Nog and Spumoni. Fast forward to the 21st century and now they have Green Tea and even Sugar free ice cream. 
With the sun beating down in hot waves and an ice cream cone in hand, I have to smile. Life is good.
author: Joanna T.

description: This place really gives you value! The ice cream was so cheap! It only came out to be three dollars and something . The ice cream is a little more of a icy texture but full of flavor. We ordered the mocha chip.
author: Joling S.

description:
I don't get it.  It tastes like old fashioned ice cream but not as good. 
The flavors have weird aftertastes and the texture is a bit grainy. 

I got the banana and it has a similar artificial taste like the banana now-and-laters or the Korean banana milk drink. But the aftertaste was horrible. I also thought it was a bit grainy in texture.
author: Heejin L.

description: Not a huge fan of the establishment itself, seemed kind of untidy and unclean, but the ice cream itself was top notch. Huge variety of flavors to choose from and each one is incredibly creamy and flavorful, very rich tasting. I've had Lychee, Coconut, Green Tea, & Lemon Custard. Each one was spectacular.
author: Danielle F.

description:
Some of the best peanut butter ice cream in the city. Super creamy and not overly sweet. 

** They only take cash.
author: Emily E.

description:
Cash only :(

Love their ice cream and traditional flavors. The older man working there always jokes with me too. Usually I leave with a smile on my face and a giant ice cream in hand.
author: Martina M.

description: It's a bit of a hole in the wall, but the ice cream at Swensen's is delicious. No frills, fancy flavors, or gourmet toppings, just good old fashioned creamy deliciousness.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Hoofing between old haunts on my umpteenth San Francisco visit, I'd become weary and in need of a lift. Suddenly, a Swensen's apparition appeared! That vision drove me onward and upward over Russian Hill. The option board blurred before me after finally arriving but I did recall the French vanilla had been just a touch "sour" last time, and opted for just the vanilla vanilla (and one other). Mission accomplished! Vitality restored! (But NO strawberry??) Quintessential San Francisco.
author: Bruce B.

description:
This place is a classic for a reason. I combined the coffee and caramel flavors. Smooth, rich, and creamy and full of flavor. I walked from downtown to the golden gate bridge, and the two scoops from here gave helped power me through the journey. 
Make sure you have cash, though, a couple of customers were unprepared and missed out on some good ice cream.
author: Omar J.

description: The best cookies and cream! Most flavors are really good and not too sweet. Customer service is fantastic. There was a lady who helped me looks like she's new. While the lady fills up my to go container the older asian guy came in and put a lot more ice cream to the point that it won't close anymore. hope there could be an easier parking spot. But that does not affect the review.
author: Quelle O.

description: BEST IN THE CITY WITHOUT A DOUBT. I went on an ice cream tour this summer and this was by far my favorite place. Great mix of unique and classic flavors. Super friendly staff. Just so amazing overall. I got raspberry marble (WOW) and the citrus orange chip (AMAZING) and have not stopped thinking about it. GO HERE
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
We stumbled across Swensen's while making our way to Saint Frank's Coffee shop - which rocked. So we hit Swenson's on the way back... It rocked!

We had a 2-Scoop cup: Chewy, Sticky Chocolate & Turkish Coffee. They both live up to the hype... Skip Giardelli's, it's a complete tourist deal Go to Swensen's corner ice cream shop of bygone era... With house made ice cream.
author: Eric B.

description: ice cream was sooo good! it was well worth the uber ride in the rain. I got the rocky road and now I wish i got 2 scoops! I still crave it and now that I am going to san francisco in a few week, we will definitely be going again!
author: Taylor T.

description:
No frills ice cream shop. Solid if you like classic flavors, but I personally prefer quirkier flavors.

I tried the pumpkin, caramel marble, and Turkish coffee. They were all good, but I went with the caramel marble.

Cash only!
author: Lucy N.

description: Love this little shop. Not overly priced and lots of unique flavors. My favorite is Swiss Orange Chip. Who would have thought, citrus and orange. Yum!!
author: timothy l.

description:
Meh nothing special by any means. It was nice that the cookies and cream had actual cookie bits in it, but that's the most exciting thing about their ice cream. 
Cash only as well, which is a bit of a hassle.
author: Jenn T.

description:
For some reason I thought this was another branch to Mitchell's, but boy was I wrong. 

I'm a huge ice cream lover, so I really enjoyed what this place has to offer. I think there are better alternates in the SF area, but if you happen to be in the area and have a hankering for some ice cream, then by all means come and try this place out. 

You won't regret it. Lots of flavors too. More than even the colors of the rainbow!
author: Benny H.

description:
I came in with very high expectations due to the reviews and sadly was disappointed. I got thin mint and mocha fudge. Both tasted like pretty bland store bought quality. The mint wasn't with thin mints but bland chocolate pieces and the mocha had no chocolate or fudge to just super extreme coffee taste.
Wasn't my best icecream experience at all.
author: Tayla H.

description: For a well known ice cream parlor, the customer service is embarrassing. My sister and I traveled to Swensen's and arrived at 10:01pm. The door was open and the OPEN sign was hung in the door. We entered only to be greeted by a very rude employee who told us that the ice cream scoops had already been put away. We politely asked for any opportunity to be served and we're quickly dismissed without any apology. Very disappointed.
author: Jenna M.

description: Oh ice cream...so smooth, so cold, so flavorful, so delicate, so creamy, so sweet, so rich, so unapologetic, so real! Ladies and gentlemen, you, my friends, are doing it right! It only took one little sample of this outstanding incredible fluffy frozen milk, eggs and sugar to get me in your floating gondola in ice cream heaven. I am a believer. And I will always return. It feels like coming home. If YOU want to treat yourself, or even better, others, THIS is the place to go! Don't be shy, have at it!
author: Kevin G.

description: Been a while since I been to Swensen's.  I was happy that they still have this place.  My wife and I decided to go and get ice cream here.  Its not a big place and its only big enough to buy ice cream.  My wife got green tea ice cream and I got the crisp orange chip and caramel turtle fudge.  It all was nice, cool and refreshing.  It was great to have ice cream on a warm day.
author: Albert K.

description:
Great ice cream joint for no egg ice cream flavors.

Tip: they accept only cash.
Park at the 10 min parking spot on the busy main road just for swenson customers.How cool is that?

Try unique flavors like chocolate orange,blackberry strawberry marble,etc
I also took some ice cream cones to go.
author: Priyanka L.

description: Worth the walk on those Cali hills for this place!!!  Caramel turtle ice cream was amazing!
author: Avani S.

description:
Small little ice cream shop but great flavor selection and good taste. Got mango and the sticky chocolate. Both were creamy with great flavor. About $5.15 for a double scoop cup.

On a corner with no parking except what's on the street outside. Came late on a Sat night and wasn't a problem but can see how it could be tough at most times. Still easier to get to though and with a shorter line than Bi-Rite ice cream.

Cash only.
author: Joey L.

description: Old school traditional ice cream shop with the best peanut butter chocolate ice cream. Even the sprinkles seem like their homemade. Please open one in the marina so we can get away from all of these trendy ice cream of fro yo places!
author: Claire V.

description:
I hate saying 'Meh' in my reviews but there is no other way to describe Swensen's. Yes, it is old fashioned ice cream. Yes, it is a very old SF institution. Yes, they have popularity and brand name going for them. No, they are not even close to the best ice cream in the city. Nor are they even in my top 5.

Based on the highlights I felt obligated to order the chewy sticky chocolate as well as the turkish coffee. Neither were anything special. I also got to try the mango, lychee and toasted almond. Of all of these the only one which I felt was above average was the toasted almond because it actually had some almond in the ice cream itself. 

Overall, at best this place might be 6th on the totem pole of ice cream shops in SF, although I suspect I might be forgetting about more that would be above it. "I've experienced better."
author: Mark O.

description: After a cable car passed me by (even though I was waiving for them to hop on) I saw this place and had a vanilla cone. There was no line with a few people  posing and taking photos outside. Must be a famous place, I figured. It is a no-nonsense ice cream parlor and I liked the clean, traditional taste. Feel great as if I made a huge discovery! Thank you universe!
author: Lauren P.

description:
Do I look like a vanilla girl to you?!!  Everyone who knows me most certainly knows I'm not.  However, Swensen's got me going for French vanilla custard.  I sampled the Thin Mint & the French vanilla custard.  The Thin Mint was too faint for me, but the custard was perfect with its creamy consistency and strong vanilla taste.  I'll admit it though, I was jealous of him because he had cookies and cream..and this is probably the best cookies and cream that I've ever had.  It's flavorful and got big chunks of Oreo cookies.  My friend loved her strawberry ice.  I'm so happy she suggested this place to us because I would have never known about it.  She said Swensen's was as good as she remembered it to be when she was a kid.  

It's not Bi-Rite, but they make all of their ice creams on site, prices are fair and they have good tried and true flavors.  We did make a trek from Dogpatch to come here for ice cream, but I wouldn't mind coming back for another scoop next time I'm in the area.
author: Cat C.

description:
Good Ice Cream

Based on the reviews, I thought I was going to come away amazed.  I wasn't.  Don't get me wrong.  They do make good ice cream.  However, it is not among the best I've ever had.
author: Ted Q.

description:
Way back, when my wedding & reception dresses were being made ( at Atelier des Modistes http://www.yelp.com/biz/atelier-des-modistes-san-francisco?hrid=RgmiJ9fxeXGr-OIP3lTcwQ#src:self ), we found ourselves on a sunny afternoon, arriving to the neighborhood a bit too early for my fitting appt... but luckily Swensen's Ice Cream was right up the block!

I must admit that I only had small tastes of these delish orbs of creamy goodness - as I had dresses to fit into - but the Mr was thankful for the extra helpings

Our choices were Sticky Chewy Chocolate & Toasted Almond

Chocolate was dense & chocolaty & hit a high note for sure - but the Mr particularly loved the Toasted Almond.  He's a sucker for all the nut ice creams & thought this one had a nice almondy flavor & the perfect ratio of crunchy nuts

This isn't any Mitchell's by any means but for a refreshing stopover, it was very nice.  One might even say A-OK

Best Tip - if you go mid-afternoon, you want to make sure to get there *before* the schools let out!  We got there right before the hordes of monsters descended... lucky us!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Swenson's is comforting.  It's like waking up in the morning throwing on your robe and grabbing the morning paper while your coffee pot automatically starts dripping.  It's the smell of warm fires in Autumn and Winter.  It's the cold cone of ice cream on a Summer's day.  No really, it is.

Swenson's has been scooping out sweet cream of ice since 1948 and it hasn't changed a bit.  The flavors are always constant yet a few change here and there keep the crowds guessing and coming back for more.

Although I haven't frequented Swenson's in a while, I take comfort in knowing that it'll be the same yesterday as it is tomorrow.
author: Kevin J.

description: This place is overrated and the chocolate ice cream tasted like burnt milk! Not sure what these reviews are about but we wasted our time ubering here! Disappointed
author: Rana H.

description: Not bad. Got a waffle sundae with mocha chip (okay) and chocolate (very good), topped with whipped cream nuts hot fudge and a cherry. Not any better than you'd get at a Baskin & Robbins or Ben & Jerry's but a cute tourist-y stop.
author: Steven C.

description: Don't have much new to add that others haven't ably summarised.  We came here on a Thursday night, fortunately there wasn't a line.  $3.75 per cup. Many flavours although Rabia wasn't able to enjoy as they only had one non dairy flavour.  I had sticky chocolate, which was good but not great.  Rest of family enjoyed strawberry, cookies n cream and mango.
author: Iftikhar K.

description:
Soooooo goooood.

Got a cookies and cream shake and it was perfect.
author: Caroline C.

description:
So now for me it's all about the salted caramel at Bi Rite, but I have incredible nostalgia for the sticky chewy chocolate I had here as a little kid.

Fast forward a few decades later and I brought my own little girl...watching her chow down on the same flavor. and trying it again myself and realizing I still loved it just as much was awesome!!!
author: Laura C.

description: Don't be fooled by the old school ice cream parlour vibe cause Swensen's has some pretty amazing ice cream. My favorite flavor is their strawberry and it actually has fruit chunks inside it. If you order a pint or more, you can go half and half have the ice cream stacked side-by-side to get the best of both worlds.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I like to call myself quite the ice critique, I have worked at bi-rite after all. This hidden gem is one of my new favorites, just sucks getting to it! 
They have TONS of exotic flavors from pineapple sherbert (fave) to vanilla bean custard. And their cones are delicious too!
Everything is in house and the workers are so shy and efficient. A great lil mom and pop ice cream shop.
author: Emma G.

description:
I always love checking out local ice cream shops whenever I visit different towns or cities. According to other Yelp reviewers it appears Swensen's was the place to go.

In comparison to the large "Swensen's" sign outside the corner shop, the inside of the ice cream parlor is relatively small. Standing room only and even more than 5 people will feel like sardines inside the cramped area. There are not any tables or chairs inside or outside of the shop so be prepared to enjoy your treat in your feet.

The sticky chocolate is as describes, it is sticky and chocolaty. Kinda makes you wonder what it does to your insides but regardless it is a delicious ice cream. I had that mixed with a banana ice cream on a cone. Easy to say I was in hog heaven. 

Parking can be tricky in SF and parking near Swensen's is no exception. I say huff it if you can otherwise plan to walk from your car to the shop. Be sure to have cash in hand as well because Swensen's is such a throwback that they don't even take credit cards.
author: Stan W.

description:
I love this place. I'm not even a huge mint chip fan (no chocolate usually for me), but the mint chip here is delightful. I went here with a friend in our journey to taste all the best ice creams in the bay, and it was a really nice way to spend an afternoon, because after we grabbed our ice cream, we walked around Russian Hill a bit, and it was the perfect summery day.

I might even like this place more than Bi-Rite, but its a very different feel. They have some exotic flavors (Turkish coffee), but they're really more of a traditional shop than bi-rite is.

Cash only though.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
Came here because 

1. Our son wanted ice cream 
2. We were driving in the area
3. This place has 4.5 stars

The place is small, no where to sit and barely any room to stand in line. I was surprised by the menu because it had a lot of different flavors to choose from. A very nice selection (vanilla, cookies 'n cream, strawberry, mint, lychee, etc.) we couldn't make up our minds so I asked to try a sample of the strawberry for our son. The man who was serving us gave him a nice size sample including strawberry chunks. 

Although the man was nice to us, he was a bit rude towards the staff. I couldn't figure if he was the owner or manager of the store, but he was yelling at them like he was. One of the employees already helped everyone in front of me but I guess the man didn't know, started yelling at him to help customers. The second time, he yelled at another employee for cleaning the surface wrong and how it's smudging all over. I looked at the employee faces and I felt horrible. The whole thing made me uncomfortable and felt like no one should be talked down on like that esp in front of customers.

Other than that, this place had delicious ice cream. I had the cookies 'n cream, he gave me a lot of cookies in my small cup! It was sooo good! My boyfriend had the hot fudge Sunday with vanilla, whip cream, nuts and cherry on top, he said it was really good. Our son finished his strawberry ice cream and loved it! I'm glad we stumbled here.
author: Yee W.

description:
Delicious.  Oh my gosh.  Absolutely love this place - it's dangerous that it's only one block up the hill from my apartment (yikes!).  

My husband and I typically grab a quart of our favorite flavors to have on hand at all times :)  Our favorite flavors (that we've tried) thus far are as follows:

Sticky Chocolate (so rich, so chocolately, and yes as the name suggests - "sticky" - for all chocolate lovers, you will NOT be disappointed)

Cookies & Creme - oh my gosh, this may just be my favorite.  Talk about cookie-loaded!  I swear, my last batch had more cookies than ice cream.  It was to die for.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough - like the Cookies & Creme, this ice cream was totally loaded with little dough balls.  SO good.

Mint Chocolate Chip - a "go-to" for my husband and me.  This mint chip is one of the best we have ever tried.  I love the consistency (and amount!) of the chocolate chips; the mint flavor is spot on as well.  Delish.

If you haven't been to Swensen's yet, get your butt over to Russian Hill and give it a whirl.  Maybe go to Zarzuela, a highly recommended Spanish tapas restaurant, that's right across the block from Swensen's.  Mmm, tapas and ice cream - I know what I'm doing Saturday night!!!
author: Rachael S.

description: Great ice cream!  The staff is super friendly and helpful.  Calvin is an ice cream pro.
author: Troy J.

description:
CASH ONLY!  Today Sun 12/11/11 is the last day for the FREE ice cream scoop from Scoutmob app at Swensen's!  They're open until 10pm tonight!  They're at Hyde & Union.

Went twice this weekend.  Got my Scoutmob deal on Sat 12/10/11 and got the Sticky Chewy Chocolate.  Tasty chocolate ice cream I got on a sugar cone.  I liked it.  There's no seats indoors, so ate the ice cream standing up outside.

Next day went back w/ hubby.  He got me a scoop of Spumoni with his Scoutmob deal, & paid for his scoop of French Vanilla Custard small for $2.95.  It's a lot of ice cream, but tasty enough.  Spumoni is tan w/ dried fruit & some candy pieces throughout.  I liked it.  

There's a single drinking fountain in the shop & pre-packed quart/gallon size in the case behind you when you order.

Tip: Sticky Peanut Butter actually is Chocolate Peanut Butter - I want that next time.

Christmas Special flavors: pumpkin, egg nog, spumoni, rum raisin.

Egg nog drink sold out until 12/16/11 - $4.25 quart.

Bus 45 stops right in front.  We walked, several hills but manageable.

Note: Get a receipt & if it has a Red Star on it, your purchase is FREE up to $5.

Hrs:
Closed Mon
Tues-Th 12-10p
Fri & Sat 12-11p
Sun 12-10p

Closed Thanksgiving 11/24; 12/25 Xmas; 1/1 New Year's Day
Special Store Hrs:
12/24 12-6p
12/31 12-6p
author: Ann L.

description:
Came across this neighborhood gem while strolling around with my boyfriend. It's not a big shop, but big enough that they can offer 20 different ice creams at a time (don't quote me).  I walked in and wanted to try nearly every flavor. And probably asked for 10 samples. The spunky Asian gal behind the counter was very patient and gave me one teeny spoon after another until I finally settled on Toasted Almond. I could've easily gone with 3 other flavors but only wanted a scoop.  Said gal also made the thickest milkshake my bf has ever been satisfied with at an establishment, which made him very happy.

Thanks for the sweet treats and happy bellies Swensen's!
author: Christine Y.

description:
My go-to flavor is always mint chip and theirs (thin mint) did not disappoint! The employees were super nice and were more than willing to let me try whatever flavored I wanted to sample. Still ended up with mint chip. Creamy, perfectly minty and refreshing, good ratio of chocolate chips. Got a small but it wasn't too much of a price difference if you get the single or double scoop. I should have gone for it. Oh well time to go back! 

Make sure you bring cash because it is cash only. You can buy tubs and I wish I wasn't walking around the city because I would have definitely brought some home!
author: Katrina M.

description:
I ordered a pint with two flavors: Sticky Chewy Chocolate and Caramel Turtle Fudge. It hit the spot! Delicious.

When I was young, my mom occasionally took me after school to Swensen's in Vallejo before it closed down so the shop carries nostalgic value. I'm relieved the quality of the ice cream still measures up to the fond memories.

A few  things you must know:

1) Cash only.

2) It's not like the Swensen's ice cream parlor I grew up with in the hometown as there are no seats and tables. You get your order then you go chill outside or go on your way.

3) I think if your receipt randomly prints out with a red star, you get $5 cash back on your order. I don't exactly know the details because I was too busy being excited over unexpectedly getting $5 back. I hit the jackpot!

Enjoy.
author: Michael M.

description: I love their orange chip and Turkish coffee! The lines move quite fast and the servers are friendly. While parking can be a challenge here, I normally get dropped off to get the order and eat it in the way home. Or if you are in the area for dinner, take a nice stroll here to get some ice cream. The shop isn't intended for you to consume the ice cream there.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Woah and I mean woah! This place is heart-stirring yet butt warming. I rolled up on a late Saturday night around 10 o'clock with my friends brad, boston, jackson, thomas, turner and jacksons mom.

They have a thing called a "red star" and if you recieve a "red star" on your receipt then your order is free! When my squad and Jacksons mom rolled up we saw this dude name Trevor who received this award. We were so pumped chanting "TREVOR! TREVOR! TREVOR!" During all this outragous activity, I looked over and noticed the sorrow in Jacksons moms eyes. I approached her and said "what's wrong?" While tears came to her face she told the story of how she has never once recieved a "red star" and how close she was to getting one.

Anyways the ice cream was good.
author: Grant N.

description: Drove 20 min to try their ice cream. I am an ice-cream lover, but I was not wowed here. I had a scoop of their sticky peanut butter - the chunks of peanut butter were smooth and were decently sized. I was very disappointed with their milkshakes though. I expected a thick shake but ended up with a milky mint shake. Too much milk, not enough ice cream. I would stick with scoops over the shakes here!
author: Andrea H.

description: Fresh no frills delicious ice cream. No seating but they let you stand around in the shop. It truly feels like an institution in there. When we went there was a line but it went quickly and was absolutely worth it.
author: Laurel S.

description:
food: sticky chewy chocolate. imagine rocky road blended. it's chocolaty with a soft chew without the nuts. it's a weird combo but i love it. it was a bit too sweet for me but thats not going to stop me from eating it all. ***4/5

service: servers were friendly. they moved everybody through the lines fairly quick. if it's slow, it's indecisive people holding up the line. ***4/5

value: the place is cash only. good thing i always carry an emergency $20 on me. never know when you will need it. yes i count eating ice cream as an emergency. it's a bit on the expensive side. scoop is not as big as some places. since they only take cash, their expenses are even lower. they can give up a little bit more ice cream. it's that important. ***3/5
author: Andy Z.

description:
It's not a Graeter's or anything (read: we weren't blown away by the flavors), but it's a cute shop with a loootttt of flavor choices!  I got some kind of marbled chocolate swirl in a vanilla base (it wasn't as flavorful and complex as I was expecting), and I experienced remorse when I tasted K's toasted almond, and it was much better.

Overall, a little pricier than I was expecting.  A single scoop in a cup + a double scoop in a sugar cone + tip was $10. Also note there's not a lot of standing room inside.
author: Tricia D.

description:
The Swensen's website mentions that the business has 3 founding principles: "Quality, Quantity and Value for Money." These are literally the 3 points I was going to highlight in my post, and why (any) 5 star review deserves their praise. 

Quality - You can definitely taste the flavors but it is also not overpowering or too sweet. Each spoonful gets more addicting than the previous one! 

Quantity/Value for Money - I got a whopping 16 oz Swensen's pint for only $6.65. This is beyond reasonable since even a pint of Haagen Dazs can be $4-5 on a normal day and those are not even freshly made! They are also kind enough to let you mix multiple flavors in a pint. I chose Lychee and Tahitian Coffee - both flavors that I highly recommend and would return for. 

Walking up here is quite a trek, since it sits atop Union and Hyde, but it is well worth it and I am glad to live within walking distance. It is a great after-dinner stroll, especially in the summer time. Digest that dinner and then come treat yourself to a delightful dessert! 

Bring cash!
author: Jenny M.

description:
Upgrading the size is like a 50 cent difference. It was so hard to resist.
A lot of flavors, all the ones I tried were delicious.
I felt adventurous and went with the cherry. It slightly tasted like medicine. It makes eating medicine good.
Expensive.
Parking sucks. As anywhere else in San Francisco.
author: Trang B.

description: Love their chunky chocolate and Mint icecream. So dense and creamy! As if there's no ice crystals that are formed , giving you an amazing texture !
author: cristina s.

description:
Cash only! 

Sticky peanut butter ice cream had actual peanut butter in it. I felt like that dog from the jif commercial years back! It was delicious and I was going to town. I was so busy eating it that I forgot to take a picture of it! 

The coffee ice cream is rich and I loved it as well. 

The flavors here are pretty original and unique which i love, because trying different flavor options is way more fun than your standard Chocolate and vanilla.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Despite its proximity to my apartment, I made my first trip to Swensen's last night and I am pretty sure it will not be my last.

Delicious ice cream and reasonable prices, what more could a girl need?! 

The sticky peanut butter was more chocolatey than peanut-buttery, but still very good. Everyone seemed satisfied with their choices.

Cash only which is a pain.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Could've sworn I wrote a review years ago but whatever.

Nothing special. Just good ole fashioned comforting flavors and malted shakes available.

Ca$h only, which irks me.
author: Susy C.

description:
I mean, yeah, it's good, but I don't get the "OHMYGAWDITSAMAZING" bit from it. I had a taste of the sticky peanut butter (holy chocolate-punch-in-the-face, Batman!) and the caramel turtle fudge (hello, instant diabeetus!) so I settled on my regular: coffee. Not insanely sweet, but comforting and delicious at the same time. My friend got the mint chip, which was pretty standard.

A single cone is at about $4 and it's cash only.
author: Adena B.

description:
What the heck is in Russian Hill? 

Swensen's is your ordinary, no frills ice cream shop. It's cute and on a corner, with your standard flavors. I'd say it's a level better than your average joe ice cream. We got the cookies & cream, which had a 'chewier' texture to it and was loaded with soft cookies (not the chunks). Not bad. Didn't think anything of it. I think it's good if you're going for the traditional ice cream taste, but with all these great and new modern ice cream places popping up in the city, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Sally C.

description: Bannnaaaannaaaaa!!!!!  This maybe how the minions fell in love with their Bananas.  The Banana ice cream here was really good, i think i can taste pieces of the banana. However, the turkish coffee and the Sticky chewy chocolate was too sweet for my taste buds.  There is usually a line here, and although it feels it's not moving, it really is, it's just that the people in front of you are buying a million flavors.   The serve here is good as well, they always serve up your scoop with a smile. I just wish there were tables for us to sit here instead of talking up or down the hills in sf holding our ice cream and trying not to freeze.
author: Belinda C.

description: Came to visit San Fransisco and my friend right away took me to this place. He said it was the best ice cream. I tried several samples and they were all great but ended choosing the almost ice cream! It was gone before we got home!! The service was great as well!
author: Edilia D.

description:
I guess there are a few things you should know
-parking isn't super easy, but there is a 15 minute zone next to the shop.
-it's just like any other great ice cream place.
-it's a little on the pricyer side, but you're paying for history.
author: Ian W.

description: Yum yum yum! The sticky, chewy chocolate is SOOO delish! Not over-poweringly sweet. The bf got the green tea and it was yummy! Attentive staff and the line wasn't super long. Will come back again if there's parking.. The only down side is that it took us 30 minutes to find parking.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
Got to love the reserved 10 minute parking for Swensen customer only. I am only in this area for ice cream only and I don't want to look for parking all over Russian Hill.

Swensen's is your traditional ice cream shop. Classic flavors done right. 

I tried the following flavors:
Green Tea was good. 
Swiss Orange chip was alright. Maybe I am not in to this combination.
Roasted banana was off the chains. Bursting with bananas!
author: Kien M.

description:
Swensen's isn't the kind of place that you go when it's cold and rainy outside, because there's nowhere for you to sit. Swensen's is made for sunny summer days or slightly breezy fall nights, where you can take a stroll with your ice cream.

The sticky chewy chocolate used to be crazy amazing, but recently, it's started to taste a lot like chocolate sauce, which isn't bad, per say, but not what I'm looking for at Swensen's.

I wouldn't go out of my way to come to Swensen's, but if you're in Russian Hill or even in Nob Hill, it's worth the trek if you have a craving.
author: Christina S.

description:
Oh Swensen's....You will always have a place in my heart. Before all these young ice cream shops moved in, you have already established your well deserved place on this corner. If it was 10 years ago I would have added a couple of more stars to this review, but unfortunately my palette might have changed.

It's been a long while since I've returned to Swensen's, so I ordered my staple Mango & Toasted Almond flavors. For some reason it didn't taste the same as it remembered. I don't know if my taste buds have matured or if it was too chilly of a night, but I was a bit saddened by it.

Overall thoughts : I do want to note that I would STILL come here over any store bought ice cream. There is something to be said about visiting your local ice cream parlor for a scoop or two. Their prices are also very reasonable and they aren't stingy on their scoops. However, if there are other options, I may be swayed to visit those instead.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Homemade ice cream in a cute little shop! 

I love the thin mint and the cookie dough ice cream! My boyfriend and I like to get our ice cream and walk down the block to Lombard Street and check out the view!

Parking might be a little difficult if the reserved 10 minute parking is taken up but don't give it! It's worth it!
author: Cathie N.

description: The real deal! Old school ice cream parlor with great options and flavors. Enjoyed the chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream. Cash only!
author: Abby G.

description:
I think you can count the walk to Swensen's as the exercise needed to counter act the calories you will soon be consuming. It is pretty much at the top of Russian Hill. Great to grab a cone and then look at the views.

The ice cream is always fresh and they give you a healthy serving. The unique and delicious flavor that they have is banana. Now, when you think of banana in anything sweet, you think of the Runts style artificial banana. But Swensen's makes their banana ice cream with fresh bananas. The flavor is powerful, but it is the true flavor. If you get a banana milkshake they even put another banana in their with the ice cream to pump up the banana-ness. My other favorite flavors are their coffee varieties - all delicious!

Staff is also always very friendly and accommodating.
author: Ben B.

description:
STICKY CHEWY CHOCOLATE

It's been 1 month since I came here and I am still craving their sticky chewy chocolate ): Their lychee, mango, green tea, strawberry & rum raisin ice cream is also very good. All of them are very good actually. You can also ask for a small sample too, but whatever you do, order sticky chewy chocolate.
author: Nancy M.

description:
A solid place to come for ice cream! I came here while on a date and enjoyed myself a lot! This place had a pretty steady line throughout the night! I had gotten the sticky chewy chocolate ice cream because someone on here had suggested it. Now, I'm not the biggest fan of chocolate ice cream, just because I feel like they can never execute it to have it taste like actual chocolate. I enjoyed myself a lot though... I'm not sure I would call it sticky chewy chocolate, it was more like chewy chocolate, but hey I know that's the name. It was very enjoyable, even for the non chocolate lover like me. It was also a very clean establishment as well. I was surprised at that fact for a ice cream place. 

Bottom line: If you're in the area for some ice cream, you can come visit this place. It's an awesome place to go grab some ice cream after dinner, especially on a date!
author: Derek W.

description: Decided to give this place a try as I was sick of the other neighborhood options. I'm so glad I did because it was soooo good! I would highly recommend the sticky chocolate peanut butter. Tasted like a Reese's. Definitely my new favorite ice cream place!
author: Christen N.

description:
I noticed this ice cream store the first time I took a stroll on Hyde Street in August. Originally I had come to photograph street name signs. The second time I came to Russian Hill I went inside Swensen's Ice Cream and took two minutes to decide on a flavor. Unfortunately, I only had my credit card and had to go to the bank to get cash for my treat. 
There's a water fountain inside. How nostalgic is that? 

How many other ice cream stores are still in existence from long ago? Stepping into Swensen's literally felt like stepping back in time! 

It was worth the wait!
author: Julio B.

description:
Swensen's Ice Cream is such a classic ice cream shop in the city. Sitting on top of Russian Hill, the surrounding view is epic. On one side of the hill is the Marina and on the other side is North Beach, so either way you are in a perfect location. 
I love the classic chocolate ice cream and strawberry 2 scoop combo on a sugar cone. They also sell ice cream by the half and full gallon. Even though it's located at the top of Russian Hill the extra walking might benefit some of us. (;
author: Dominic P.

description:
YASSSS SWENSENS 

Amazing ice cream. My favorite: orange sherbet because it has little flecks of actual orange in it. My boyfriends favorite: peppermint stick, he says it's beautiful. We always get double scoops in waffle cones because they are always made fresh. They make all of their ice cream in house and it shows. 

You get a lot of ice cream for your money and you can even take some home in half gallons! Come here, it's worth walking up the hill/ struggling to find parking.
author: Carmen C.

description:
I guess this place has been here for awhile since my friend says he's grown up eating Swensen's homemade ice cream. There were so many flavors and it didn't exactly help that the flavors were covered by their silver shiny tops so I couldn't see the color bursting from the ice cream.

I usually love pistachio ice cream but wasn't impressed when the color of the ice cream was a light brown color, I guess that makes sense since pistachio nuts are that color but I'm used to it being more of a bright green. After sampling a couple of different flavors and copying the girl in front of me, I decided on Sticky Chewy Chocolate. It was super creamy and the chocolate flavor was bitter tasting and rich. Definitely filled my chocolate craving for the night.

Parking is so lame. Even coming here close to 11PM, there's still no parking. Had to pull up in front and run in while a friend waits in the car.

I almost think that buying a pint of one flavor is more worth it than buying individuals so if you and a buddy are planning on getting the same flavor, opt to buy a pint (about $5).
author: Lauren K.

description: Sticky chewy chocolate really is just that. Ice cream for me is about texture & you guys know how to do it right. I will say that the mint chocolate chip might do better with smaller slivers of chocolate - this is just a personal preference. That way, the chocolate can melt better? With that said, I still devoured it all.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I wanted to try this place because of the rave reviews. I wasn't too impressed though. 

It is an old-fashioned, home-made ice cream type of place. But, as far as flavors, nothing stood out to me. I ended up getting a medium sticky chewy chocolate sundae and it was $5.35.

The ice cream was pretty good and creamy. It definitely was sticky. It wasn't out of this world amazing, but just ok. I'd come back to try another flavor. 

I honestly wouldn't go out of my way to come here. Parking is really hard to find. I'd rather go to Mitchell's or Bi-Rite.

FYI: CASH ONLY!
author: Fallon P.

description: I feel that this ice cream shop is subpar compared to Bi Rites or Humphrey Slacombe. The flavor were unoriginal, though it was quality ice cream. I'm just not very impressed but if you're looking for a quick fix, this place is great! If you're looking for something that will blow your mind, I'd recommend looking elsewhere!
author: Ashley T.

description:
Theres always room for some ice cream.

Came here and got a sticky chewy chocolate and Turkish coffee, which are two of their more popular ice cream places. I thought it was okay...melted rather too quickly too..maybe its because it was fresh and its a good thing I suppose...

But for ice cream in SF I am loyal to Bi rite.
author: Phuong K.

description:
Working on a Sunday is not my cup of tea, unfortunately it's a cup that comes with the territory from time to time.  I could not find spots for a reward and stress relief in the FiDi on a Sunday, which is normally a ghost town, so thank goodness for places like Swenson's in nearby Russian Hill.  

I agree with one reviewer, in the world of "regular" ice creams,  Swensen's is in a league of its own.  Not a lot of unique items to choose from, but Swensen's stays true to perfecting traditional ice cream.  I enjoyed two generous scoops - bittersweet chocolate and toasted almond.  I love the texture - not too creamy.  Flavors are alive but not too sweet and sugary.

Again, the cash only policy baffles me, and there aren't ATMs around the area except for the market across the street that charges a transaction fee almost the price of a scoop of ice cream.   

Overall, Swensen's is enjoyable and worth the occasional trip to Russian Hill.
author: Angel S.

description:
This is my favorite Ice Creamery in this part of town when I want a good Strawberry ice cream!  It's really fresh! Since the Strawberry IC is so hard & compact; I usually order only a quart so that the server doesn't strain his/her hand when doing the hard scoop/hand-packing!

Their Chocolate ice cream is also a winner! Rich, creamy, flavorful & sinful! 

Just be careful of Brain-freeze! That's the price of over-indulging with Swensen's! But SO GOOD!
author: Edward H.

description: Cash only shop. Had a great selection of fruit flavors. I had the raspberry marble, which is vanilla mixed with a yummy raspberry sauce. Worth the 5.10 for a double cone. Young teenage staff were a bit rude though.
author: Tina B.

description: I'm not a big ice cream fan but it was a hotter than usual day in SF and I was close by. I had the mocha fudge ice-cream on a chocolate dipped waffle cone. It was delicious, tasted like a brownie in ice-cream form. It also was a huge scoop that was priced cheap. I'm probably gonna be coming for seconds next time I'm in SF.
author: Mike W.

description:
Get the Caramel Turtle Fudge! ^_^

First impression of this store = wow. I loved the entirety of the shop as it felt like you stepped back in time when you walked through the door and you probably did!
author: Christine Y.

description: Traditional ice cream shop with some delicious and unique flavors. Loved the sticky peanut butter! There is no seating and they only take cash. Be prepared to wait in line for this place but it moves quickly!
author: Neel P.

description: Literally the best ice cream I've had. Sticky peanut butter with fresh banana on a waffle cone was perfect, and Brian was ridiculously friendly and generous helping us navigate to this delicious flavor duo. Excellent staff + unbeatable ice cream = I'm coming back.
author: Matt C.

description:
Classic staple in the community. 

Last night was CRAZY warm in SF. We went on a walk up Lombard and then down Hyde with the pup. It's not always perfect ice cream weather in the city so we weren't surprised to see a line around the corner on this perfect night. 

The line moved quickly and the service was no-nonsense and prompt. I got a mini double with thin mint and rocky road (was re-living my childhood a bit here). It was the perfect compliment for our walk home. 

Also! It's cash only and closed on Mondays.
author: Aggie N.

description: I usually dont write bad review, but feel that I need to this time. I took out of town guests to this shop, lucky there's no line and even not a single customer there at that moment, first time for all of us so we were kind of standing there and trying to figure out what flavor we might like, the girl behind the counter looked very impatient, giving us attitude when we started to order, she looked like she's giving us free ice cream, very rude behavior, for the owner's reference, she's an Asian girl working in the afternoon around 2 ~ 3pm on 7/9/16, the point I am trying to make is we didn't even do anything or say anything that will make her mad, the ice cream is good, but not worth it to be treated rudely.
author: Eileen T.

description: During my visit to San Francisco I had my first and so far only Swensen's Ice Cream. I was definitely impressed! But with a place with such good reviews, I would hope so! The ice cream was good quality - fresh and flavorful. I got one of my favorite flavors, chocolate chip cookie dough. It was good, just not too memorable except I just remember that I liked it. Swensen's was clean inside and our ice cream scooper was very friendly. They have a big variety of flavors plus of course sundaes, shakes, etc. I wouldn't necessarily go out of way to get ice cream here, but at the same time I don't feel Bi-Rite Creamery is that special either. So if you're looking for good, old fashioned ice cream, look no further.
author: Michael G.

description:
Bottom line at the top: great old school ice cream spot! I usually dislike chocolate ice cream but their sticky peanut butter (chocolate base) is soo good! Cash only. 
--
Yum!! I sampled a couple of flavors (Turkish coffee and caramel ribbon I think) and everything here is pretty good and I liked it more than Mitchell's. Cash only is a little inconvenient but I like the authenticity of being able to add 'jimmies' aka sprinkles. There is a ten minute parking spot out front which is really convenient and no seating inside or outside so don't expect to stay!
author: Dahlia S.

description:
Again, best ice cream ever. This time I had the coconut and the sticky peanut butter. 
I hope the sticky peanut butter is in heaven! Indescribably yummy.

Better than Bi-Rite in my opinion. LOVE Swensen's!
author: Chelsea J.

description:
I'm not sure about other flavors, but I tried French Vanilla Custard and literally it was the most fresh, chewy, creamy ice cream I've ever had so far. I thought it was gelato for a second! I strongly recommend trying this flavor. It was really good. 
(Cash Only)
author: Sue K.

description:
Bottom Line: My favorite ice cream on my trip to San Francisco.

Their service is average, but still friendly and helpful.  Not very enthusiastic, but still good.  

Their ice cream is not overly creamy.  They also have very recognizable flavors.  They aren't into all these silly new age ice cream names that you have no actual idea what you're ordering.  Leave the marketing at Starbucks, and gimme some damn chocolate ice cream.
author: Anson G.

description: Yummy!  My hubs favorite ever the sticky chewy chocolate and I had chocolate chip so good!
author: Amanda M.

description: Great ice cream, really bad customer service and some pretty glaring food safety concerns. We waited in a pretty long line and the server who called us to order next was texting on his phone, put it in his pocket and grabbed a cone to start serving. Also everyone that is touching your ice cream cones is also handling the money in a cash only joint. This may be par for the course but it grossed me out quite a bit. It kind of flies in the face of their health inspection score posted on the door (94 or 96 I believe)
author: Danny W.

description:
You can't ever go wrong with a classic ice cream shop like this. Saying you don't like Swensen's is like saying you hate your Grandma's cookies. Just don't.

My favs are Lychee and Peppermint Stick - I love love love their seasonal Peach flavor - SO GOOD. When the trendy spots with Olive Oil and Bacon flavored ice cream gets tiring, you can always rely on Swensen's for the classics as well as all of their other perfectly good flavors.
author: Sandy T.

description:
Swensen's is a traditional old-timey spot that sells ice cream, sorbets, and sherbets.

A little girl indirectly recommended mint chip ice cream to me[1]; I'm addicted to the stuff, so it didn't take much convincing.

That's when I saw they had lychee ice cream[2]. I bought a cup, and enjoyed the hell out of it. Cold yet soothing, it was a perfect salve for a long San Francisco walk.

Friendly service. Cash only.

[1] We were in line behind her, and heard her order.
[2] Or was it a sherbet? Looks like I'll have to go back.
author: Dave L.

description:
Swenson's is my favourite ice cream place in San Francisco. Everything has a rich, creaminess to it that you don't find in most places and certainly not in store-bought ice cream. The decor is a throwback to the years gone by (certainly longer ago than I've been alive) when everything was seemingly simpler.

My favourite flavour is Sticky Peanut Butter, however every flavour I have tried has been scrumptious.

Although instant gratification is nice, I recommend buying a larger quantity like a pint or gallon to take home as that is where the real value is (plus with ice cream this good you want to eat it everyday).
author: Daniel A.

description: ..the ice cream is fantastic..and they had a guy making ice cream with this rather large piece of machinery..kind of cool ..it is cash only...the sundae was delish, and the staff is very friendly..word on the street it's a cops hangout.
author: Sean R.

description: Good, fine but certainly nothing special. Certainly not 4.5 stars. Not sure what all the rage is about. After sampling 4 flavors we settled on the chewy chocolate and enjoyed it.
author: Kem K.

description:
- Locale Destination - 
It's on Hyde St and Union St in Russian Hill, San Francisco. 

It's very small yet filled with a lot of ice cream choices. No seating. No bathroom. Decor is simple, yet very old fashioned/classy. You feel the "age"... Friendly service. Cash only. Parking? Forget about it. It's really hard to find it around this area - bus is the best bet! The bus stop was right across the street. 

Flavors: Old fashioned (chocolate etc.) to lychee and green tea. Kinda interesting. 
Texture: Creamy, rich and thicker. Decent consistency. 
Quality: Decent yet very old fashioned. Not like the ones at "Bi-Rite" and "Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream" - modern, sophisticated high quality ice cream. 






- Gluttony Expedition - 
Lychee: Chemical like taste. It had bits in it. I don't like this. 
Blackberry swirl : The jam was good but vanilla ice cream had very artificial thin flavor that you get from very classy cheap ice cream. 
Coconut: Decent, rich and creamy. 
Cookie dough Choco chip: Too rich, too sweet.  
Chocolate & peanut butter: Very classy and too rich. 






- Conqueror's Deduction - 
Very old fashion and rich ice cream. Just better than average - among fierce gourmet SF ice cream competitions. I see that they try to offer the quality, yet they weren't as refined, sophisticated nor mind blowing as the modern ice cream by
"Bi-rite"and other top notch places. It was disappointing.
author: Akiko I.

description:
It's everything you've heard and more. 

Don't let the retro-classic interior fool you, this ice cream defines the industry. Quick, friendly service is the cherry on top of this array of delectable frozen treats. 

Pro tip: have you favorite flavor ice cream made into a milkshake and drink down some deliciousness.
author: Ryan G.

description:
I am not an ice cream fan.  I repeat.  I am NOT an ice cream fan.  

However, after eating a delicious meal without dessert, I started to get a little loopy.  I NEEDED MY SUGAR!  It was a Saturday night, and all the dessert places in the downtown seem to close at 2pm.  We didn't feel like getting buck wild at a bar, so we were on the hunt for frozen yogurt.  Yogorino was closed.  Miette was closed.  All the cupcake places I love were closed.  So we stumbled into Swensen's.  

The name sounded so familiar... I wasn't sure where I'd heard it from... I wanted to say I saw it on some food network show... but I'm still not quite sure....  It had to be a hit spot when people are lining up out the door at 10pm on a Saturday night.

Oh boy, Swensen's Ice Cream totally hit the spot.  The boyfriend had Thin Mint and I had the lychee ice cream.  DELICIOUS!  They had real chunks of lychee in the ice cream!  I was definitely a happy jumping bean.

Only downer, it's cash only.  I'm usually very against institutions that are cash only.. Come on.. who carries cash anymore?  The shop's also very small, so don't get intimidated by the long lines.. it's really NOT that bad.

Despite my lack of love for ice cream, this place is not too bad at all.
author: Cecilia S.

description: Got the touted sticky chewy chocolate and an appropriate evaluation was that it tasted like fudge. Indeed, it was sticky, not so much chewy, and of course, chocolate, but I would have preferred it a little less sweet. At $3.40 for a single scoop, it was more than enough for my mild sweet tooth. I would probably come here once again to try the black raspberry marble, just because.
author: Anita C.

description: I came here twice during my visit to San Francisco this week. Both times I got Sticky Peanut Butter  ( which is chocolate ice cream with a peanut butter swirl) and Chocolate Chip. Each time was delectable. My mom got Chocolate Chip the first time and for the second event she picked Chocolate Chip and Black Raspberry Marble. My mom had told me about Swensen's my whole life and I finally got to try it. Just another way to be satisfied.
author: Khalia B.

description: IT IS A MUST - best ice cream around - had it a few times and def want more - flavors are delicious - friendly staff and always a treat - one you def deserve - RUN DON'T WALK THERE -
author: Phillip S.

description:
San Francisco makes you work hard- whether you are a tourist in the city, working there or simply trying to park your car. Which is why its awesome that places like Swensen's call SF their home- to make you want to come to SF (despite the minor glitches) for a lick of this ice-cream again and again. 

If I were to throw out a couple of flavors that I can absolutely say you will not be disappointed by, they would be the Swiss Orange Chip and the Turkish Coffee. Even a small cup seemed to last forever ( I was worried about eating it too quickly and watching the bottom of the cup appear) as I relished every drop of this ambrosial goodness. 

Given a chance I would have sampled every single flavor in the store and gladly embraced a tummy ache later. 

I also think their milk shakes are divine. I tried the Mocha shake and loved it! However, whichever flavor you pick out, there is no way no can go wrong with it for sure.

Parking is a pain. But Swensen's offers courtesy 10 minute parking (very limited though ) to its customers right at the entrance.
author: Meghna S.

description:
Swiss Orange Chip - Gooey icecream that's way better tasting than it sounds
Turkish Coffee - Perfect for those who love coffee icecream
author: Diana Y.

description: Yummmm:)so good , I loved there coconut ice cream as if you are biting on a real coconut. Workers are pleasant and sweet. Service is very good . Tiny small ice cream place so don't expect to sit,just grab and go. Located in the nice neighborhood. You should definitely try this ice cream. I will come here again.
author: Gaukhar T.

description: You can't go wrong with this ice cream place. At the top of Hyde street, you get to enjoy a cup of ice cream while you watch the cable car roll by, doesn't get anymore San Francisco than that. Remember to bring cash though, they don't take credit cards.
author: Samara C.

description:
Delicious ice cream! CASH ONLY!
They had my new favorite, Swiss Chocolate Orange Chip, which is so unique and unusual but just amazing, you gotta try it! Came here in a group of 4, and it was about 10 mins to closing on a Saturday night, the place was packed, but all the employees had such sour faces. Just outright grumpy looking, barking "What do you want!" and they actually seemed upset that we all 4 just wanted to pay as one order? They ended up overcharging us too, but we figured it wasn't worth arguing. I hope it's not always like that, but the ice cream more than made up for it.
author: Omi P.

description:
For the holidays only: egg nog ice cream. 

The stuff is like crack. I've had it twice this week. 

Delicious.
author: Carlos A.

description: This is the best ice cream I've ever tasted. And believe me, I've eaten a LOT of ice cream. This stuff is soft, flavorful, and they don't skimp! Two favorites are sticky peanut butter and cookies and cream. The service is always prompt and kind. They scoop very heavy, and if you get a container to go, they fill it beyond the top. Don't miss this stop if you're in Russian Hill. Only downer is no seating room to eat at the place.
author: Meredith A.

description:
Went here during the day with my girlfriend, sister and her boyfriend. Parking is street parking and we got lucky with the 10 minute spot in front of the store. The shop has about 20 flavors or so and they are fresh. I got strawberry and the ice cream was great with strawberry chunks in it. It tasted more strawberry than cream flavored, which I liked. My girlfriend enjoyed the mango ice cream here. 

It is a little on the expensive side for the amount of ice cream you get. But I guess with the location of it and others around it, I can understand. 4 stars just due to pricing. 

Must try? If you enjoy Ice cream, then yes. If not, you can find cheaper ice cream around.
Try again? sure, why not. My girlfriend loves ice cream.
author: Thomas N.

description:
OK, this has to do with the sanitary standards which are blatantly ignored at this ice cream parlor.

(I just read Lamario D.'s review, pretty much same complaint as mine.  Gross.)

It was my first (and last) visit to Swensen's with my husband.  While we were waiting to be helped, I noticed a woman who was mopping the floor.  Since the line was quite long, she put the mop down and started handling money at the register.  Now think about what she's touched so far - a disgusting mop handle and now she's handling dollar bills and change.

Before we knew it, it was our turn to order and it turns out this same woman was the one who was scooping our ice cream.  She handed our sugar cones to us which did NOT have any paper wrapping nor napkin around it NOR had she washed her hands before scooping our order.

You know how sometimes you are observing and processing things, but not really putting it all together or you're just too dumbfounded that what you saw was real?  I just accepted my cone and went outside.  When I went outside, I took a tentative taste of my ice cream (since she didn't handle that with her hands), thought for a second about just eating the ice cream only, then promptly chucked the entire thing in the trash.

Honestly SF, please take a cue from NYC and start putting letter grades in the windows of businesses.
author: Serena H.

description: Yummy!!! Small double scoop with banana ice cream and sticky chewy chocolate ice cream  is basically a chocolate-covered banana.  So good!  Super creamy and thick.  Perfect after a lighter dinner (like Elephant Sushi across the street).
author: Vanessa O.

description: Besides the incredibly cute store front, why is this place so popular? I thought the ice cream just tasted like any other ice cream..
author: Stacy C.

description: Pretty good dessert place with a variety of different flavors and options. Came here after having dinner across the street and luckily did not have to wait in line at all, however, after we finished ordering there was a line out the door so be aware of that. I had the chocolate chip cookie doe which was pretty good, not the best ice cream I have had in the city but still an enjoyable experience, I would come back again.
author: Josue V.

description:
1 sentence review: It was alright.

To elaborate, with all the impressive ice cream spots in SF, this one just doesn't do it for me.

To the ice cream purists out there who feel like all these new crazy flavors are just gimmicks and true ice cream spots are all about strawberry vanilla and chocolate, maybe this is your spot.

The look and feel of this ice cream place is old school for sure. The menu and signs give that away. Most flavors have some sort of chocolate  in them and a strong chocolate smell comes through the doors. Not a bad thing at all, but it seems like they do not experiment as much with other flavors. They keep it basic for the most part with basic sherbet and fruit flavors as well. 

I tried the Turkish coffee which I liked (though not sure what makes it Turkish vs a regular coffee flavor) and a vanilla custard which was pretty good too.

Maybe I should have tried another flavor like Swiss Orange Chip, or  Lychee. Overall they were good, just not impressive. Nothing that would make me visit Swensen over other ice cream places that I really liked in SF.

1 more thing! Parking can be tough, I got lucky when I visited but you may be circling the block more than a few times.
author: Glenn M.

description:
My creamy, deletable, single-scoop of strawberry ice cream was such a nice and refreshing end to my dinner at Sotto Mare.  

But..... next time.....

I'm getting chocolate... my name twin had one of the chocolate flavors and it literally made me j**z in my pants.  

soOoooOOOooo good...
author: Kat C.

description:
Return? If I'm in the neighborhood but not a destination spot. 
Atmosphere (3)  Standard ice cream take away 
Food (3) - This is good ice cream but not great. I opted for pretty standard flavors - mint chip and rocky road - so maybe i would have come away more impressed if I'd opted for more exotic options. I enjoyed both very much but they just didn't stand out in the crowd.
Service (4) Friendly
Cost = Total tab before tax/tip was $6 for double scoop on a sugar cone
author: Will S.

description:
Solid ice cream, with rich, creamy texture. They also have gigantic waffle cones AND sugar cones.

My kind of ice cream shop.
author: Vivian H.

description: Swenson's has the kind of ice cream you grew up on.  Nothing fancy, just good solid treats.  Most of their flavors are pretty standard (no salted caramel or balsamic strawberry here), but it's a nice step back in time.  Bring your cash -- they don't take credit cards.
author: Calee S.

description:
Best chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream I have ever had.

Only downside is that they ONLY accept cash, who carries cash anymore!
author: Megan E.

description: Always clean, helpful service, and the best ice cream around.
author: Marina T.

description: I've walked past here many many times during my youth years! I walk past here after school with friends but never tried it until recently.. And after moving away from SF for 10 years! Enjoyed my sticky chewy chocolate ice cream on a slight rainy day. This place is always crowded but no crazy lines. Recommend!!
author: Lily M.

description: The taste was okay. For the same flavor, I prefer the one in Swensen's Thailand.
author: Knott W.

description:
Ice cream!!! My friends took me here after a scrumptious dinner for dessert. And the ice cream didn't disappoint -- buttery, creamy, with a lot of interesting assorted flavours. I didn't know this is the original store of Swensen's -- now I do.

I got the mint chocolate chip and something with berries and cream. They're yummy (maybe a bit too bold to be put in the same cup ;)). If you're in the area this is a great place to stop for some dessert considering how late they open.
author: Alice C.

description:
Ice Cream - Yum

Service - Booooooo

Went here for dessert after our dinner at Zarzuela across the street. 

Asked to try a few flavors and instantly the worker gave me the death stare. He was immediately angry/annoyed with our group of 3 for some unknown/odd reason. 

My cousin asked for hot caramel after the ice cream was already scooped into a small cup. Instead of transferring the scoop into the medium cup and pouring caramel over it, he tossed it and re-scooped a brand new one in a medium cup....

I got the Toasted Almond, which had a really lovely almond flavor, but a bit too many almonds in it. The hot caramel is delish. Although, I wish I had gotten more!! I LOVE caramel. 

The ice cream here is yum, but not as creamy as Bi Rite. And service is not even close.
author: Swapna M.

description:
Sticky chewy chocolate is the best pure chocolate ice cream ever.

The thin mint is actually just a classic mint chocolate chip but with lots of extra chocolate chips!

Lychee, Bordeaux cherry, and Turkish coffee are also delish.
author: Amy X.

description:
Deeeeeeelish! Finally found a convenient parking spot near Swenson's today so I parked my car and ate some ice cream! It's a cool little ice cream shop with nice workers inside who are real friendly. There's no seating inside (probably only room for 3-4 people standing) and they have no benches outside to sit on...it's definitely not a place to sit and eat. But once again, I only came in because I found street parking. 

A lot of flavors to choose from. I got a single scoop of Toasted Almond in a Waffle cone for $4.20 and it was amazing. They also have a fridge full of ice cream in pints and tubs for people to take home. CASH ONLY.  

Swensons is really close to the Wharf, about 5 minute drive, and there's a few cool dinner spots to check out within a few blocks of the ice cream shop so check it out.
author: Arnold N.

description:
This was my first time trying Swensen's.  Thanks to Foodspotting, I discovered how good Swiss Orange Chp ice cream it.  I had expected...as the name suggests...orange colored ice cream or at least vanilla ice cream with orage chips.  But it was actually swiss chocolate ice cream with chocolate orange-flavored chips.  It was pretty creamy and although the orange was subtle, it was really tasty.

FYI...CASH ONLY
author: Rose A.

description: Been to place this ice cream shop since I was a kid with my parents. I've always had the Turkish coffee ice cream here and it never changed. Brings back good memories :) it's nice to see some businesses stick around through the entirety of your memory of San Francisco. highly recommend this place.
author: Kelvin T.

description: Tough parking. Unique flavors. Good prices. Definitely one of the better ice cream shops in SF.
author: Timothy L.

description:
This shop IS Swensen's yet it is NOT Swensen's and that's what makes it so great! Swenson's is a chain, but this location -- not so much, because ...

Besides having delicious ice cream as many people here describe (yay!), including two signature chocolate flavors: Swiss Orange Chip and Sticky Chewy Chocolate, ...

This is the ORIGINAL FIRST EVER Swensen's and it's still run that way by the same man since 1964:

"The Russian Hill original, meanwhile, is one of the few shops still run semi-independently (Campana still owns it), one of only 10 Swensen's worldwide allowed to make its ice cream onsite, using Earle Swensen's original recipes. "

(source: SFWeekly March 30, 2011 - http://www.sfweekly.com/2011-03-30/restaurants/swensens-ice-cream-review-earle-swensen-john-birdsall/full/)

My favorite flavor is blackberry.

In addition to great ice cream and a charming store front, you get an awesome location. At the peak of Russian Hill, Swensen's is a great stop on a cross city walk or meander around one of the most classic picturesque neighborhoods in San Francisco! 

This is a historic must-do for all San Franciscans and all True Ice Cream Fans.
author: Goodbye K.

description: If you are craving good regular ice cream with your favorite flavors, then this is the place.  They didn't have the fancy new flavors ("artisanal" stuff like hand churned sea salt lavender vanilla mascarpone blah blah) but we're just regular folks who like chocolate or cookies and cream.  They may have had some unusual flavors but I didn't notice anything too crazy.
author: Malabika M.

description:
Mocha Fudge.  Creamy, fudgey, coffee.  Yum.

A variety of flavors that will appeal to all.  Parking (as always in the city) can be difficult though.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
The first time I tried their ice cream, I fell in love with the taste. Oh boy, I felt like my childhood days came back. What is in their ice cream that I can't forget the taste? Every time I'll think about it...I'm drooling. I wish I can have it immediately and savor the delicious flavor in my mouth. 

If you haven't try their green tea ice cream, brace yourself...it is one of the best tasting  and flavorful green tea goodness I've ever tasted. Mmmm...
author: Jem G.

description: Ice cream is awesome. Banana and toasted almond are personal favorites. However I should point out the shop is very small no seating, seldom any parking nearby and CASH only.
author: Chuck R.

description:
Love Swensen's!!

+All their flavors are great but my favorites are the sticky chewy chocolate and swiss orange chip!

-I have to walk up that big hill on hyde to get it to it from my apartment but my husband says I have to earn my ice cream so I have to walk my ass up there. :)

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
I've been here quite a bit since I moved to the neighborhood. Swensen's is awesome! One of my favorite ice creams is the classic Cookies n Cream. I think you can judge a lot about an ice cream place based on their Cookies n' Cream. The ice cream has to be the right flavor and consistency, and there has to be a good ratio of cookie to ice cream. 

Most places skimp quite a bit on the amount of cookies, but the Cookies n Cream here always has HUGE chunks. I'm pretty certain i've gotten multiple nearly whole chunks of cookie in my one scoop of ice cream. All the other flavors are really good as well.
author: Yishian Y.

description: I've been going to swensons ice cream since I was a kid. My taste has changd bee the years though. I always used to get bubble gum ice cream. That way I would eat the ice cream and then have the gum save do a second treat later. Now I'm more of a mint chip guy. But swensons is a classic American ice cream shop
author: Mike D.

description: The toasted almond is so good! It's good ice cream and the staff are really friendly. If you are going with another friend and each are getting a scoop, you should just get the double scoop and ask them to put it in separate cups so you pay less.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I'm so thankful I've always lived about 2 blocks away. With that said, I've grown up eating swensen's ice cream! I will forever be a fan and customer :) 

lychee - they put real lychee in their ice cream, like little chunks of it. 

they have seasonal ice cream flavors.
PEACH AND BANANA over summer. sooo yummy. oh and bordeaux cherry! 
pumpkin and eggnog during fall! ++.
author: Kayla O.

description:
Like everyone has mentioned, the sticky chewy chocolate is amazing!!! We shared it and wish we had gotten our own because even though we were full from dinner, we wanted to keep eating the delicious ice cream.

Can't wait to try other flavors! Service is super friendly although it can get very crowded.
author: Shireen J.

description:
Simple flavors that are really good.  It's no wonder this place has been around for 80 years.  I hope it is around for 80 more. 

Chocolate and peanut butter chicks was really good!
author: K B.

description:
This was a good stop on a lazy Saturday afternoon when all a friend and I wanted was some ice cream.  A cute place, good value and tasty ice cream.  Just driving by the place, you can start to smell the delicious waft of ice cream and waffle cone heaven...but I guess that is good because it might take circling the block a couple times to find a parking spot in the busy neighborhood.  

We shared a delicious sundae with chocolate chip cookie dough (my favorite) and marble fudge.  The ice cream wasn't too sweet and it was super creamy.  The sundae was topped with whip cream, chocolate sprinkles and nuts.  It was huge and very good value.  This place only takes cash, so get those Washingtons or Lincolns ready.  

The people behind the counter were good at moving through the crowd convening in the small shop, so it didn't take much time to be happy campers on a sugar high.  The place reminds me of an old fashioned ice cream parlor, but there isn't any indoor seating, so be prepared to find a nice spot outside.

All in all, a place worth checking out if you want some ice cream, a milkshake or another sweet treat.
author: Maria K.

description:
NOM NOM. 

The lychee and the thin mint ice cream were bomb. Considering these were the only two flavors that I have had there, I am sure the other ones are bomb too.

NOM NOM.  And it was even better because we got the regular scoop for free courtesy of ScoutMob

homemade ice cream for free? WINNING in my book
author: Stephanie W.

description: Awesome ice cream, specially the cookies and cream! Very consistent place. Their large size ice cream (pint? the one in the fridge by the window) is a great priced item!
author: Javier S.

description: The place reminds me of what an ice cream shop would look like in the 50's. The ice cream flavors taste delicious and fresh.
author: Celeste D.

description:
Caramel marble full of caramel and sticky chocolate, just typing it makes me wanna go back. They even have a deal, if you get a red star on your receipt.

SF classic, hands down!
author: Don G.

description:
Really, really good.   After a wild ride on  the Powel-Hyde cable car, I got off at Union for a small double: Sticky peanut butter - chocolate with large globs of peanut butter, and blackberry.  Enjoyed this as I walked to Lombard street to see the spectacle that is labeled as the "crookedest street in San Francisco" (technically not true).
Anyways, it is really that good.  Old time-y decor, very retro I suppose.
author: Therese D.

description:
Fantastic ice cream, Creamy and flavorful.  The cones are fresh which is a plus. 

Don't let the line scare you away. They are pretty good with keeping it moving quickly.
author: Sabrina J.

description:
Years ago when I lived in San Francisco (on the Cow Hollow/Russian Hill cusp), I would sometimes take the Cable Car home. This Swensen's is was the place to get off, buy a cone, and head down the hill. 

Much of the old Swensen's chain seems to be gone, but the "Mother Ship" is still a light in the storm with its reliably good ice cream. And even though it doesn't get the benefit of OMG reviews that places like Bi-Rite Creamery regularly receive, sometimes slow and steady still wins the race.
author: Eric B.

description:
Call me boring, but I came here one day a got a scoop of strawberry icecream in a waffle cone. The waffle cone was stale and the strawberry icecream wasnt creamy but rather sorbet-ish. (this may not be a bad thing for others, but just my own preference)

Perhaps it was a bad day for the poor waffle cones or perhaps I shouldnt of ordered the plain ol' boring strawberry. I'll come back and give another flavor a try another time.
author: M W.

description:
Tried Swiss orange chip for the first time, and the little tart bits of orange candy surprised me at first because they weren't visible in this coffee colored ice cream, but I ended up buying a small cup anyway thinking it would grow on me and it did. The ice cream was gone before I knew it, and I would say I enjoyed eating it even though I don't often enjoy particularly sweet flavors and am commonly ordering vanilla. Maybe eating it with friends tinted the experience. I hope to order Fresh Banana or Mint Chip next time. 

The small cup was $3.15 which i would call fair but a few nickels cheaper. The service there was nice. They were cool letting me sample flavors while I hovered in their quaint little area (thankfully the crowd was gone then). The cashier placed my receipt and change neatly on the counter which is a detail I really liked.
author: Michelle W.

description:
WoW!!! homemade ice cream!!!! We ended our day with great ice cream!!
I am impressed on the service and also the creamy taste. We had a old fashioned vanilla and Sticky Chocolate (it was very chocolaty, but not very sweet) the way we like it. On a Saturday evening not many people came here maybe it was a bit chilly, but we did meet a senior couple which the grandpa walks with cranes, he told us that he would walk here with his sweetheart almost every Saturday to have ice cream (aw~~~ so sweet!!)
author: Lovetea C.

description:
Unfortunately I have to agree with the other reviewers that the ice cream is okay, but nothing special for the price. I like the classic feel of the place, and the young-ish man behind the counter on Sunday was perfectly friendly, professional, and helpful. I despise fake-chipper workers, so he was great. 

The Turkish coffee was very good, but then again I love all things flavored coffee. 

The chocolate chip cookie dough was super disappointing, however. The vanilla flavor didn't come through, the chocolate chips tasted plasticky, and there were barely any cookie dough chunks. 

I also tasted the sticky chewy chocolate peanut butter flavor or whatnot and wasn't impressed. Of course sugar on sugar on sugar with nut butter and chocolate tastes good, but it was super overwhelming and not special. Maybe I've eaten spoonfuls of peanut butter out of a jar too often to be impressed . . . 

I also tried the banana flavor, and, again, is everyone aware that you can just freeze bananas, blend them, and magically have one-ingredient, all-natural, hand-made, relatively healthy, banana ice cream, all in the time it takes to freeze a banana? I had a hard time picking flavors and didn't find any of the options worth the relatively high prices of this place.
author: Marie L.

description:
Another old school ice cream shop.

If you are in the south part of the city, go to Mitchell's (http://www.yelp.com/biz/76smcUUGRvq3k1MVPUXbnA).
In the western part of the city,  go to Joe's (http://www.yelp.com/biz/-STLHuhs2WXTOa1ucsRb_w).
If you are in the Russian Hill area, go to Swensen's.

It's nice that these three famous shops are nicely spread out, so that you are never too far from a cone of creamy heaven.

Update (11/10/06):
In a blind taste test by 8 people scoring 5 local vanilla ice creams (Mitchell's, Joe's, Swensen's, Polly Ann, and Safeway) side to side, Joe's and Swensen's came out tied for 1st place.
author: トモ T.

description:
driving around randomly, we passed swensen's...and I was like "Isn't that the one in Thailand!? Is this the original one!?!?"

So we had to make a stop! Luckily found parking a block away, yay what a great day.
Tiny place, semi rude/blunt asian guy taking my ice cream order. 

craved cookies and cream, so that is what I got...could have gotten the baby size, but opted for the single scoop. which was nicely packed into the cone. SO MUCH COOKIES!! YUM!! i was a happy camper.

bf tried some kind of orange chocolate mint one...in a waffle cone. mine was better.

but $8 for two is a bittttt steep...

but happy we got to try it. the ones in thailand sure are more fancy.
author: Christine M.

description:
Swiss Orange Chip has kept me coming back -it's that good. It was one of my favorite flavors as a child, and Swensen's is still making this classic. No one else makes an orange-chocolate flavor as far as I know.

On my most recent trip to Swensen's, I took my toddler son as a treat for not crying during his doctor's appointment and flu shot.  He was thrilled.
