The guys behind the counter was so friendly and patient and totally accommodating.  I didn't want to give a full scoop to my son so I asked if they could split a single scoop into to separate cones. They happily obliged and both my son and I got just enough ice cream to make us happy.  10 minutes later, my son dropped his cone in the store. Not a problem, the friendly man behind the counter gladly replaced it for him-- what great customer service!  I ended up buying a half-gallon of Swiss Orange Chip for my freezer...it was the least I could do :)
author: Sonia S.

description:
A great place to step away from the tourist crowds of Ghiradelli square and Lombard st!

The owner of the shop was very funny and cracking jokes as we were sampling and making our order. Its the small actions that make this ice cream shop a unique experience. 

The ice cream itself was very good and I was impressed with my lychee on a sugar cone. The mixture of traditional flavors with flavors that I have never seen (Lychee) was great to see. The price is fairly reasonable (about 3.50 for a single scoop)

Tip: If you are thinking of taking a visit from the pier side (Ghiradelli square) consider taking the trolley up to union
author: Eric K.

description: Best place to get your favourite classic ice creams in the city! Top your favourite ice cream flavour(s) on a sugar come and you'll soon be a happy camper! Great location (if you don't have to walk) and great prices! The ice cream severs are really nice too!
author: Katarina D.

description:
A San Francisco Original. This Ice Cream place has the best ice cream in the planet. I go there 2-3 times a week. If this place was not there, I would buy a house in Pacific heights already. I live like 4 blocks away from this historic Ice cream corner. It's like getting morning coffee @ coffee shop, but nightly Ice cream @ this place.
I would pay extra for great tasting Ice cream as opposed to cheap Rite-aid Ice cream. 
My top 3 Ice Cream from Swensen's
1.Banana (Must have flavor)
2.Lemon Chiffon
3. Mango
All Ice cream flavor are great, test it out!!
author: Matt G.

description:
ICE CREAM anyone??? Homemade ice cream!!!

This place is a blast.  I've been here since I was a kid.  My auntie always took me here to get ice cream.  It's a small shop on top of Russian Hill neighborhood at the corner.  You won't miss it.  Every time I go here, there is always a line.

I order my usual which is Strawberry.  The ice cream is well balanced and is very creamy and flavorful.  One lick of this strawberry ice cream will have you craving for me.  In their ice cream, there are huge chunks of strawberries.  Now that's what I call a Strawberry ice cream.  Most ice cream places are a bit skimpy on having a lot of fruits in the ice creams.  

Overall, this is hands down as good as it gets.  It is good since its open for so long and to this day they are still making ice cream and it's still as good as the first time I tried it.

-Parking-

Parking is a bit disaster.  It is pretty hard so I recommend going with a friend so one can drive around are double parking by the bus stop.  Be careful of double parking at bus stop you might get a citation!
author: Kenneth Y.

description: This ice cream shop is near my work, so I swing by every time when the weather is nice and eat at the tennis courts. I had swiss orange chip, green tea and turkish coffee so far, and liked all of them! Turkish coffee was kindda bitter to me, but still worth trying!
author: Asato T.

description:
I have a huge sweet tooth and have been on the mission to try every ice cream shop in the city (doing very well so far).  When I walked in, I felt like I walked into a smaller Poly-Ann in that the shop itself had a "old school feel.  With that said, the flavors itself were very original/"normal"/safe, nothing experimental as one would find at Humphrey Slocombe or Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.  This is a perfect spot when, on a sunny day, you're out and about, and wanting simple ice cream.  

Trivia fact: based on a small group of tourists whom recently traveled to SF, Swensen's is really popular in Singapore.

SF location itself allows both tourists and locals to enjoy the viewing of a cable car rolling by.  Suggestion: I would try not park on the same street as the cable car rolls; I parked at a 10mins. green zone, on the same block, and, upon attempting to park my car, I felt bad for the cable car who had to wait while I reversed into my space.  And also getting out, I felt like I was very close to the passengers rolling by.

Great little place for simple flavors.
author: Jessica S.

description:
You scream, I scream we all scream for Swensen's Ice Cream! 

Lots of flavors. I tried the Lychee ice cream which was delicious despite not being in a sorbet or froyo form. I loved that they had pieces of lychee in it.

PARKING is non existent... therefore you may have to have one person stay in the car circling around while the other goes in and orders you ice cream.
author: Emily C.

description: I love the texture of this ice cream and to think it is hand made right there in the store. This place hasn't lost touch with its beginnings. My favorite is the Peach Ice cream!
author: Nicole G.

description: I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream!!! Swensen's has that old fashion ice cream parlor vibe. I love it! I am never disappointed with I go there. How could anyone really be disappointed about ice cream? I always find a new flavor to try but if all else fails, dark chocolate is the way to go for me! Last time I got the black cherry vanilla. Yum!!! One scoop on a sugar cone please!
author: Liv A.

description:
Located about a 10-15 minute walk away from my apartment, we were craving ice cream on this beautiful spring weekend. After doing some Yelping, we headed up to Swensen's, partially due to my friend knowing its reputation, partially because there really isn't any other ice cream shops in the Nob Hill area.

Fortunately it wasn't too busy and while we had to wait in line, it moved quickly and service was super fast. We each ordered a small cup, paid, and headed out... peanut butter chocolate for me and peppermint crunch for him. 

The portions are small, but I think it was a good amount for we wanted at the time. I could easily see wanting a larger size at other times though. The price is worth it, the ice cream was divine. 

I'm sorely tempted to go up there to get a liter for myself!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
When I came here the first time, I raved over the Swiss Orange Chip. The second time around wasn't as great

SWISS ORANGE CHIP
[+] tasted a LOT like the orange-shaped chocolate candy so yessss!
[+/-] consider making it orange w/ chocolate chips? so it doesn't just look like a mass of brown aha
[-] the 2nd time I had this, it tasted more bitter than I remembered...

STICKY CHEWY CHOCOLATE
[-] tasted too much like chocolate fudge for me

LYCHEE
[+] quite good! there's lychee bits in there!

GREEN TEA
[+/-] tasted a lot like matcha so it was a bit bitter and I like the sweeter green tea flavor

WAFFLE CONE
[+] was yummy since it wasn't overwhelmingly sweet
[+/-] $1 extra!

[+] there's gallon tubs of their ice cream flavors!
[-] they're almost the same price (if not cheaper) than two double scoop ice cream cones aha
[-] parking can be a paaaaaaaaain to find

I will still come by to try their other flavors!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Oh man-- I love this place.

It's so quaint, and it's in the best part of Russian Hill.  This is the perfect place to end a date.  It brings the magic back to ice cream.

The ice cream here is fantastic -- old school, simple, and unrivaled in SF.

An absolute must visit, at least once!
author: Yan L.

description:
Swensen's doesn't strive on having the weird and wacky of ice cream flavors that so many ice creams parlors tend do today. But what Swensen's does do is old-fashioned and original. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cf6el4kGXe686x4Kb6F18Q?select=ouJCeSVs7mCnhvkq3aIldQ

They don't have an extensive list of flavors to chose from, but the originals they do, they do well.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cf6el4kGXe686x4Kb6F18Q?select=yUVrhUL4E-m8dFunNdSvOg

This place has a soft place in my heart as both my folks frequented Swensen's as kids growing up.  San Francisco does the old fashioned ice cream parlor feel so well, that it's no wonder this place has stood the test for the past 50 years. 

I came here on a warm Saturday afternoon, and decided on a scoop of Black Raspberry Marble.  Sometimes the palate craves something simple just to cleanse the mouth with.  So I opted this flavor as it was a very traditional vanilla with black raspberry swirl flavoring mixed in.  It was just what I needed with a little hint of the sweet black raspberry flavoring.  
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=uMpWu7hSowxC2v25Nv9wbg&select=-SVEQpfk1O-7rfKurkONdA

The texture of the ice cream was thick and chewy. Which is definitely a nice change from what I see at other spots around SF--the light and fluffy texture.  Sometimes I could use something with a nice and thick texture. 

Swensen's is a very small corner shop, so there isn't any seating.  They also still use these awesome old fashioned ice cream freezers, so you can't really see what the ice cream flavors look like before hand.  Thankfully,  you can sample as much as you can.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cf6el4kGXe686x4Kb6F18Q?select=potFlehXyh4YjjkQXK3fEA

Overall, the few flavors Swensen's does do, they do them pretty well.  But I can't ignore that this place is a little part of San Francisco ice cream history!
author: Cass J.

description:
Very solid ice cream (on the creamier thicker side), but considering the amazingly fantastic ice cream options available in SF, I wouldn't consider this a standout in anyway. There were just too few flavors that I really enjoyed, and the flavors weren't particularly authentic/ natural tasting. They also don't offer any unique flavors - everything is pretty generic and classic. Which is fine, but I like seeing something different especially at such a hyped ice cream spot. And while their texture is pretty good, I would say it's much creamier and smoother at the other well known spots around the city. Maybe just a personal preference, but that's reason enough for me not to have to come back (and too bad because I live around the corner!).

On the service: even though we asked the guy nicely to taste flavors and told him ahead of time we would be in order to choose the PERFECT flavor, he got visibly annoyed. (that never happens at Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous!).

We ended up with:

* Cookies n cream - Can't go wrong with my favorite flavor in the world. Nice and dense blend of oreos & vanilla.

* Swiss Orange Chip - Really liked this one. Orange & chocolate is a great combination of flavors, and I loved the crunchiness of the chips, whatever it was (nuts?).

Also one of the chocolate ones was really good - it was heavier and more like dark chocolate in flavor.

Really bad ones included: thin mint, fudge, and banana. They all just tasted way too artifical and overly sweet.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
This is still and always be my go to place for ice cream! One of those childhood favorites that you can never forget. The decor and look remains the same after so many years. They don't seem to have as many flavors as back then, but still offer many delicious choices! 

Must try!!!
author: Philip K.

description: I have been going to Swensen's ever since I was a little kid and I absolutely love this place. It has been in existence since 1948 and is one of the few places that has been in the city that long without change. They simply have the best ice cream in the city and I always grab a pre-packed gallon before leaving. Expect a wait during busy times, but it will be worth it. Highly recommended.
author: Jared C.

description: They have great ice cream for how small this ice cream shop is! It reminds me of Mitchell's but still not as good as Bi-Rite's.  The sticky chewy chocolate puts you in chocolate heaven, but don't get it if you're not a die-hard chocoate lover or else it'll be too much.  I also tried the thin mint, but wasn't really feeling it.  I think it was because I was looking for more of a mint chocolate chip feeling.  The one that I enjoyed the most was their vanilla caramel swirl.  MMmm the amount of caramel in the vanilla was just perfect.  Not too sweet and not too taffy.
author: Stacey C.

description: A great way to end the night at Elephant Sushi. I went for the cookie dough ice cream and it did not disappoint. Wait time total was 2 minutes. Cash only so prepare for that.
author: Chase L.

description:
We were wandering along Hyde Street on our last night in town and I was joking that I was going to get some ice cream before we left because we were vacation and well, why not. I spotted this gem across the street and decided it must be done. I had the Bing Cherry ice cream in a cake cone and it was perfect in every way. My husband who doesn't love sweets was taking his fair share of the ice cream that night. Delicious.
CASH ONLY
author: Sarah C.

description: I am very picky about ice cream. After my 5th or 6th visit to Swenson's, I have to write a review. The cookies and cream is top 3 ice creams I've ever had. It's a 10/10 and I have dreams about it. Do yourself a favor and get it. The first time I had it, I went immediately back for more.
author: Christopher M.

description: An old school ice cream shop that makes their own stuff in a HUGE variety of flavors. It's very, very charming and a nice traditional contrast to the newfangled fancy ice cream makers in the city. An SF institution. There can be a line sometimes, and it's not high-concept slick, but it's just a genuinely good place. I hope it stays exactly the same for years go come. Yes, the Turkish Coffee is very good, as are many other flavors, but my absolutely favorite has to be the strawberry ice. It has chucks of real strawberries and might just be my favorite ice cream/sorbet anywhere.
author: Dave Y.

description: Back when Swensen's were a chain throughout the state, I would have this delicious ice cream every Saturday. Now, I am lucky to make the pilgrimage here once a year if that. You can be sure that if I am within a 50-mile radius of San Francisco, I will be stopping here for a double scoop of Swiss Orange Chip. The only bad thing is parking is a freaking nightmare, so I usually get dropped off and have someone drive around the block a few times while I get my ice cream. Don't piss off the neighbors by illegally parking and blocking their driveway. Definitely worth the trouble.
author: Michael W.

description:
Groovin' on a Sunday afternoon (love that Rascals' song), an idea popped in my head... a nice, cold pineapple freeze.  Foiled on two previous attempts, I entered the store with tempered expectations, looking for that dreaded "out of order" note pasted on their soda machine.  REDEMPTION!  There was no note and only one person ahead of me in line.  After ordering a large one ($5.80), my eyes wandered towards their icebox that stores their pre-packed half gallon tubs.  Eureka, Bordeaux Cherry!  I picked up a pint of this for later.  It had small cherry chunks and the ice cream was just right in creaminess.  
Back to the freeze.  After entering my car and inserting the straw, I took a long slurp of my freeze (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cf6el4kGXe686x4Kb6F18Q?select=xIyuzhqougDd6Q1UwRv3WA).  Mmmmmmm... soothing and sweet.  The pineapple chunks are small enough to slide through the straw.  Take a bow, Swensen's.  You've brought me back to home and the many memories of past trips here.
author: Mike C.

description: Great creamy ice cream in an old-fashioned shop!
author: Dimple B.

description:
We were jetlagged but wanted to walk a little to enjoy this warm, sunny San Francisco evening.  My bf mentioned he wanted ice cream - so Swensen's popped into my mind!  

I love this quaint neighborhood shop!  We got chocolate chip in a cup and a Turkish coffee ice cream sugar cone - nice and creamy, cool and refreshing, especially for warm San Francisco that we're not normally accustomed to!  We walked home through Nob Hill enjoying our ice cream, enjoying the Bay views - perfect, just perfect!  :)
author: Maile N.

description: The Lychee ice cream is bomb
author: Lisa M.

description: Came across this place while getting pizza and Zas  ( If looking for pizza Zas is the way to go) wasn't impressed with their menu but they nailed it with what they did have, service was fast and friendly! I had a cookie dough milk shake it  was awesome and didn't make me feel gross even after eatting pizza. It went down a lot smoother than I thought and was able to finish the entire thing. They have a room in the front where you can watch them make their ice cream. Would recommend!
author: Ryan S.

description: A classic ice cream parlor that serves both the traditional flavors and some with a slight twist. I had the Turkish coffee but I also liked the Swiss orange chip that my friend got, which was slightly more interesting. The texture of the ice cream was spot on. I would come to Swensen if I wanted classic, comforting ice cream flavors, but nothing here stood out to me in comparison with other ice cream places in SF.
author: Allison S.

description:
Super delish! I love this place, and it makes the walk up the hill totally worth it! 

They are more suited to the 'usual' suspects of flavors; mint choc chip, choc fudge, etc. but they cycle through some new seasonal flavors through the year which is always fun.  Had the raspberry sherbet, and hubby had a roasted almond.  Yum, yum!

Small corner store, no outdoor seating (there is a small parklet 1.5 blocks down the hill, back towards the city).  Cash only.
author: Beekay M.

description: 10000 stars. The BEST ice cream in the city. It's not overly pretentious bullshit ice cream, with cayenne and popcorn flavors, it's comfort, creamy, heavenly made ice cream with flavors meant for ice creams. It's an old fashioned parlor which makes it such a nostalgic place to go to. It's a fun experience that takes you back to childhood. I repeat, BEST ICE CREAM IN SAN FRANCISCO.
author: Adriana A.

description:
Mmm ice cream. Not just any ice cream, it's Swensen's! I grew up with Swensen's in Malaysia and I had fond memories of indulging their beautiful creations in Kuala Lumpur and Penang. Little did I know, it all started from this quaint little shop in Russian Hill.

Honestly, we were walking on Hyde St and stumbled upon this place by accident. I got so excited I just crossed the street without looking and rushed into the shop. It's was definitely different than other newer Swensen's shops which tend to be brighter and colourful. This location seems to look a lot simpler; probably staying as close to the original decor as possible.

The flavours were amazing and I think it took me a solid 10 minutes to decide what I wanted. I mean, this is historic and it's got to be the perfect ice cream =). I decided to get the Swiss Orange Chip while my partner got the Peanut Butter Chocolate. They were dense, creamy and there's small dollops of frozen peanut butter in the PBC, it's almost like eat PB directly from a tub. Phe-no-me-nal!

The downside is, I don't find the staff very friendly though. We stood there for 10 minutes and they didn't even suggest anything. They didn't have to but it would be nice.
author: Kwoky L.

description: Great place for lunch dessert! Super delicious caramel marble ice cream and strawberry milk shake! Good prices and excellent customer service!
author: C G.

description:
After Za's -- this used to be our next stop. Oh the good old days!

We had to continue the tradition...thus...after Za's w/the family, we all trekked up here (no more than 20 steps away) and there was a line already! 

I had a single of chocolate chip ~ my goodness, it was delicious! There were chocolate chip galore! I forgot what the rest of the party had b/c I was in la la land! 

I think our total for 7 single was under $30 -- again, can't beat that! 

PS: not sure if it's CASH only but just bring cash if you're planning on stopping by.
author: Cath M.

description:
Been going to Swensen's forever...well as long as I've been in the neighborhood any way.  Their quality is consistently good and flavors galore!  I've been going for years for my peppermint ice cream and just recently discovered the joy of venturing outside of my comfort zone and tried their delicious French vanilla custard which is out-of-this-world great!  Always make a point to stop by from Okoze for my after sushi dessert and people watch standing outside on a hot summer night....I mean ANY night.  

Sugar cone is my fav but as someone said go there for their hot-off-the-grill waffle cones on Sat mornings and make a brunch out of it!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
This is a great ice cream parlor for classic flavors. Sure they don't have all the super unique flavors like honey lavender or balsamic strawberry or salted caramel, but some times simple is better. 
My favorites here are probably the green tea and the lychee. Here's a tip, try them together! The texture of the ice cream is smooth and creamy. You really can't go wrong. Pick your favorite flavor, walk down to Jones, sit on the stairs at the top of the hill and enjoy your ice cream and the nice scenery....of course it would be best do to this on a sunny day.
author: Grace C.

description: Delicious scoops of ice cream in a waffle cone!
author: Elise G.

description:
SWISS ORANGE CHIP.  

Also, I really like how Swenson's offers a small/junior scoop for only $2.70 because it seems like most ice cream places in SF besides Swenson's and Mitchell's start at $3.25 or $3.50 for a single, which is usually too big anyways.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
My go-to ice cream selection is Cookies & Cream. Yes sometimes I like to experiment with new flavors, but other times I'm just going to stick with the one I KNOW I will get great pleasure from consuming. Especially if a part of me is going to feel guilty after.....

Well Swensen's is super yummy. Plus it's in one of my favorite hoods in the city, so it makes the experience even better. The Cookies & Cream cup of ice cream did not disappoint. Actually it was very very tasty! Definitely going back next time I get to dine in this area. 

Oh and the whole guilty pleasure part? Non-existent considering there were many others waiting in line with smiles on their faces. How can you feel bad after that?
author: Sonya D.

description:
600+ reviews and counting and there's a reason: Swensen's is so good you feel like you should go to a confessional afterwards. The sticky chocolate is so sinfully delicious that it should be a crime! 
With a wide variety of flavors, you can't go wrong and the kids working here are typically pretty generous with the servings as well.
This is one of the gems of Russian Hill, and right on the line for the cable cars if you're visiting and taking one.
Heads up though, cash only!
author: Muz H.

description:
A lot of people who know their ice cream can pick out a flavor with ease. Maybe I'm just not nuanced, but Swensen's is one of the only places where I can pick out so many of their flavors so easily. Their Sticky Chewy Chocolate is unlike anything I've had before.

My only issue might be that the service is 100% no-frills. These guys aren't mean or bad by any means, but they are very no-nonsense.

Cash only.
author: Paul C.

description:
After a long day of wandering the streets of SF checking out the neighborhood's million dollar homes, the old factory turned mall, the coastal scenes, it was time for some ice cream. Our hostess, Alex, knew just the place to go. 
Swensen's is the idyllic ice cream shop, simple but gets the job done with a variety of flavors.
I got the lychee ice cream. There was chunks of Lychee in it. Really amazing. Dolce's was still on the mind... but 3 cones for $7.50 is a pretty agreeable price.
author: David M.

description:
Highly recommended. It is great ice cream and a good price.

Cons - parking sucks., They only accept cash, and no place to enjoy your ice cream.
author: Roger A.

description:
The best ice cream I have had in all of SF! And the portions are generous. 

Cookies n cream is simply Devine. I'm  typically more of a mint chocolate chip person, which is still pretty amazing here, but the cookies and cream really can't be beat. 

My only problem with this place is that they aren't open Monday. But it's probably good for my diet.
author: Katie J.

description: I don't know that this place is over-the-top good, but it's definitely the creamiest ice cream I've ever had! If you have dinner in the area, you should definitely stop here afterward for dessert. Try the Turtle Caramel or the Sticky Chewy Chocolate. Good stuff!
author: Riz W.

description: I come here for the sticky chew chocolate peanut butter ice cream! Oh man it's good. They service is always quick and done with a smile. Be aware: They only take cash!
author: Whitney S.

description:
When my husband and I came here one night after a late (and delicious) seafood dinner at a nearby quaint restaurant, we didn't know of its popularity.

The service was so-so. The gentleman (kid) behind the counter wore no smile, and seemed very frustrated when patrons couldn't make up their mind (it's tough to pick ONE flavor...).

My husband had a cone, I had a cone. His was caramel-delicious, whereas mine... it wasn't that memorable, but it did hit the ice cream spot. We giggled our way down the street, licking our ice cream cones and reflecting on the night. Ah, to be kids again.

Recommended if you're looking for a yummy cool treat. Prices are fair.
author: Erin O.

description: Good old-style ice cream with waffle cones.
author: Bosco H.

description:
Sticky.

The awesome "sticky chewy chocolate" light ice cream.

The Muni ride home if you decide to indulge without proper napkins.

The history. Stuck on SF since 1948.
author: Jason B.

description: DUH! SF classic. I can't add what hasn't already been said. JUST. GO!
author: Meredith M.

description:
A single cone, is still under $3! 

There is no place to sit, but that's okay. 

How can I describe ice cream?! It's just good ice cream! Nothing I've ever tasted that I could buy at my local Safeway's. You just need to try it.

FYI
Good luck finding parking. 
No more Lemon flavor ice cream
author: Jess W.

description: Traditional flavors, traditional tastes. If you're looking for that old school ice cream shop feel, this is it. I'm a bit of a sucker for a traditional mint chocolate chip and this place does it.
author: Amy L.

description: I've been going to this place since I was really small. I remember my grandpa taking me here for a scoop of orange sorbet and sitting on the stairs outside the house. It was always a nice treat after going to Chinatown, hahaha. As I got older I started to go for the strawberry ice cream with real strawberries, Rockie Road, black raspberry marble and more. As old as I get I still love going there when I can. I also used to love watch making the ice cream.
author: Melanie T.

description: flavors are ok. not very eclectic. green tea was bland. lychee wasn't bad. overall, just average.
author: Ryan B.

description: Seriously tasty treats to be had here! Friendly, welcoming staff in cute as a button Russian hill.
author: Susan A.

description:
Drawn in by a scoutmob offer for free ice cream.  Though Swensen's is a widely distributed, though not all that big, worldwide chain - this shop is old school - a small space with just a counter and flavors posted up on a board.  Surprisingly, they have some very creative flavors available - and some nice seasonal stuff as well.  Got Swiss Orange Chip - we almost never like chocolate flavored ice creams, but this one was very good.  Also tried Pumpkin, which was decent.  The ice cream is not quite ... high end ... but the flavors are strong and the texture is good, if slightly chewy.

However ... be warned that THERE IS NO PARKING.  Well, there's a $15 garage just next door actually, but no street parking within many many blocks and many many vertical feet.  It's nearly at the top of the hill.  We drove around a bit, but the only reason we'd come back is if we were in the neighborhood already and needed ice cream.  It's a pity for those of us coming from far away that there are some gems in San Francisco which are nearly impossible to visit simply because there's no place to put a car anywhere reasonably close.
author: Albert H.

description: Excellent coffee ice cream here, and they will pack you a pint right on the spot. My only critique is that the selection is a bit limited overall.
author: Captain B.

description:
Solid ice cream with no frilly favors or fancy tricks- just good ol' fashioned ice cream. Got the custard French vanilla (I believe it's called, something along those lines) and the cookies n cream all scooped onto a sugar cone. Ice cream was chewy-ish, creamy, and flavorful. What more could you ask for? Yum!

Store is very tiny, there's just enough room to stand and order (if theres a line). Just by that, you can tell this is a no nonsense kind of place... I like!

Cash only & parking takes forever. So take advantage if you find that rare parking spot and go somewhere nice nearby for dinner and come here for dessert :)
author: Audrey Y.

description:
great banana and cookies and cream!
Fudge syrup is delicious!!
my bf likes the milkshakes
service always nice and friendly!!
author: Dee N.

description: I got the regular chocolate ice cream and ended up throwing it away after a few licks. It tasted like freezer burn and had some nail polish-y smell. You'd think a basic flavor would be hard to mess up
author: M N.

description:
With the popularity of gelaterias and creameries that serve out-there flavours in SF, old-fashion ice cream parlors like Swensen's seem ironically novel nowadays. Being a fan of the chocolate-orange combo, I got a small cone of swiss orange chip for $2.70 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cf6el4kGXe686x4Kb6F18Q?select=-BS4Cz6rBmPtGmAWRdj5Eg). It was incredibly decadent and I don't even want to think about the % milk fat they use. The chocolate chips added a nice crunch and though there was a nice chocolate orange flavour, I prefer the chocolate orange gelato at Naia.

I also sampled the Turkish coffee (yum!) and bittersweet chocolate (not as intense as I would've expected).
author: Steph L.

description: Ice cream was great, my family are big fans of the sticky chewy chocolate, grew up with Swensons in Huntington Beach, nice seeing this place each time we visit San Fran
author: Danny C.

description:
Never had Swensen Ice Cream before and I didn't crave any desserts from Zarzuela across the street so decided to venture here.

I got the toasted almond $2.95 for a 3oz small cup or cone but I wasn't too impressed with the overpowering flavor. 

I sampled the "sticky chewy chocolate" and "chocolate malt". Both were okay.  

No seats inside this corner store. Hard to find parking.

I still prefer Bi-Rite.
author: Jboogie L.

description: Love it! I remember back in the days when they gave out free ice cream for Halloween. Growing up in SF rocked. Cookies 'n Cream FTW.
author: Vanessa K.

description: I love this mom&pop ice cream shop! The staff is pretty friendly and will let you try different flavors. They definitely have a great selection of unique flavors such as taro and red bean. It is a bit of a walk from the Embarcadero area, and uphill I might add, but I have  done it a few times. However, once I tasted Swensen's ice cream, the difficult hike to get there was well worth it.
author: Jean L.

description:
Love it! Super nice and creamy. They gave me a lot too!

The employees are pleasant as well. 

The only thing is, there's no place to sit.
author: Emily Y.

description:
I came here during a recent trip to San Francisco. By most standards this ice cream shop is small and does not any indoor seating. Though if your coming here at night chances are your not minding to brave the cold for a little dessert. I tried a few flavors out and not fan of the green tea ice cream.  

Pros: 
Great location, if your a pedestrian the uphill trek will be worth it.
Fine selection in tunes
Friendly staff.
The tip jar never seems to be empty

Cons:
No indoor seating.
 Finding parking, if you decide to drive.
author: Gabriel A.

description:
Came in here to enjoy some ice cream on a somewhat long walk back home with the boyfriend. The place is your average looking neighborhood ice cream shop, more old fashioned. Ice creams were all covered up (I think they were closing soon) so I didn't get a chance to look over all the flavors lol. Got to try two and chose the toasted almond. It was delicious, very creamy and more traditionally flavored than Bi-Rite, which tastes lighter and airier. Got it scooped into a waffle cone and enjoyed!

Boyfriend got the root beer float and seemed to like it. I'm not much for root beer so my judgement is clouded by that, ha.

I will definitely try to come back when in the neighborhood.
author: Sam H.

description: Reward is up at the top of the hill.  I can never find a parking space to stop, grab, and go.  I haven't been here for so long.  The strawberry didn't have the same amount of strawberries and the chewy chocolate wasn't chewy at all.  What is up with that?  It was still good and very chocolaty.  What the hey?  Let's dip it in chocolate.  The thing melted and dripped immediately.  Just take a good stack of napkins and do some quick licking.
author: Helen L.

description:
yum!! the perfect example of an original san francisco treat. located right in the heart of the city, on a mid-hill street corner, with a perfect view of the hyde street cable car running by right next to it. 

i've been coming here since i was a kid, and swensen's always hits the spot. my favorite flavors are the banana and green tea. i'm not a fan of chocolate ice cream in general, but i've also heard that the chocolate flavor at swensen's is on point.

$3.15 for a small 1 flavor. and by small, it's only describing the size of the cup. i'm always amazed at how much ice cream can be packed into a cup that small!

parking may be a bit difficult, but there's a stretch of ten minute parking spots right outside the ice cream parlor along hyde street. so hopefully you'll get lucky!

cash only!

remember one last thing before you throw your receipt into the trash - if you have a red star on the back of the receipt, your ice cream is free!
author: Caitlin C.

description: LOVE Swensen's! Maybe I'm just biased because I've been coming here since I was a child and every time I walk in, a wave of sweet childhood nostalgia sweeps over me.. Buuuut really, this place is great. They have all your classic, old-school flavors and the ice cream is deliciously rich and creamy. Try the caramel turtle fudge!!
author: Vivian C.

description: Swensen's Ice Cream is far from the ice cream belt of the Mission (Humphry Slocombe, Bi-Rite, Mitchell's). I usually don't make it out this far but on a recent night with the warm weather decided to make the trek up the hill to check it out. Swensen's is a little shop with more classic offerings than you'd find at the other places I mentioned. I had heard good things about their sticky chewy chocolate but sampling it decided I liked the sticky peanut butter better. They were sadly out of waffle cones, obviously unprepared for the rush that comes when the mercury tops 70 in the city. The ice cream here is pretty tasty but it's definitely a draw back that there's no indoor seating as San Francisco is not really a place where eating ice cream outside is always fun.
author: Stephen S.

description:
I must add.. The ice cream stays creamy even after sitting in your freezer for a week or two! (I probably shouldn't be eating 2 week old ice cream, but it still tastes fresh!) Now, that's quality :)

Oh, and CASH ONLY (I don't remember if I said this in my first review).
author: Allie E.

description:
Homemade ice cream.... that is sold... not in a home... WHAT IS THIS SORCERY?! 

Swensen's does some magic making in the back or SOMETHING because their ice cream has such a homey and refreshing taste. It seriously reminds me of my child hood. Simple, clean, tasty flavors. You can't go wrong. Especially when you get two scoops of mango ice cream in a waffle cone.

Who just bought their ticket to heaven? I did. :)!


Tips: Park wherever you can! Although...this tip applies to pretty much all of SF.
author: Jon N.

description:
San Francisco is famous for Chinatown, Alcatraz, and Fisherman's Wharf as well as Swenson's... I have been bringing my tourist sightseeing out of town visitors here for years. 

I remember about 22 years ago when they took out their seating next door. I just barely remember another SF Swenson's with seating that my oldest would take us to when home visiting from college, I have had several first dates, weekend dates, and summer dates at Swenson's, all before the age of 10! I went on alot of dates with four older sisters and four older brothers, the youngest girls were what my parents considered the perfect passion killer on their dates. 

Sticky Chewy Chocolate has been my long time favorite since they changed Swiss orange chip from having mini chocolate chips to chunks. 

But this last visit with Lydia F. to one of our must stops on our day trip to the city was a big disappointment for me. My sister ran in to get me a cone of SCC and herself a pint of SCC as I doubled parked in the bus stop half way on the cable car tracks (who knew cable cars have blow horns?) 

With my first bite of SCC I thought maybe my sister got me just plain chocolate. It was missing it's rich chocolaty sticky and yes chewy but not in a bubble gum type of way usual flavor and texture. 

I will continue to make a Swenson's stop when my out of towner visitors come for a visit since we will be in the neighborhood and it holds great childhood memories for me. 

Bring your CA$H or checks.... they don't do plastic!
author: Serra S.

description: The cookies 'n cream (my ice cream staple ever since I was a little kid) definitely does not disappoint here.  It was so good.  I also love the cute decor/easy neighborhood location.  I can't wait to come back.  Delicious.
author: Mel G.

description:
There is absolutely positively nothing like Swensens Ice Cream! Forget Bi-rite and all their unique different flavors! Swensens is the original stuff, the real deal! They have about 20 different flavors from mint chocolate, cherry garcia, strawberry, turkish coffee (which is the BEST flavor), all those original yummy flavors. 

This place has been around since my dad was a kid and let me tell you that was a LONG time ago! (Sorry Dad) He's lactose intolerant and he still wants swensens all the time! I have been coming here since I could remember and it has never changed, not one bit. There is still the tile black and white flooring, with their ice cream maker off to the left side, the freezer to the right side for the ones who want a half gallon full, and the friendly workers behind the counter. Theres just nothing like it. 

When I come here I usually don't just get a scoop, I'm guilty of getting the whole shabang of half a gallon. Its about $3.25 for one scoop and $9.50 for a half gallon, for $6 more, you may as well get it all :) In my house of four, it'll be gone in about 4 days, it is TO DIE. 

The only downside is the parking here, it sucks. Most customers just double park in the driveway of the car repair shop next door to run in for some heaven. Oh, and its cash only! 

Give it a try, you will keep coming back over and over again!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I came here on a Sunday afternoon with my husband, my friend, and my friend's boyfriend since my friend and her boyfriend were visiting from Chicago. We walked from the Ghiradellhi Square area, which is a bit of a hike but good exercise if you're up for it. 

We came here because we'd seen the great reviews on yelp. I couldn't decide what I wanted, so I sampled lots of flavors. The person behind the counter was nice about it and didn't complain. My husband got the fresh banana ice cream, which was really, really good. I'm not a fan of banana, and all the other flavors were just ok but nothing special. I would have preferred Ben & Jerry's or Ghiradellhi or the Safeway brand. 

The place is also really small with no seating so we stood on the street corner as we ate. It also only accepts cash so my friend had to run across the street to an ATM at the convenience store (kind of annoying). The prices didn't seem outrageous (or maybe I just don't remember), so at least that was good.
author: Lisa M.

description: Fantastic ice cream place. A little bit on the expensive side, but definitely worth every penny.
author: Scoot S.

description: Smooth n creamy ice cream you just want to keep savoring. Had the best toasted almond....Mmmmmmm :)
author: Cindy L.

description:
Next time, I'm just gonna go for it and not screw around with the light flavors..

My boyfriend's raspberry marble was delicious, but my thin mint was so not the business.
author: Valerie H.

description: Peanut butter + banana. Unlikely but great combo. I was craving a milkshake and it was so delicious. Definitely felt like a little kid again.
author: Vandy P.

description: Excellent.  At first, I thought it was a bit pricey for a tiny cup, but they pack in the small so it's actually a nice amount if you just want a little something after a meal.  I stuck with basic chocolate and it's dark and not too over-powering.  Can think of any improvements they need to make.
author: Marc S.

description:
We bought some ice cream here for the boyfriend's "31 flavors" birthday party I recently threw him.  We got the vanilla caramel swirl and thin mint.  I didn't care too much for the thin mint, it was just ok...but the vanilla swirl was pretty good.  It's not the best ice cream I've had in the city (Mitchells wins that one) but I prefer it so much more than Bi-Rite or Humphrey Slocombe.

I also appreciate that there's no huge line and the staff is quick and efficient.
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
I've been coming to Swensen's since I was 6 years old!  This is old-fashioned high fat, clog your arteries ice cream.  My favorites since childhood have been strawberry (with big chunks of strawberries and strawberry syrup in it) and the mocha fudge is absolutely divine - coffee ice cream with big swirls of liquid chocolate running throughout.  I'm sure they have other delicious flavors but I'm a creature of habit - I stick with what I like.   They will combine two flavors in a Swensen's quart which is nice - you can have them do it vertically (side by side) if you want to eat them together.  They will also give you a free sample of anything on a spoon to taste in the store (I always get french vanilla and give it to my dog!) ...oh, and their sorbets are good too.

They have a revolving door of high school kids who scoop for you ... they don't zero out the scale when they pack the pints and quarts, so make sure that you get an extra ounce, weight-wise, because the container weighs just under an ounce.  Most of the people who pack the pints/quarts overpack so you usually get the full value of what you are buying.
author: Alexandra D.

description: Without any doubt THE VERY BEST lemon sorbet ice cream I've ever had. Highly recommended to cool down on a warm SF day.
author: Patricia D.

description:
Fresh, flavorful, extra-creamy.  I love Swensen's ice cream so much, I can no longer eat Ben and Jerry's ice cream.  It makes me sick (I wrinkle my face in disgust) to open a pint of Ben and Jerry's and look at it because it looks and smells bad (too sweet, not fresh) compared to a fresh, hand-packed pint of Swensen's.  Even Mitchell's is so-so to me now.

Favorite flavors: Lychee or Cookies 'n Cream
author: Diana C.

description: I love everything about this place. The ice cream is SO good. Who knew homemade ice cream would be so much better? The mango and lychee are my favorite. The cookies and cream has a ton of Oreos in it so that's delicious as well. I'm pretty sure you'll love whichever flavor you get from here. The waffle cones are the best I've had. The workers are all really nice and patient, even during the crazy rushes. Definitely give this place a try!
author: Cicily C.

description:
Green Tea and Turkish Coffee are my favorites.

Thank you for being so close to my apartment. I love you. But why must you be closed on Mondays?
author: Cheri R.

description:
Now that I've found Swensen's in San Francisco, I'm not going anywhere else when I get a craving for ice cream.  

I grew up in Taiwan on Swensen's.  My dad would drop me off in front of the store every Friday afternoon after picking me up from school and I'd run in to get it.  It was always the same.  Double scoops of Stick Chewy Chocolate every single time.

As a grownup, I have a little more self-control.  I'd get half and half Coffee and Sticky Chewy Chocolate.  You wouldn't be able to talk to me while I'm eating it.  I won't pay attention to you. 

The Swensen's on the corner is lovely .. very old school and your orders get processed very quickly.  No parking, barely any standing room .. it's best that you get your ice cream and be on your happy way.  

Please don't close .. ever.  I'd cry.
author: Kimberly C.

description: Ehh. 3 stars only. I was pretty excited to try Swensen's Ice Cream just because of the reviews. However, after trying it, I was a bit disappointed and not amazed. Swensen's Ice Cream isn't like Bi-rite nor Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous Ice Cream. Swensen offers the classic type of ice cream flavors that you can find elsewhere and once in awhile, a few unique flavors. None of the flavors really stood out to me. We were around the area one night because we had reservations at one of the restaurants nearby. Since we were early, we decided to grab some dessert before dinner (we had a pretty late reservation). We ordered a small size Swiss Orange Chip flavor to share. I thought the flavor was just alright. There were small bits of chocolate in the ice cream with an orange flavor taste. The chocolate ice cream was very rich, which was a bit too much for me. I think the ice cream in general was very creamy and thick. As for service, the guys working that night did not seem too happy to be working. They looked miserable and looked like they didn't want to be there. They should at least not show that to the customers! Geez..  As for parking, it is a nightmare! Make sure you're ready to circle around the blocks for awhile!
author: Philana C.

description:
"That'll be $10 each," "She told me you were rich," "That will be $10 each"... the server at Swenson's sounded a bit like a broken record last night with the same jokes over and over and over again... quite a jokester! But at least the ice cream was yummy...

We headed to Swensen's after a date at Frascati. I had the mint chip and my date opted for the Turkish  coffee and sticky gooey chocolate. His ice cream made me really want to try an actual Turkish coffee. And I was so satisfied with the generous serving of yummy chocolate chips in my mint ice cream. Yummy and luckily not really $10 each...
author: Meghan P.

description:
I absolutely love Swensen's. I live in the neighborhood and look forward to going to get ice cream at this place. 

The absolute perfect combination (and my order everytime...) is a hot fudge sundae with peppermint stick and and thin mint ice cream... it can be yours today for $5.50!

Please note it is CASH ONLY! 

The workers at Swensens are dedicated and clearly work very hard. They are always friendly, willing to give samples, and they really give the place a nice, local feel.
author: A H.

description: Good old fashioned ice cream served by friendly folks.  The Sticky Chewy Chocolate w/peanut butter was amazing.  Of course parking in Russian Hill is nearly impossible - tho walking up the hill will help "earn" your scoop.  =)
author: Kim S.

description:
When we had a dessert failure at a nearby restaurant we came here.

I had a licorice ice cream.  It was fabulously good, the best ice cream I have ever had and am planning future trips to San Francisco just to go there.  However, I'm guessing they only have it with the pumpkin at this time of year - Halloween.  I forgot to ask.  Yelp* it if you find out please.

P.S. Licorice is BLACK!  It's not red, green, cherry, strawberry, orange, mango, tutti-fruity, et al.  IT'S BLACK!  JUST BLACK!

Don't remember what my date of 34 years had but I know she liked it.
author: David U.

description:
The ice-cream is creamy and very tasty. I am torn between giving it 4 or 5 stars. Bi-Rite is 5 stars in my books, but I haven't been back there in too long. 

The sticky chewy chocolate will definitely satisfy any chocolate craving and the chocolate cookie dough is always good.

Since this place is just up the street, I will definitely be coming here when I have an ice-cream craving. I no longer need Ben & Jerry's anymore.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I should be sent far far away from the Russian Hill neighborhood for coming here today for my first time in four years of living in the hood. Maybe because I finally decided to start walking instead of taking the bus on my daily commute. But honestly, I was just too tempted after seeing like 20 school kids leave Swensen's with the biggest smiles on their cute little faces and skipping away in joy.

There's one thing missing here and I'm a bit disappointed: Nutella! But no worries, I can just buy a jar. I really enjoyed these flavors: Lychee, Sticky Chewy Chocolate, Fresh Banana, Midnight Brownies, and Cherry Bordeaux. Nelso was very nice and gave me a cone. I felt like a little kid again. 

Sometimes there's nothing better in the world than Ice Cream. The best part is only having to walk up one pretty crazy hill to have some, you dont need to commute all the way to the mission for Bi-rite, Mitchell's or Humpry Slocombe. Swensen's is just as wonderful!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Love SWENSENS!! been coming here since i was in high school!!! Friendly service and great Ice cream! can never go wrong with the original flavors!
author: Bruce L.

description: Classic ice cream shop, but nothing too special. Cash only. Nice neighborhood setting, with the cable cars running by.
author: Lauren P.

description:
I LOVE SWENSEN"S! Maybe I am Biased because I grew up on this lovely creamy perfect delight. I think they have the best vanilla ice cream. And the BEST Thin mint, toasted almond, and rocky road! MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM. You can take the cable car right in front of this place, and then go check out the view from this hill top!
oh and if you get a red star on your receipt, youget like five dollars off or free icecream basically!
Come here on Halloween and get a free delicious vanilla ice cream cones. This place is so awesome, the celebrities go here! yay
author: Victoria L.

description:
Decided to take a hike from dinner on Octavia to here...man it was a crazy hill walk! 

All ice-cream are made on the house, not bad yet a bit sweet for me.
author: Linh D.

description:
Been going here since I was a kid. My mom used to take me here all the time. One of the best childhood memories that I have. They really do know how to make you feel at home. I always wanted to receive a red star! Their ice cream is the best I have ever had. The strawberry ice cream is made out of real strawberries unlike most place! You get big chunks of strawberries. 

I love the freshness of the ice cream and the original taste it has.
author: Matti L.

description: Delicious ice cream! And wonderful waffle cone!! It's a cash only place so be prepare!!!
author: Katie E.

description:
Is the ice cream worth the 20 minutes it might take you to find parking? Debatable. I circled around forever, eventually had to have my friend get out and get us ice cream....continued to circle, eventually found her waiting at the corner as I was circling, and ate it on the drive back home.

I wasn't particularly impressed with the mint chocolate chip ice cream I had. The little chips of chocolate were so hard and chewy. I'll just say that I've had a lot better, e.g. Bi rite.

Lots of good ratings so I want to try it again with other flavors, but I'm not sure if I can justify the parking for another try.

Didn't include price in my rating, because I wasn't able to get out of my car to buy it. I will say that the line looked long and I thought I was going to have to circle around forever, but the line went pretty quickly.
author: Wendy M.

description: This place is sooo good! They have big chunks of whatever it is that comes in the ice cream, so much flavor. It's definitely a must try if you're in the area. There's nowhere to sit so you can take a nice stroll whilst you enjoy the ice cream. Oh, and cash only. Prices are very reasonable...it's just over $6 for two single scoop cones.
author: Sel B.

description: I've been eating their ice cream since 1985! Sticky Chewy Chocolate was my long term favorite. Turkish Coffee has a unique coffee taste that you can't find anywhere else. A scoop of Orange sorbet mix with Vanilla is definitely refreshing.
author: Grace S.

description: Besides the owner being a little looney trying to make jokes which turned into being kinda annoying, the ice cream here is pretty good. I got the turkish coffee which was super good.
author: Anna H.

description: its a nice old-timey parlor but for how expensive it is ($4 or $5+) I really don't see what they offer that's special compared to other newer dessert spots.  Swensen's just tasted like generic store-bought ice cream to me.
author: Jake L.

description: A great neighborhood ice cream shop with a good variety of flavors. I had the orange chocolate chip and my wife had the rocky road. Both had rich flavor and a nice creamy texture. I don't think it's worth a trip much out of your way, but if you are on Russian Hill and craving something for dessert  I would recommend stopping in.
author: Erik C.

description:
This is definitely a solid spot for ice cream!! They don't have crazy flavors like Bi-Rite or Three Twins here. You typically get the more traditional flavors along with a good assortment of asian flavors (lychee, green tea, etc). But what they're known for on the 7x7 is the Swiss Orange Chip! Usually I don't like chocolate ice cream, but for this I will definitely make an acceptation! If you've ever tasted Terry's Chocolate Ball... the chocolate shaped ball that you would smack on a table and it would split into "orange slices", then you'll know exactly how this ice cream tastes! I couldn't believe it when I tried it! 

TIP: swensen's has two 15min parking spots so that you can get in and out after grabbing a scoop of your favorite ice cream!
author: Kristen C.

description:
I had this Scoutmob (I think) coupon for a free scoop. First of all, this ice cream shop is pretty cute and located in a quaint neighborhood. I decided to try to be "healthy" (yeah right... at a ice cream shop)--so I ordered the LOW FAT sticky/chewy chocolate flavor. I was surprised how generous one scoop was, despite me getting it for free. Anyway, I don't blame Swensen, but the sticky chewy chocolate was alright. I guess that it was low fat that the consistency was off.

However, I did try my roommates' banana and orange swiss chocolate ice cream scoops (normal, not low fat). They were very good! The banana one tasted like real banana, not the gross artificial flavoring kind. The orange swiss chocolate was my favorite. What a great flavor combination that was so refreshing yet luxurious. I would come back again to try other flavors.
author: Vera W.

description: GOSH DARN IT!!!  I hate to say it but Swenson's changed their famous Sticky chewy Chocolate flavor............... I know right??  It now tastes like Hershey's syrup and I was so dissapointed yesterday when we stopped by for my yearly binge......... darn!!!!!!!!  It just wasn't the same flavor I have known since my childhood and dream about each year when I get to do a day of it in the City............... whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!
author: Lydia K.

description:
You've got to love an ice cream shop where the employees can tell you, with a great degree of confidence, the differences between the three vanillas on offer.

The cookies and cream was excellent with serious hunks of cookie goodness.

Whether to celebrate, console or just satisfy your sweet tooth - Swensen's is top notch.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Swensen's is my local ice cream shop, and it's very good. I love the old-fashioned look & feel, and it's hard to beat one of their scoops in a cone (especially mint chocolate chip, sticky chewy chocolate, chocolate peanut butter, ginger, and peppermint when it's in season).

But the 4 stars instead of 5 is because something CAN beat it, and that something is called Bi-Rite. It's probably a good thing that I don't live near Dolores Park, because I would surely gain 100 pounds on Bi-Rite's ice cream alone (or some combination of that and Delfina's pizza right around the corner). 

My guess is that if you're just looking for good old traditional ice cream, Swensen's would be your place. But if you dig the more inventive flavors and the super creamy texture of Bi-Rite's ice cream, then, well, Swensen's can be your neighborhood next-best that is within walking distance (but is separated from you by a big hill, preventing you from going multiple times per week).
author: Emily A.

description: I don't understand why people are so jazzed about this place.  I've eaten here twice, and is it "horrible," no.  But is it anywhere near "the best," definitely not.  I got two flavors to go - chocolate chip cookie dough & chocolate peanut butter..sounds like a win win.  Imagine my surprise to not find any, that's right ANY peanut butter in my entire cup.  There also was maybe 3 pieces of cookie dough.  That could've been overlooked, had it been the "amazing" ice cream everyone claims it is...but honestly, it was blah.  I'd rather spend 50 cents more and get a pint of Ben & Jerry's - better quality and would last way longer.    Will not be going back to this place...I just don't get the hype.
author: Jake H.

description:
Adorable Spot. Not Ridiculously Crowded. Pure Lactose Perfection.

For a lady who is denial of her lactose intolerance, this place is worth the belly ache.  An old-fashion shop that doesn't have the bells and whistles like the fancy pants Bi-Rite spot which I too love.

The ice cream is classic flavors, with a couple unique ones sprinkled in, in a shop where the family behind the counter is serving it up with a smile.

- Almond ice cream was heavenly.  Perfectly sweet and nutty! I wanted to just bathe in it. But brrr... Still delish delish delish.
- Cookies and Cream: It's a hard one to mess up.  But this on is perfectly creamy and classic.
- Grean Tea: It's Classic and Asian. And I loved it.

Swensens is super charming and low key.  It was busy a bit, but you politely wait and smile. :)
author: Natalie G.

description: I love this place and have from childhood. Their chocolate ice creams are just outstanding. It's a great fun place. It's too bad their numerous locations closed their doors. :(
author: Michael S.

description:
Good ice cream.  Plenty to choose from.  They also have a few sherbets and sugar-free/low-cal options.

Some scoopers are generous...others are stingy.  You've been warned.

Cash only.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Swensen's has the look and feel of a classic ice cream shop, and delivers a solid scoop.

Although it was difficult to find parking around the neighborhood with many of the spaces being one square too short, the Swiss Orange Chip scoop that was free courtesy of Scoutmob made it a worthwhile venture.  The sweet, creamy flavor and fresh, crispy sugar cone seemed perfect for the holiday season.

I will definitely consider Swensen's if in the area!
author: Andrew M.

description:
Its really truly hard to say anything negative about free ice cream!

After being blessed with a free small ice cream from Swensen's, compliments of ScoutMob, I went one frozen night to reap my rewards.  I tried the chocolate peanut butter in a sugar cone, which was pretty good.  I say "pretty" instead of "spectacular", "fantastic", or even "delightful" because I found mine to be a bit too sweet and rich.  My friend noted that my decision was based on the fact that I chose a richer flavor, since she thoroughly enjoyed her cup of cookies and cream!  Unfortunately, I was not able to finish my whole cone (even tho it was a small) and was disappointed, although I blame the near snow-like weather for putting me in a less than interested ice cream mood!  That is not to say I would not be back if I find myself in the neighborhood on a warmer, more "ice cream friendly" day.
author: Pb J.

description: Kids saw the shop and decided they wanted to have ice cream so we stopped in. MISTAKE! I'm totally into customer service since I have my own business and this shop's customer service today was terrible. Maybe they didn't like each other or something but I was really hoping that at least one of them had customer service experience. No hello, barely a smile,  no genuine care that we were even there. Just went with sub par service to serve up our cones and send us off our merry way. So sorry to bother you! No problem Swenson's (on Hyde)- you'll never have to worry about seeing us again! :-( And your ice cream wasn't even all that! Customer service is huge in any business!
author: Gem G.

description: seriously the best ice cream i have had in the bay area. their sticky, chewy chocolate is decadent, divine, and down right DELICIOUS. the flavor of the chocolate itself is truly wonderful and rich. i can't speak of any of their other flavors because i can't get myself to order anything else. but that's okay because their sticky chewy choc is everything i want in ice cream - its classic, simple, and superb. And that is exactly what swensen's delivers!
author: Asmita J.

description:
Great ice cream at a very low price! We got Swiss orange chip and it is chocolaty and yet zesty! What a treat:) They keep the old decor and interior inside too. 

Too bad there is no seating.
author: Athena C.

description:
PROLOGUE:
Humphry Slocombe is still my favorite ice cream joint in SF. I have yet to find a flavor to rival the Secret Breakfast. 

REVIEW: 3.5 Stars
Swensen's is a great place to grab some ice cream after dinner. Walking from downtown to Russian Hill is great way to walk off your dinner in order to negate that with some ice cream.

It has a retro Americana atmosphere but no seating.
Their flavors are pretty typical and standard. I got the Turkish Coffee, I highly recommend it to any coffee connoisseur. 

The service is not bad but the guys who were behind the counter did not want to be there. At least their facial expression told that. 

Cash only.
Parking is not ample.
author: Tony N.

description:
Good stuff.

I enjoy the cookie dough ice cream, and this other one I had that was chocolate with a caramel ribbon. mmmmmmm.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Swesons, I love you and your ice cream. Whenever we have a warm day it's so much fun to walk up Hyde to grab a cone or scoop at swensons. Gotta love the cherry ice cream (YUM! big chunks of dried cherries) and anything with chocolate is good as well.

My fingers are always crossed that I get a red star on my receipt... still trying though!
author: laura f.

description: Yum! The toasted almond ice cream was to die for!!! I had the banana as well which was good. Great place. No seating and cash only. Overall it was great. I would go back for sure
author: Ashlee S.

description: I grew up in montebello ca and this was the go to place for excellent ice cream.  These shops disappeared from the Los Angeles area in the late 1980s.  I was pleased. To find the original on my vacation.  I think this is a must stop for anyone visiting.   Enjoy!
author: Jaque M.

description: I've been to this little ice cream place twice. Both on different trips to San Fran. This is a must stop. If you have a rental car, perfect but parking might be tight. I would recommend taking a street car that stops right by the shop. I've only had the sticky chewy peanut butter and its amazing. Stupid good! They are quick and prepare yourself for a little wait since the line is normally outside.
author: Kyle A.

description: Not bad, but compared to Bi-Rite, it's not the same. Just okay, not great or spectacular.
author: Adam L.

description: Really incredible ice cream and great service. I happened to get a red star on my receipt so they comped my order.
author: Ryan Y.

description: I love the ice-cream, it was very creamy and smooth and oh so delicious!! The staff working was also extremely friendly.  I rarely give 5 stars but this place earn my 5 stars. It was a clean and quite organized place and if I lived in San Francisco, I wish I did, I would be at Swensen's Ice Cream every night. Well worth getting a little overweight for!
author: Simon W.

description:
Uh oh.. I shouldn't have come here. It is far too close to my apartment. 

Sometimes when I am hungover I just really want a milkshake against my better judgement. Lactose... either a great idea or the WORST idea, you know? So I walked up the hill to Swensen's and was slightly overwhelmed by how many flavors and options they have. I tried the banana (my usual fav) and it was delicious, but in this moment I needed a cookies n cream milkshake and I was even more amped that they have a "light" option... made me feel better about my shamble of a Sunday. 

Unfortunately for my skinny jeans... I will be back.
author: Molly S.

description: As cold as the weather is, I enjoyed a single scoop of lychee ice cream in a cup. It was sooo good! Service was pretty good and the workers are super funny!  It's well worth bearing the cold winds while eating such a delicious and creamy ice cream.
author: Joyce W.

description:
The best strawberry ice cream in town!!!!! 

TIP: If you buy a tub to take home, make sure to ask for "hand-packed" strawberry ice cream. If you take a pre-packed one from the freezer, it won't have the huge strawberry chunks inside! 

Other flavors to note: toasted almond and lychee :)

I've been coming here since I was a kid, and the recipes have not changed one bit. Why change a good thing, right? Definitely worth the trip if you've never been.
author: Denise L.

description: One of the best ice cream shops I've been to. Banana ice cream is always fresh, strawberry ice cream actually has large chunks in there. The chocolate dipped ice cream is fire. definitely 10/10 would come back when in the area.
author: Alex L.

description:
If I have a sweet tooth it is definitely for ice cream.  I can wolf down mind blowing amounts of creamy delicious dairy so when I discovered that a very popular ice cream parlor was nearby I had to try it.

We went late at night so we avoided the line that many reviews are talking about.  It is simple inside and has an old ice cream parlor feel to it.  I sampled a variety of the flavors and the chocolate orange (not sure the official name but they will know what you are talking about if you ask) was amazing!  The other flavors didn't really do much for me though.  I wasn't in love with the texture of the ice cream, it seemed almost artificial and heavy.

This place is solid, just nothing insanely special.  If you want to wait in a huge line for great ice cream head down to the mission, the wait is much more worth it.  If there's no line and you want a special treat I would give it a go.
author: Ryan J.

description: Fast service and super tasty ice cream! The cup, cone, and shake were all good. They're open late on Saturdays and Sundays which makes for a good time to get some late night ice cream. Was a favorite on my trip! Just make sure you bring cash as they don't take a card.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Swensen's is the best "regular" ice cream in SF. I know, you don't typically hear the term regular associated with a 5 star review but my definition is different this time. 

With ice cream parlor's like BiRite Creamery and Humphry Slocomb where they serve flavors called Secret Breakfast (surprise it's Bourbon and cornflakes!)  and salted caramel, regular is really the only definition to use for parlors serving typical flavors. That doesn't mean Swensen's wasn't amazing, though.

I had a scoop of peppermint stick and a scoop of caramel swirl topped with a hefty dollop of hot fudge. Sometimes you don't want fancy flavors. Sometimes you want it basic. Swensen's is the place to go when you feel like ordering something amazing and sweet but...regular.
author: Julia N.

description: I'm a SF Native and it was my first time ever going to Swensen's, damn! I got the Thin Mint and it was so good! Creamy and a ton of chocolate chips! I think it lives up to the hype.
author: Karen T.

description: I will never understand the people who wait in line for Bi-Rite.  Cookies n Cream, Peppermint, Sticky Chocolate, Coffee are all amazingly good and it's been that way for a zillion years or so.  Sorry the caramel isn't "salted," the strawberry doesn't have balsamic vinegar in it, and there's no chile pepper in their chocolate.... but that is not what makes good ice cream
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Swensen's is one of those places where you feel like a kid again.

I grew up coming here for ice cream. Some of my childhood memories stem from this place. I know there are a lot of hype for other ice cream places in the city nowadays. This place will always have a special place in my heart.

It is the original Swensen's ice cream parlor. Small but efficient. Service is always fast. I had the chocolate mint on a sugar cone. Perfect. Sweet. Simple. It made my day.
author: Molly T.

description:
There's nothing quite so nice as a neighborhood ice cream shop on the corner. After dinner on Polk, go for a walk on up the hill on Union Street -...can't miss it.

Open late.
author: J T.

description:
Swensen's is an SF Landmark.

I've heard many anecdotes about this great ice cream place near the windy part of Lombard Street in San Francisco's Russian Hill.

Recently, I read an article of a newspaper interview of Red House Painter lead singer/songwriter Mark Kozelek who took a journalist here.

The ice cream is excellent here.  I ate the chocolate chip. A single scoop on a cone that cost $2.45. 

As there are hills everywhere, you will burn off all the fat you will eat from any ice cream you purchase here.
author: Tony U.

description:
Come on people, this is the original, it's a San Francisco landmark, and it is DAMN good ice cream. Just walk in and smell the waffle cones, the service is fast, and the ice cream is so good!

Bring cash btw, and try as many flavors as you can, I am HUGE fan of good ol' classic strawberry - and one more thing, everyone is on this crack-binge like obsession with frozen yogurt - and don't get me wrong I like fro-yo just like the next guy - but sometimes you gotta just get ICE CREAM!
author: Nate E.

description:
I'm not sure what's so special about this place. I've been here a few times and to me, ....it's just ice cream *shrugs 

nice folks but the sticky chewy chocolate was just chocolate ice cream. no big...

O.o
author: Serena F.

description:
My bf works for muni and drives past this place on the 45 all the time. He's always wanted to try it since there is always a line out the door. 
We shared a mocha chip ice cream when we really wanted plain coffee or mocha. 

Perhaps they have a line out the door because the place is small.. not a lot of standing room, no seats either. 

The ice cream was OK in flavor, the chocolate chips were DISGUSTING. I don't like huge chunks of chocolate and i am a chocolate lover. When you bite into these chips, they get stuck in your teeth. We ended up spitting out the chocolate and enjoying the "just ok" ice cream. 

The people are really nice and the portions are a good size, but the ice cream wasn't special.. I'd totally pick Mitchell's over this place.. perhaps i need to try a different flavor and then fall in love? 

Willing to give it a second chance, but seeing as it's not very accessible.. it will be a while before i go back.
author: J-nine I.

description:
Swensen's ice cream was nowhere near what I thought it would be. They paid a great web designer to make their ice cream parlor look as if it offers millions of flavors and insane sundae combos that would fit any persons' palette. One insanely big thing for me is you could not sit down to eat any of the items, so there was completely no reason to get a large sundae because by the time I carried it to the car, get it over to the apartment, it would be a nice slushy soup.

I got the Rocky Road Sundae in a Waffle cone. My cone was stale and while the Rocky Road did have real marshmallows, it also really tasted like every other Rocky Road I have had in my life, which would be fine, had I not been at this Yelp Loved ice cream parlor.

I don't understand the hype. I also did not appreciate the girl who was frustrated within the first 30 seconds of helping me, I asked if there were real marshmallows in the Rocky Road. That's all, I am sorry if you were having a bad day. But chillio, how can anyone working at an ice cream parlor be that bitter?

Save yourself the trip and the parking, which took me 20 minutes. Mitchell's beats this place hands down, any time, and I'm not even apart of the Mitchell's cult.
author: Winè C.

description:
I ate about it.........

Cookies and Cream is the only reason I have to take so many spin classes each week- it's really that good.  Skip the line and get the pre-made bucket and a spoon on your way out!
author: Kristina I.

description:
Very tasty, very high quality ice cream. 

I recommend just going with the classic: cookies and cream; it's soooo good here!  (It's my favorite).  The huge chunks of real oreo cookies, with oreo logos still intact, are very impressive!
author: Mike G.

description: One of the oldest and best ice-cream shops in the city. As I'm told, this shop has been here for over 50 years? All of their ice-cream is made IN HOUSE. Nothing is outsourced (except ingredients I'm assuming) and everything tastes great. Parking can be hard since it is in Nob Hill and whatever you do, DO NOT park at the bust stop right outside the shop because you can get ticketed by the meter maids. I'd suggest walking here if you can help it or come with more people so someone can move the car or something. They have a lot of seasonal flavors like pumpkin pie during the holidays.
author: edward k.

description:
I seriously don't get the big deal. It's not bad. But it's not fab. 
Bigger scoops if they like you. I think they gave my cousin a big scoop because she was a cutie. Hehe!! 

Small little corner joint. No parking !!! Street parking is such tough luck!!!!Be warned!!
author: Veranna N.

description: Nummy! Coconut flavor is amazing. Parking was nearly impossible. Had to illegally park and cross my fingers I wouldn't get a ticket. Really good little place though.
author: Kathryn M.

description:
Ended up walking in here one rainy night last November. I had heard of it and for some reason... never went out of my way to find it. I was lead there by the night rain and even found a spot outside... coincidence, no... fate! I walked in with my friend and we proceeded to try several flavors. All of them were tasty too. I ended up have mint chocolate chip and dark chocolate with orange peel... I may have the name wrong, but that was in it. At $3.20 a single on a sugar cone... I was a happy camper. 

I don't live close, but it is wort the trip to this little gem.
author: Amelia M.

description:
Friends in the local San Francisco area recommended this place to us for ice cream after dinner.  We came around 10 at night on a cold May evening.  For the LA locals, the quality of the ice cream reminds me of Fossilman's in Alhambra (San Gabriel Valley) but with less flavors.  It wasn't too rich so it was perfect for me.  I ordered a single scoop of mocha almond fudge.  You can definitely taste the mocha and it was good!  The only complaint I have for it was that it was a bit expensive...over $3 for a single scoop?  But a place is worth checking out if you're not from the SF area and want some decent quality ice cream.  The quality wasn't bad, I'm just not sure if you want to pay that much on a regular basis for ice cream!  I heard this place gets crazy and can go out the door but no lines for us when we went in (thank goodness!)

By the way, Swensen's is a franchise ice cream shop...so it's a pretty common place in SF.
author: Michelle T.

description:
I tried several flavors before settling on the Swiss Orange Chip.  None of them were all that special, tasted just like any store bought ice cream.     

I don't understand how this place is rated so high, Bi-Rite is way better with more flavorful ingredients. It's also lame that if you order the two smaller sizes, they only allow you a single flavor.
author: Shane L.

description:
I just don't understand.  Its cream and sugar... how can you go wrong?!  And yet I'm left wanting more... flavor? sweetness? salt? texture?  

So I'm curious as to why this place has received 5 stars.  I understand that it's a San Francisco mainstay, I get that it has a great ambiance, I think its great that they've been around forever.  But I have a confession to make: I have ice cream about every other night (you can call me a fatty, its ok) so I'd like to think I'm a bit of a connoisseur when it comes to ice cream.  And the verdict is: I need more flavor.  If you're a toothpick of a socialite who hasn't had ice cream in ages, I'm sure Swenson's will blow your mind.  But do yourself a favor.  Hop over to the corner store across the street and pick up a pint of Ben & Jerry's
author: Vanessa K.

description: Tasty ice cream. But there are a lot closer and equally expensive ice cream places in the city that have easier parking
author: Jenna H.

description:
A San Francisco staple with some of the best ice cream around.  I always pretend I'm going to try new flavors...but I'm a thin mint in a cone with chocolate sprinkles girl to the core. 

I usually try to convince myself that the walk up the hill from Polk burns off all the calories. It doesn't, but I love it anyway.
author: Katie W.

description: Hard to park to get a bite of ice cream. Its good but Baskin Robins is just a good if you ask me.
author: Henry D.

description: Definitely the best ice cream in the city. Super creamy an delicious. I live pretty far away but go out of my way to go to Swensen's!
author: Gaby A.

description:
Love that Swensen's is open late. However, even though we went right before closing, there was NO parking. We just parked in the bus zone, ran in and got our ice cream and ate near the car to make sure we didn't get a ticket!

I got mango in a sugar cone. Yum! The ice cream was nice and creamy and exquisitely rich. It had a nice depth of mango flavor in there that made it just right and not too overpowering.
