There were two people there manning the store there who I assumed were the owners, dad and son. The dad seemed like a cool, quirky guy who was really in to his ice cream. The son however, just looked miserable being there. At least he let us sample a couple flavors. Whenever I go over to my friend's house near the area, you can count on me making a trip to Swensens :)

Oh, and don't forget! CASH ONLY!
author: Julia K.

description:
Swensen's is really yummy. We went there with my sister today. I got the Sticky Chewy chocolate and she got the Raspberry one. Sooo good. And gueass what? When we finished out ice cream, we went there to get more! :] I got the Turkish Coffee and my sis got the Chocolate Orange. (I wanted to steal her chocolate orange. Yummmmm.)
Definitely 5 stars!
author: ponch l.

description: I have a soft place in my heart for Swensen's despite the fact that I'm lactose intolerant.  Some of my fondest memories growing up were of going to Swensen's for ice cream after school, despite the huge hill on Union Street we had to climb.  Believe me, when you're 12-years-old, it's a helluva lot easier to climb a steep hill than when you're 40, but I digress.... It was always so exciting when one of us got a red star (which meant you got your ice cream for free!).  It took me 40 years, but I finally got one.  Anyway, I look forward to another 40 years of memories getting ice cream at Swensen - yes, in spite of the lactose intolerance.
author: Eric G.

description:
Taint vegan, just good ol fashioned ice cream. Not too sweet, not too creamy. Quite satisfactory. As a testament to their popularity, even on a rainy day a steady stream of fans came in. Absolutely worth a trip up. The thin mint is perfection. 

There are no seats and not a lot of stores to browse in the immediate area, so plan accordingly.
author: Kim K.

description:
My favorite over Humphreys, Mitchells, Bombay, and every other ice cream EVER.

OMFG Cookies and Cream- monster chunks of oreos make me so ridiculously happy I just can't stand it.
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
The perfect place to get classic flavors, nice service, and fresh tasting cones! Usually at night (after dinner hours) they have a bit of a line, but it moves fast. I recommend the Coconut ice cream for anyone out there that likes the fresh coconut in it. 

Swensen's has to go pints, it's not too pricy, and they even have Rootbeer Floats!
author: Natalie N.

description:
I paid $5.95 for the smallest scoop of ice cream I have ever seen.  It was the size of a golf ball.  

Was it good, sure, it was pretty good, but I couldn't get past the price and that I had just been hosed.

I have eaten ice cream at some great places across the country, this isn't one of them.  Go to Coldstone's.  I know it's a chain, but the ice cream is just as good and you get your money's worth.

Swenson's, you have your kool-aid drinkers to bilk and you ought to be ashamed of yourselves.  Good luck with that.
author: Tom K.

description: Terrible customer service. We were served by someone who seemed annoyed that we were even there.  The ice cream was ok, but nothing special.  Also, they only accept cash (which the person quickly and curtly reminded us about when I tried to pay). Won't be returning.
author: Chris R.

description:
OVERALL:3.0   FOOD:3   SERVICE:3   AMBIANCE:3   VALUE:3
Super proud I lasted 3 months in the neighborhood w/o caving for ice cream--I blame global warming and random November heat waves.  Got the seasonal pumpkin (tasted like Thanksgiving & Santa Claus all in one) & swiss chip orange (mm, citrus chocolate creaminess!). Waffle cone was a depressing letdown: stale, and with none of that sweet, waffle-y smell....boooo. Ice cream itself is pretty unexciting, but it really takes some major effing up to actually ruin ice cream, so this still put a smile on my face :)  Shop is barebones, so hike your cone a few blocks to George Sterling Park & enjoy your ice cream with a view of the GG bridge!
author: Amy K.

description:
Not that this needs another review, but what the heck, I'll toss in my two cents.

TASTY.
ICE.
CREAM.

(try the mint chocolate chip. it'll change your mind about this old standard)
author: Liz K.

description:
This place has the best ice cream ever!! They have so many flavors to choose from but my favorite is the Chocolate Fudge Brownie. Last two times I went they didn't have my flavor so that was a bit of a let down.. but Cookies n Creme is my next favorite.

The prices aren't too bad and well...on the few hot days in SF that we do get this is the place to go for Ice Cream!

Four stars because there isn't any seating, it's cash only, and the menu changes so your favorite flavor might one day just go away..
author: Jen L.

description:
I've passed Swensen's a hand-full of times and I've always been curious about it.  When I'd asked my friends, it seemed as if none of them had ever been.  I finally got the chance to go - it was amazing!  They had a ton of different flavors - they had the typical (chocolate, vanilla, strawberry) and some unique (sticky chewy chocolate, bittersweet chocolate, Thin Mint).  I tried three flavors: Cookies and Cream, Sticky Chewy Chocolate and French Vanilla Custard - all were fantastic: rich, creamy, homemade-tasting ice cream.  You can really taste the quality in each bite.  

Before coming here I'd seen/heard of the other "Swensen's" chains, but this has nothing to do with them - those are franchises with the same name and that's it.  So, if you've been curious about this  place, definitely stop by.  As a bonus, the area is very cool as well - very San Francisco.  It's the perfect place to stop by after a dinner date in Russian Hill or after walking up and down those San Francisco hills.
author: Ken G.

description: Yep, we did it - we cheated on Bi-Rite and had Swensen's and I'm soooo glad we did. It was damn near 100 degrees outside and Bi-Rite had like a 4 hour wait. I have no problem waiting for a good thing but in Saturdays heat that was out of the question. We headed over to Swensen's and had ice cream scoops in our hand within about 35 seconds of walking in the door. I did the sticky chocolate with rainbow sprinkles. Yes, I am a 3 year old at heart and after seeing the toddler in front of me get rainbow sprinkles on his cone, I wanted them too! My son had a scoop of chocolate - not sure what the difference is - he said mine was sweeter, I didn't try his. Of course we left a tip, when you have ice cream in hand this quickly you better leave one! Great spot, street parking - most seem to walk over or park and enjoy their cones on the sidewalks. Good stuff! Oh, I'm pretty sure they are cash only.
author: Candace L.

description:
Toasted almond, you had me at hello.  

If you're looking for slightly more traditional flavors, this is the place.  It's sometimes hard to find parking so come with a friend who can drop you off and drive around the block while you get your delicious toasted almond ice cream to go.
author: Kristine B.

description:
Sure, Swensen's is a chain, but this old school location really feels like one of a kind. 

I rarely find myself in quaint Russian Hill, but after experiencing the Swiss Orange Chip ice cream, I have a feeling Russian Hill is going to become more of  a regular destination.
author: Lee H.

description:
Came here with a big group after dinner @ Farmerbrown (ready my review) & I was at first put off by how small & quiet the place was - especially after hearing so much hype about it.

My first impression was way off.  The ice cream was delicious and the place got real busy real quick.  I got a single scoop of Turkish Coffee, the boyfriend got a scoop of Thin Mint, and one of our friends go Very Strawberry.  I couldn't remember what the others got but I think we all stuck with the fundamental flavors.

I liked the mom 'n pop feel of the store but the 2 guys working just did not want to be there at all.  I also like that there were classic flavors as well as some unique ones.  There will definitely be more trips to Swensen's in the future.  I only wish it were easier to get to.
author: Karen S.

description:
I used to walk from Galileo high school to the TL and stopped here to give myself a treat at least once a week. 

I still come here every so often. BUT, when I want it the most, there is no parking, so I get butt hurt and don't come by for a long time. Yeah, I'm sensitive like that. 

It's pretty cheap, it's good, and I love the feel of the store itself. It's like stepping back in time.
author: Jeanette P.

description:
I'm so glad the cab driver recommended this place. We've never heard of it until the cab dropped us off here. The store is super cute and in a great neighborhood. There's actually no where to sit and I was hoping to see a longer list of flavors. Although, there were at least 20 flavors to choose from. Oh well, I guess that's the culture we live: more, more, more.

Sticky chewy chocolate is my fav chocolate flavor ever!!! The right amount of cocoa, cream and sugar.

The cherry is also another new fav. We also ordered 2 sorbets: pineapple and strawberry. Although they were sorbets, they weren't too tart.

The banana was good.
author: Alice S.

description: Thank you to my coworker for craving ice cream after a recent business dinner.  I was dining across the street and on our way out my coworker saw the Swensen and convinced me to eat some ice cream there.  We walked in right when they were closing and allowed us to still order.  I asked for recommendation from the gentlemen behind the counter and he said Sticky Chewy Chocolate.  I ordered a scoop in a cone to go.  It was one of the best chocolate ice creams I have ever had.  The only way to describe it is sticky, chewy, & chocolaty!  It was a wonderful delight after the dinner I just had.  There were some other flavors I hope to try one day.  If you are ever in San Francisco I recommend eating ice cream here!
author: Sayjul P.

description:
I love the lychee and sticky chewy chocolate. YUMMY!


btw.. parking is horrible here..  :(
author: Doro C.

description: love their homemade ice cream! the servers were really nice about us wanted to try several different flavors. my favorites are probably chocolate, lychee, and cookies n cream.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
This place has been around for a long time. When I lived in Russian Hill, this was my favorite ice cream shop to visit. Flavor wise, it's pretty standard. None of those crazy flavors like Bi Rite or Humphrey's. Nevertheless, the ice cream is still pretty solid. 

4 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Come prepared~! CASH ONLY!

Cute ice cream shop in the middle of a residential area.  It was quite a trek uphill from North Beach but we worked off all the calories so we could make some space for ice cream!

The line was out the door (which is usually a good sign) and the menu was chockfull of different flavors - so many choices!  I ended up going with their thin mint in a cup.  I was pleasantly surprisd to see how much ice cream they actually stuff into a cup for a small!  They definately don't skimp on the servings!  I was a little disappointed with the thin mint because the chocolate pieces weren't chocolatey at all and had this chalky weird texture and taste to them.  Booo!!

Alas, I must say that I agree with a lot of my fellow Yelpers.  Once you've had Bi-Rite... it's hard for anything else to compare!
author: Kim-van T.

description:
the guys that work here hate their jobs...or at least that's what it looks like.  

semi creamy, not overly icy, cones are nothing special, a good variety of flavors.  the ice cream was decent...they've got nothing on mitchell's of course...but a good enough fix to feed your craving.
author: Jen W.

description: I LOVE their ice cream! I've been coming here since I was a little girl. And I love how I'm able to take my own kids here. Favorite ice cram flavors .... thin mint and sticky chewy chocolate. They have a lot of classic flavors and you just can't go wrong.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
This is not your bi-rite of Humphrey, this is comparable to your traditional ice cream shop with basic chocolate, vanilla, rocky road, and then a few tweaks here and there such as the sticky chewy chocolate, french vanilla custard, and thin mint.

Sticky chewy chocolate!  It's SOOOOOO good!

It's sticky, slightly chewy, and oh so chocolatey!

The staff was friendly and I lucked out on parking because I have a small car.

The downside is that there isn't any indoor seating.  I'd definitely come back, but only if I'm taking the cable car or driving my miata :)
author: Michelle S.

description:
Minus the big hills I have to climb to get to this place, the ice cream here is not bad. Needless to say, this place is also voted one of the top best ice creams in the Bay area as well. SO it's definitely worth a try if you stop by SF or even if you're a local! The place has been around for years, and the workers there are very nice too.
Flavors I've tried and loved are: 
Cookies and Cream, Vanilla, banana
Flavors I didn't like very much: 
The almond flavor. 
& Also, this place allows you to bring how tubs of ice cream :] 
And that's also how i got sick of the Almond flavored ice cream, haha.
They also serve floats there too, but I haven't tried that yet!
author: DANA L.

description: I love Swensen's!  I've only tried Cookies & Cream, but since it's so good, I can't bring myself to try anything else!  It's so creamy and delicious, but doesn't leave you feeling nasty afterwards.  The only thing I don't like, is that their waffle cones are stale, at least the times I tried them.  Either way, I would definitely come back.  In fact, I think I'll head there right now...
author: Jade F.

description:
In my opinion, the best ice cream place (and I'm a huge ice cream person)!!! I grew up on this stuff, as my dad would always take my sister and me here after school. +12 years and most of the same people still work here!

My favorite flavors are lychee, strawberry, mint chip, and mango. The ice creams have the best flavor and are the perfect mix of creamy and icy. Also, make sure to take a quart or half gallon home!

We used to always order orange freezes too. Possibly an off-menu item, but basically it's orange sherbet blended with seltzer water. Yum--I wish I had one right now!

Parking is nonexistent in the area, so you'll have to find somewhere to stealthy double park. This place is definitely worth it though!
author: Stephanie F.

description:
I. LOVE. SWENSONS.

It's the best ice cream in San Francisco!!! My dad has been taking me here since I was little (and he's been coming since he was a young'n too!!)  I love the old school interior and the flavors are just great!!! 
I'm probably the only one who'll say this, but their black licorice is super yummy!! I think that's only seasonal though..I haven't seen it every time.  Otherwise, I highly recommend the cookie dough :)
author: Kei H.

description:
LOVE this neighborhood ice cream place! Their ice cream is great and the venue is charming. The are very creative with their flavors - their classics are great as are their holiday favorites. 

I only wish they had some chairs or a place to eat the ice cream inside, but  I can keep dreaming right!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
I live across the street. I can see Swensen's from my window. This is bad news.

I had the pumpkin tonight and it was SO delicious. Like one of those things you eat and have to keep stopping and say, wow, this is so good! That doesn't happen that often, but I love when it does. The pumpkin was creamy, with the perfect amount of pumpkin pie spice. I absolutely loved it.

I'm a huge ice cream snob having worked at Screamin' Mimi's in Sebastopol (go there!) in high school. It's rare ice cream lives up to my standards. Tonight, I was very pleasantly surprised. Plus - it's a real, old-fashioned place with a cool history (and ya can't beat the location!). Love it!
author: Janet G.

description: Awesome. Old Fashioned place. Takes cash only. Get the Turtle flavor. It's to die for, between the flavors and the textures.
author: Brittany F.

description:
All these jokers posting how they'd rather have Dreyers or Safeway need to get their snouts out of the gutter.

You really can't go wrong here as far as the ice cream. I had carmel turtle fudge which was delicious. Price is cheap, no complaints there. The people working the counter were subpar, and there was a line (duh!), so not 5 stars, also not gonna top Bi-Rite so I wouldn't feel right giving it a 5 spot.
author: David K.

description:
The famous Swensen's
Isn't anything special
So disappointed
-----
I went here with two friends and the three of us had ice cream, yet for the price of three ice creams we could've gotten a GALLON.  That does not make sense to me.

But price aside, let's talk about the important stuff--the FLAVA~!  I ordered the caramel swirl and the oogey gooey chocolate chewy.  I must admit that the chocolate was pretty good, perhaps a 4 on the scale of 5, but the caramel swirl left me wanting something else.  It wasn't bad (as I don't think "ice cream" could ever be "bad") but it wasn't even average as far as ice cream goes.  I would've been better off going to a super market and buying some Haagen Daaz.  So I left Swensen's confused what all the hype is about, knowing that I'll never ever go back again, and thinking to myself, "I parked at a fire hydrant and ran here just for this?...."

Then I went to a yogurt shop and had a delicious peanut butter chocolate froyo to get the not so yummy taste out of my mouth.
author: Jin D.

description: Had the Turkish Coffee ice cream here after a great meal at Zarzuela across the street. I'm not really sure what the big deal is about this place. It's more of that old-fashioned ice cream place; a definite contrast to Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe. The coffee ice cream was good, but really nothing special. No wait when I came by a little before 9pm, so at least that was nice. I could see why people like this style of ice cream, but I actually prefer the flavors and texture of the aforementioned ice cream shops more.
author: Morris C.

description:
Two words:  Red Star

Haha if you get one of these bad boys on the back of your receipt, it's automatically $5 off your purchase.  I offered to pay for a friend, but they didn't accept card.  My friend paid, and bam! 40 cents for two scoops of ice cream.

I got the Pineapple Sherbet, which was quite refreshing.  I am definitely coming back.
author: Nick W.

description: Super tasty ice cream goodness, especially the sticky chewy chocolate!!!
author: Mindy N.

description:
Two words:  Tutti Melon

This is where you need to go instead of Swensen's.  I am a huge fan of Hyde St., and an even bigger fan of ice cream.  However, the ice cream here is average, and to top if off, the servers are not friendly.  at all.  

Tutti Melon is a few blocks away (either in NB or on Polk St..).  They serve either fro-yo or amazing gelato, and their servers are much, much friendlier.  Check it out- highly recommend!
author: Nicole A.

description: Good ice cream but I don't understand the hype. The Bordeaux cherry ice cream reminded me of theThrifty black cherry ice cream of my childhood so points for nostalgia. Hubs had a vanilla sundae in a waffle cone which he raved about. Nice overall but I felt like I was cheating on Loving Cup with a undeserving, less healthy, less tasty option.
author: Kiristen R.

description:
Good ice cream without the frills. While I enjoy savoring frozen yogurt and gelato where there is an abundance of here in the City - it is simply refreshing to see a good ol' fashioned ice cream parlor in a charming neighborhood. This review is based on my second visit and I certainly hope to frequent it more often.

The reason why I give three stars is because it would be nice to have a few benches or chairs. Families, couples, friends, and mothers with children would find this convenience helpful (especially for those who drove from outside their neighborhoods and tried to find a parking spot after x amount of time). 

The fun part about Swensen's Ice Cream is looking up for minutes on end, deciding which flavor to devour. This is the best alternative to Baskin Robbins (and I hope it is sans high fructose corn syrup). Nonetheless, the experience of eating an ice cream cone (or drinking a shake) outside with others and hearing the sounds of the Cable Car line while watching people walk by is a lovely way of being in the moment.
author: SpringAutumn P.

description: The peppermint flavor is my favorite. It is sooo delicious.
author: Ivy G.

description:
So I hear this is the OG Swensen.  It must be, because the first time I came by it looked like it was from the 50's-60's.  It had a very old school feel and look to it, which I LOVE.  They didn't try to make it all swanky and modernized looking.  And for an ice cream parlor like theirs, they shouldn't...gives a place more character and credibility since they've been around for so long.  Also means, you  know their ice cream is on HIT if they've stayed up and running since then! I was house sitting for an old co-worker of mine who lived just one block down from the store. DANGER! DANGER! DANGER! Ha - every single night I house/cat sat... and after dinner.... i'd take myself down that Union block and grab myself a scoop of ice cream! EVERY SINGLE NIGHT. LOL

Pros: 
- Rich quality ice cream
- Lots of yummy flavors
- Pack and bring home

Cons:
- CASH ONLY :(
- Not rite aide cheap, but it's SWENSEN'S! 
- Wish they could expand this one and provide seating

Recommendations:
- Sticky Chocolate - quite a decadent ice cream.  And I love the gooey/sticky texture.  I always have it on a regular cone cause I like the deep sweet rich flavorful chocolate contrasted with the regular cone. And I like creamy contrasted with crunchy.  I have complex taste buds lol.
author: Kathy D.

description:
Let me tell you a story:

Once upon a time, a girl and a boy moved from Boston to San Francisco.  Right up the street from their new apartment was a fabulous rice pudding and yogurt shop, and that became the go-to destination for sweet-tooth-cravings.

But one day, while riding the 45, the girl spotted Swensen's.  Old fashioned, hard-packed ice cream?!  That's a little more my speed, she thought.

So off to Swensen's she went with a friend.  One taste and they were both delighted at the variety of flavors, creamy, delectable quality of the product itself, and authentic charm of the shop.

When the girl returned home to the boy she informed him: "from now on, when I say I want ice cream, I mean I want Swenson's!"
author: Allison B.

description:
Hot damn, I love ice cream! Swenson's isn't the best, but it's very classic. The real deal here is the orange sherbet; it's one of the tastiest I've ever had. Also, they'll dip your cone in chocolate, which is fun and delicious. 

I'm not in love with the people who work here... they can be playfully rude and I'd rather not deal with that kind of crap when I'm out to eat. It's the kind of thing where you politely ask, "Can I get a scoop of ice cream in a cone?" and they say, "No." 

Haha, how very original, now get the ice cream (groan).

BTW, does anyone really say "May I?" Because I've tried plenty of times, but it sounds way too elitist. Who goes into El Farolito and says, "Pardon me, but May I have a carne asada burrito? May I get black beans on that?" It's just way too formal- we should really change those grammar rules in favor of social competence.
author: Amanda C.

description: I'm not necessarily an ice cream connisouer (or that much of a desert person), but on the 6 hot days SF experiences in a given year, I feel it my duty to go to Swensons. I live very close, so i feel but they add express lines for locals, but anyways they have a whole bunch of great flavors. If you're looking for funky flavors go to Bi-rite. but if you want traditional flavors and a old ice cream parlor feel, come here. Its old, a bit small, and expensive...but goood.
author: Jeremy K.

description: Pineapple Sherbet FTW - A San Francisco Treat
author: David C.

description:
Oh Swensen's how do I love thee? Let me count the ways by recapping my last 10 visits to your wonderful store:

1,000,010) Toasted almond
1,000,009) Toasted almond
1,000,008) Toasted almond
1,000,007) Toasted almond
1,000,006) Toasted almond
1,000,005) Toasted almond - "Oh forgive me toasted almond, I'll never  stray ever again!"
1,000,004) Blackberry swirl - "Maybe I should break out of my tradition and try something new, you know now that we got a new president and all this change is goin around, and so that I can say I've had more than one flavor at Swensen's"
1,000,003) Toasted almond
1,000,002) Toasted almond
1,000,001) Toasted almond 
...
245,234) Toasted almond - "In the words of our new governator 'I'll be back for more toasted almond'"
...
4) Toasted almond
3) Toasted almond
2) Toasted almond - "Damn that toasted almond was OFF THE CONE brah.... hook it up!! Oh hi current mayor Willie Brown, may I recommend the toasted almond?"
1) "Hmm... Swensen's... what's good here? OK I'll try toasted almond"
author: Michael K.

description:
Words cannot do Swensen's ice cream justice...but I'll give it a shot.....

AMAAAAAZINGLY DELICIOUS! Seriously, every flavor I've tried has left me salivating for more. My absolute hands down favorite is the toasted almond, with slivers of almonds packed into it. Ahhhhhh :)

Anyone who says ice cream is all the same is:
a.  totally insane
b. living a sad sad existence 
c. has obviously never been to Swensen's!
author: Genie M.

description:
I don't know what to say other than this is the place for ice cream.  I'm not huge on that whole "beer and fruity pebble with bacon-potato" ice cream thing (novelty can only carry mediocre flavor so far in my book, Hipster...) so this is really my kind of spot.  All right, so call me old-fashioned, my ham radio and I will be just fine, just fine with our myriad Swensen ice cream flavors that bring back the childhood memories.  

Bubblegum, strawberry, all that good stuff.  SAY GOOD BYE TO YOUR TEETH.

Nowadays though my go-to is their Swiss Orange Chip.  Loaded with fudge.  Do I want whipped cream on that?  Um no I'm watching my weig-OF COURSE I DO!!!!  Yea get that all on there- put that waffle cone on it upside-down because I'm such a gluttonous human being that my ice cream orders no longer fit in the cone the proper way.  Kinda like me in my jeans.  Great selection too, and not just of the ice creams.  Tons of toppings, different kinds of cones, and all at reasonable prices.  Also, props for putting the store up on the hill - always tastes that much better after a brief hike.
author: Jake D.

description:
Classic. Absolutely classic.

This place is the only place I would go for some good ice cream. Whenever I'm out, I tell my dad to drive there just so we can get another tub of ice cream. It's fantastic! The flavors may be on the original side, but it's as good as it gets, every flavor is bursting with their own taste, and it doesn't taste artificial at all. I recommend the French Custard Vanilla-- and if you ever DO happen to buy a tub of it, make sure to put some bananas in there! They go so well together...

Not to mention that they have quite a few awards to prove their popularity, and shows that they're a neighborhood favorite. I'm pretty sure their waffle cones are homemade, since I got a...sort of warm cone before, haha. Bad for the ice cream, but the cone was delicious!

Definitely considered a tourist attraction...it needs more customers to spread the word of their ice-creamy-goodness. (:

Happy eating!
author: Winnie J.

description:
My bf and I walked up a long hill to get to Swenson's and was excited to finally get there. I had the cookies and cream and he had the mocha almond fudge. Both flavors were good. We got to try different flavors before we ordered also. 

However, the staff was unfriendly and did not smile. They really looked unhappy working there.
author: Linh R.

description: I live 5 blocks from Swensen's and it's my favorite place to walk to on a warm night after dinner. The cones are reasonably priced and they have multiple flavors that I love. It's ice cream. What more could you ask for?
author: Kerry K.

description:
what i ordered... rocky road

tried a lot of their flavors before(yearS ago) for my cuz' used to work nearby and alway's bring home 1/2 gallon of 'em icy treat. ice cream's good but nothing special that's why am so dumbfounded of so many staaaaars here at yelp*.

ambiance... ok (cramped, kindda old and goodluck looking for parking)
service... ok
cost... $(typical)
author: Gors P.

description:
need some better flavors-only have vanilla custard now-use to have lemon custard that was to die for.
It's a good ice cream place but give us some cool new flavors please!
bring back good custard flavors!!!!
author: SJ O.

description: STICKY PEANUT BUTTER. YOU MUST GET IT. Literally globs of frozen peanut butter in it--so good and so bad. But every time I have broken my diet to get it, I have not regretted it. You won't either.
author: Steffi L.

description:
It's a rare thing to find a non-chain ice cream shop of high caliber yummy goodness. Sure, people talk about Birite and Mitchells but really, this is the place for a cheap, unpretentious scoop of delicious ice cream that elicits memories from decades past.

I'm a bit biased, having come here many times over the last two decades. But each flavor here brings out a mood. Orange sherbert for when I'm feeling happy. Strawberry when I need a soothing fix but don't need the tang of orange sherbert. Chocolate if I need unrelenting sweetness. Green tea when I am feeling more Asian. And coffee if I want to be an adult.

There's little to no parking, although if you get lucky there will be the 10 minutes space on Hyde right in front of the shop. I think I might have had one red star like 15 years ago, but they certainly are rare - so if you get one, count your lucky...stars! (a red star on your receipt means you get $5 in free product).

I think this Swensen's is the last one around...there was one in Vegas a few years back, but you can't beat this shop.
author: Aaron F.

description:
Reminds me of those small town childhood summer spots especially because the ice cream sits in metal lidded compartments, unlike the open barrels at Baskin Robbins.

Flavors keep to the fairly traditional side although there are a few surprises. I felt really basic the day I visited and went for the second kind of vanilla instead of the first. When there are two vanillas how do you pick? "Old time vanilla" for me.

The ice cream is creamy and dense. What an amazingly refreshing treat on a warm afternoon. Plus the ice cream doesn't sit in your stomach or overpower your taste buds with sugar. I was hesitant about this place at first but I might have to come back.
author: Michael H.

description:
I'm not originally from San Francisco and the first Swensen's I went to was in Bangkok, Thailand! 

Then I moved to SF and went to the original (a few times...). I'm a huge ice cream fan and they do it right. So many delicious flavors I always have a hard time choosing. I really love their cherry. If you are feeling adventurous, try a malt!
author: Sara P.

description: Good-- but when is ice cream ever not? Nothing you can't pick up from the grocery store. A little pricey for pretty basic ice cream. Staff isn't particularly friendly either, and parking is nearly impossible to find. If you must go, I recommend the waffle cones.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Best ice cream in the city. Hands down.
Personal favs include Peppermint, Mocha Chip, and Mint Chip.
Forget Ghirardelli- this is the real deal. Made in-house with the best ingredients it's hard to go wrong. 

Bring cash, stand outside, check out the cable car, and enjoy a true San Francisco spot.
author: Maggie M.

description:
After a dinner where I stuffed myself silly with Korean bbq, dessert was a must. 

The BF kept talking about Swensen's and how delicious their ice cream, we decided to go  and get a cone or two.  

It took us a while to find parking but when we did, it was just a quick wait before we were at the counter. I tried the Espresso chip (was totally in a coffee mood) in a sugar cone. The portion was huge! And oh so worth the price. 

I loved every single lick. It had a light coffee flavor and the espresso was tasty and woke me up a bit. 

We casually cruised down Lombard Street in the car, eating our ice cream, and just enjoying the view. I think I'll give in more often to the BF whenever he starts waxing poetic over Swenson's. I want to try their other flavors!
author: Julia W.

description: Holy crappies. The Bordeaux Cherry is  awesome! One a cold windy night in SF, nothing tickles my pinkies than having a waffle cone with 3 scoops molded to perfection.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
I grew up one street away and we would get the rare treat of walking here.  I've been going here my whole life and most family parties whether at our place or not always included Swensen's.  My first memory of this place involve riding in on my dad's shoulders... and was so young that when asked what flavor I wanted I'd say "Pink".  It was my favorite color and nothing pink can be bad.  Ahh the memories... 

The ice cream here is so good that at my b-day party 2yrs ago a few of my friends who have never had Swensen's before will still to this day ask me where was that you go that amazing ice cream on you birthday?  Ah Swensens.  Some favorites: Lemon Custard (no longer being made... *tear... its either French Vanilla or Old Fashion Vanilla that tastes similar), Turkish Coffee, Banana, Rocky road! Rocky road! Mint chip, Cookies and cream oh my! Strawberry(of course) Coconut Pineapple... everything is good here... and have you ever had your cone dipped? Its this secret process (ok maybe its not a secret...) where they dip your ice cream on a cone into a vat of chocolate and while they walk it back to you the chocolate hardens into a delicious protective chocolate shell completely encasing your ice cream and cone! similar to the chocolate dipped bananas you've probably had at Disneyland.... 

On a small unimportant note: I'm sad that they no longer have their own Swensen printed cartons or Lemon Custard... but i guess its just the way it is... 

Radom Tip: if ur looking for cheap eats before your ice cream head down Hyde for a slice at Za's
author: Paula Y.

description: I love ice cream.  I had the mocha fudge and caramel marble...pretty good.  I would have loved it on a cone but they handle the money and your cones bare handed...bleh...sorry but not for me.
author: she q.

description:
HANDS DOWN BEST SF ICE CREAM! Total tourist spot but also one that is a true native sf!! GREAT flavors to choose from! Also, the famous walkaway sunday is always delish!!! SO GOOD. Another plus, you can get the ice cream of your choice in pints/large amounts to take home if you wish :)

I think its closed mondays
author: Laura G.

description:
My bf went to dinner with his friend's family and they all raved about Swensen's.  He was bummed that he couldn't go with them and told me that this place was supposed to be good.  I kept Swensen's at the back of my mind and every time I saw the high Yelp reviews, I told myself that I have to make the trip out there to try it.

I was so excited to go here!!  As we were going round and round to find parking, I was seriously smiling the whole time because I was so excited to finally try Swensen's. 

Ugh.  Then we got there, and I sampled over 8 flavors and wasn't even mildly impressed by any of them.  So my friend and I split a single scoop of bittersweet chocolate because how can you go wrong?  It was pretty good, but nothing special.  Last week, I had the most amazing milk chocolate with salted almonds from Ici in Berkeley on waffle cone.  That was amazing and worth savoring.  This ice cream was okay.  I liked the texture, it was thick and I could kind of bit off chunks of it.  And I liked that the cone barely melted!  Too bad the flavors are just okay.  I actually prefer Dryer's ice creams in terms of flavors... and I've never said that about any ice cream shop before... 

If you want good ice cream, go to Bi-Rite, Ici, Mitchell's, Humphrey, or Joe's (in order of my preference).
author: Anna T.

description:
IMHO, Swensen's is a San Francisco gem. The ice cream is excellent, there are never lines more than 5 minutes, and the neighborhood is perfect for walking a few blocks while you eat. I am an immediate fan of any place that serves Peppermint ice cream. Not to mention I got my ice cream gratis last week because my receipt had a red star on it. I guess there's a sign right on the cash register explaining this. Either way, it was awesome. 

Just down the block on Hyde is a thin crust pizza place called Za. I've been known to pair these two places together. Pizza first, ice cream second. Or vice versa. It's a can't miss.
author: Jonathan G.

description: I loved the Lychee ice cream. Refreshing, light and tasty!
author: Karin Z.

description: YUMMMYYYY!!! I always want to order something new when I go, but I sample a couple and consistently go for the sticky chewy chocolate.
author: Amanda V.

description:
My first trip to Swensens I didn't get to go inside so I'm not sure what the service was like and I didn't get to see all of the flavors. Place looked pretty small from the outside and there were a lot of people going in and out. But our trip was like a drive-by - boyfriend jumped out of the car, ran inside, got us both some ice cream and ran back out and we were on our way home. 
Since I didn't have any idea of what type of ice cream they had I told him to get me anything so he picked the pineapple sorbet and I loved it! You get some nice little chunks of pineapple with every bite and just talking about it makes me want some. 

Hopefully next time we won't be in such a rush and I'll actually be able to go inside!
author: Katie J.

description: Now that must really be a good ice cream for me to want to Yelp it after it has been a year since I was last there. Swensen's, on the corner of Hyde and Union Street is a global chain of ice cream restaurants that started at this little shop in San Francisco, California and is not headquartered in Ontario, Canada.  Swensen's is easily accessible by hoping off the cable car and heading into the shop.  I remember the ice cream was very delicious and a must if you enjoy ice cream.  How often would you be able to go into the very first Swensen's, one out of the 300 store that are located across the world?  I highly suggest that if you are in San Francisco that you go by here and get a scoop or two.  Stop by in March and you just might see me there again. =)
author: Christian H.

description: Most amazing ice cream shop ever and is famous! I was there for The Bachelor appearance and I don't even watch the show. The greatest waffle cones and ice cream which from my understanding they make in the shop. If not they could have fooled me! Definitely a place to stop when in the neighborhood!
author: Ambrosia S.

description: Marketing pitch, cool liquid nitrogen technology. Then add a sprinkle of hype will definitely lead to some good star ratings.  But all pitches aside, I found nothing "that" special with the product.  It's an over-priced, overrated cup of ice cream.  One can even argue that it's nothing but a full serving of mediocrity.   You sure can choose to pay top dollar and get with the hype or have it more reasonably better somewhere else.  For the newbies, best to try once then move on.
author: Evan S.

description:
The weather had been very nice lately so we started yelping for ice cream.  Swensons has a great looking website (which does not fit their image at all), that caught our eyes and tummies so we gave it a go.

We waited in line for about 5 mins.  Looking around, it's an old school place, doesn't match the website.  I really wanted the midnight brownies but they were out so I went with the chewy chocolate and toasted almonds.  My wife went with cookies and cream with mocha almond fudge.

I enjoyed the chewy chocolate but the rest of the 3 flavors were not creamy, it had a icey texture to them.  The mocha and almond tasted too artificial.

Just ok.
author: danny m.

description: Old school ice cream parlor at its best!  Can't go wrong with the rocky road and turkish coffee.  Grew up coming here with my grandparents and parents.  Can't believe they still have that water fountain there that I used to drink out of as a kid!
author: Eric T.

description:
My boyfriend told me about a cute old-fashioned ice cream joint in Nob Hill, and we were stoked to make a date of it (he was disappointed that I'd heard of Swenson's and to find out there were ~300 locations, but there was still something nostalgic about going to the first location on a date).  A particular night in the Castro delayed our plans, so the second time we went we were determined to make it in the door before 11 (their closing time on Saturdays).  There was running, there was even a short cab ride, and we got to Swenson's at 10:53 to find the "Closed" sign up in the window and an employee mopping the floor.  I understand that some businesses close a few minutes before their actual close time, but getting this cone with my favorite guy was more of a principal issue at this point.  The employee said they were closed because they'd had a rough night; I'm sure I said something about also having a rough night as my guy heroically/obnoxiously walked inside.  The person behind the counter said, "We're closed," to which my guy said, "It's not 11 yet - I'll have a cookie dough and a chocolate."  The people literally 10-seconds behind us were rejected by the recently locked door (bad business), and we triumphantly ate some pretty delicious,  thick, old-fashioned frozen goodness.  

Date night: awesome.
Product: great.
Service: totally disappointing.
author: Rusty P.

description:
I was looking forward to trying this after my friend found this place on Yelp. Swensen's has been open for a long time so I figured this place must be super good.

My friends and I tried a bunch of flavors - lychee, green tea, mango, raspberry marble, peppermint stick, and some other ones. One friend ended up getting dark chocolate or bittersweet chocolate, I forget, and I got a sundae with cookies and cream ice cream. None of what we had tasted spectacular. I've definitely had so much better ice cream at Bi Rite's and Ici. Really, once you try Bi Rite's, you'll be a changed person.

Swensen's is a great place to go with your grandparents or parents who might have grew up eating ice cream at Swensen's but if you want really good ice cream, try Bi Rite.
author: Lucy D.

description: What's there not to love? Old school ice cream parlor in a bustling street corner of Russian Hill. Lots of favors to choose from, staff is nice.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Add this to your family and friends Real San Francisco tour.  

As we looked at it from across the street, My Love said, "That's the original Swensen's."  

Really?  Are you sure?  You're kidding me, right?  

She walked me to the front door, where we read the news clippings.  Established in 1948, when Earle Swensen was working at the County Assessors Office.  Against the advice of his family and friends, Earle quit his day job and put all his energy into the company.  Today there are over 300 stores on 4 continents, and chances are your family and friends have bought a pint or two in their local supermarkets.  

So stop in at this tiny little take-out, and marvel at the goodness of ice cream and the eminent history of San Francisco together.  Make it a different day than the one you visit the Ghirardelli Chocolate store, and they will agree with you when you say you live in Heaven.
author: David D.

description: Swensen's proves that even in 21st century San Francisco, you don't have to be avant garde to be delicious. They have classic American flavors done well. And honestly, when I want ice cream that's what I'm looking for. Keep the crazy on the plate, and give me simple with a spoon.
author: Amanda S.

description: I tried this place months ago and was very impressed. Yes, the parking's difficult, but I needed some ice cream to go with my beignets from Brenda's French Soul Food and Swensen's happened to be on the way. I opted for the lychee ice cream which was rich, flavorful, and absolutely delicious! Prices were reasonable and the service was good. If I'm in the area, I'll be back.
author: Joyce E.

description: My dad would always buy a tub of Swensen's chocolate chip ice cream for me, my brother, and my sister and I would think to myself that's odd because he's not the type of guy that even likes sweets. But this is the exception and I can see why. Their ice cream is really good and I would recommend this place for sure!
author: Diane L.

description:
yumm!! 

what more do I have to say, only downfall their closed on Mondays =( which is usually when I want to stop in for iCe Cream.
author: Tiffani L.

description: Came here after having a cute meal in the neighborhood. I tried a few flavors but the one I really enjoyed was toasted almond. I am a huge lover of anything almond or pistachio, so this one was a winner in my book. My bf had a nice chocolate also. It's definitely a darling little place to visit for an ice cream fix if you're in the area.
author: Sheeva G.

description: i got the cookies and creme.. what was i thinking?! i should have known not to order the ordinary. my friend ordered the sticky chewy chocolate...THAT was golden. next time i'm definitely ordering the sticky choco instead of the generic flavor... that's amateur ice cream mistake 101..don't be like me
author: Jen C.

description: I love getting ice-cream here on my way back home, I honestly feel blessed that such a good ice-cream place is close by. Their waffle cone, actually tastes like waffle and toasted almond is my favorite flavor.
author: Anna J.

description: Awesome ice cream!  Highly recommend swiss orange chip. Deep rich chocolate with chocolate chuncks and hint of orange.
author: Renee R.

description: Came here for the first time with some friends.  It's a cute cozy place in Russian Hill.  The line went out the door but we got to the front quick.  I ordered the Turkish Coffee ice cream dipped in chocolate and it was a winner :)
author: Mimi N.

description:
Your love handles and ass will hate you,
but your tongue will love you.
Sweet Sweet Swiss Orange Chocolate
author: Po L.

description:
I'd definitely like to think of myself as an ice cream aficionado and I admit that there was a small, minor period in my life where I became an official gelato snob (the excuse was that that was immediately after a summer spent in Italy with the real deal).

That said, I think Swensen's was alright.  It didn't blow my mind and I'm a bit scared to admit that I would've rather spent my money elsewhere, like, dare I say, Coldstones...

(and right about now is the moment I'm supposed to dodge the whole getting burned at the stake thing for saying so...)

Maybe I should've gotten a scoop of the sticky chewy chocolate or the turkish coffee, but I had a made craving for some kind of chocolate mint concoction.  I was excited to see thin mint as a flavor on the board, but was a bit disappointed that it turned out more like mint chocolate chip than the infamous girl scout cookie type.

I also got a scoop of toasted almond (told you I loved ice cream).  That was pretty tasty, and I did like that it had tons of bits of almonds, but again, nothing too spectacular.

Plus, the guy at the counter seemed annoyed that I had asked to sample two flavors... I was too scared to ask for a third.  Homeboy should be happier... isn't ice cream supposed to have that effect on you?  Well, I guess unless you're lactose, but that just might be TMI.
author: Melanie P.

description:
the ice cream here is good, but not swoon-worthy. swensen's is perfect if you are looking for simple, traditional flavors and a quick ice cream satiation, but it never puts me into the ice cream trance. most of the ice cream is pretty rich, but some of the flavors are a bit icy. 

but my favorites are the sticky chewy chocolate, and its enhanced chocolate peanut butter version (the exact same sticky chewy chocolate ice cream but with peanut butter chips added in!). the chocolate ice cream is INDEED creamy, sticky and chewy, slightly bitter, and rich. your teeth really sink into it slowly. don't stop there. get hot fudge on top for an additional sweeter chocolate flow to balance out the slightly bitter. nothing compares to a good chocolate explosion!

one thing they really need to do though, is actually DISPLAY their ice cream (they're all covered by silver lids...why??), so that i could actually behold every flavor...and experience that ice cream decision-making-thrill.

old fashioned shop, with no seating.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Damn, that's good friggin ice cream! 

Turkish coffee and banana are my 5 star favorites by far. The other flavors are ok but then again I haven't tried all of them. It's a little pricey for a small scoop so my recommendation is to get the larger size and take it home with you. 

Would have given it 5 stars for the Turkish coffee and banana flavors alone but the price and having been spoiled with Mitchells (mango flavor) as a kid left one star out.
author: German L.

description:
This place serves average ice cream.

Ice cream is a happy food.  Here, it is served by unhappy people who are also rude.

What's worse is that they don't pay any attention to health codes. Our scooper wore gloves, but didn't change them after handling money. When he handed me my cone, I could see that his gloves were old and stained.  A young woman put new gloves on as she came out of the back, and I thought 'now there's a responsible employee.'  It turns out she had put the gloves on to clean the counter.
author: Lamario D.

description:
Let's see:

Cute antiquated store front (check)
Crunchy sugar cones (check)
Interesting flavors: Swiss Orange Chocolate, Lychee, Grape Nut, Green Tea (check)
Chocolate Dip (check, check, check, check, check)....drool
Red stars on the back of my receipt for having free ice cream (check^10 :D)

My only one disappointment is that they stopped making one of my favorite flavors: Lemon custard (le sigh)

Sure, I've tried that place called Bite Rite... and that other "establishment" called... Mitchell's, but seriously nothing compares to Swenson's!!!!!
author: Chris L.

description:
Oh my, I really thought this was going to be a typical ice cream shop but to my delightful surprise they had some off the beaten path flavors!!!  Green Tea, Swiss Orange Chocolate, Lychee, Licorice, the list goes on.

I had a small scoop (which was definitely quite big) of the Lychee and WOW!!!!  It was a "all my childhood dreams come true" moment for me.  Definitely not too sweet, the flavor was exactly that of a Lychee fruit (trust me, I've eaten bags of Lychees in Thailand).  It was just yummy fruity goodness!
author: Autumn H.

description:
Still one of our favorite places for ice cream but they stop making one of our favorite: lemon custard and my family's favorite: coconut pineapple.  Luckily, the 2 flavors we buy most often are still safe.  

Just the other day, I found out hubby likes cherry ice cream?!?  After almost 20 years together, I learned something new.  So while I was here getting ice cream, I asked to get a taste of the bordeaux cherry.  It was disappointing - just sweet with no cherry flavor at all.  Too bad I couldn't have surprised hubby.  Instead I got one of our favorites, swiss orange chip.  Plenty chocolate chips with a great orange flavor with rich chocolate ice cream - yum!
author: Gloria H.

description:
Creamy ice cream with great flavors - I had a scoop of the pumpkin on a sugar cone; YUM! Creamy, pumpkiny, and smooth. The man behind the counter was a crack up too - he kept teasing me and saying I couldn't have any tastes of the ice cream. With a straight face. Then he'd say just kidding. Multiple times.

The shop is very quaint, many flavors to choose from, and has a homey feel, like the shop around the corner (I guess it's fitting, since it's literally on the corner). Not much seating though so most people get cones or cartons to go.
author: Katherine P.

description:
Stopped in for an ice cream yesterday on my way to North Beach. The #41 and #45 MUNI bus stop right out side the door. 

I had the summer flavor special, peach ice cream. Delicious and very fresh. All the flavors are made fresh. There is one flavor I want to try next time, it is called "sticky chocolate." The staff told me it is really good and has bitter sweet chocolate in it. 

Place is clean and wheel chair accessible with the help of staff. Door has a bit of a step but staff will help wheelchair. 

Sorry no place to sit, strictly take out. And, NO credit/ATM cards. They take only cash. So make sure you have at least three dollars and some change. 1 scoop costs $3.20. 

It is a good-sized scoop. But be prepared with cash. Check out the Russian Hill area. Sweensen's is on the corner of Union at Hyde, right where the Cable Car passes by. Great classic spot to be if visiting the City for the first time. Even for a native like me, it still is a thrill to watch the cable car. And to be in Russian Hill on a sunny evening, wonderful.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Countless trips to Maggie Mudd over the past two weeks, I knew there'd come a point when I'd be too lazy to make the trek across town for my ice cream fix...  

Cue Swensen's:   An old-time ice cream parlor filled with tubs of fat, ice creamy goodness atop Russian Hill (and a lot closer to home).  They serve an assortment of flavors, including those less standard, like lychee and mango.  I'm fond of milkshakes, but the flimsy paper cups they're put in need to be done away with.  After a slice at Za's, hop over to Swensen's to complete your artery-clogging filled meal.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
love it - they serve:
green tea
mango
lychee
mocha fudge
egg nog!!! 

use scoutmob if you are going this early december 2011.  then tip the guys - they're so nice and work hard
author: Alias A.

description:
Three words. . . 

Sticky Chewy Chocolate

'nuff said.  

(I am making an effort to write shorter reviews)

Okay, three more words:   Caramel Turtle Fudge.

Two more words:  Bittersweet Chocolate

One more:  sherbets.

Ah, screw it, who am I kidding. . short reviews. . hah!

They make THE BEST sundaes too and all the ice creams AT THIS LOCATION ONLY are made right there.  

Swenson's isn't sexy,  chic, trendy or hip but  that's some good, tasty ice cream!
author: Lainie L.

description:
Pure, delicious, creamy goodness.  

Ice cream is a great way to celebrate those "life is good" moments, and Swensen's will give you that good-old-days feeling with every lick.  They've been doing it the same, handcrafted way since 1948, and their top-of the hill location with the neon light beckoning you to stop in for a cone is too romantic and tempting to resist.  A stroll thorough one of SF's most lovely neighborhoods with a cup or a cone or a shake is a real treat, especially on a rare warm night.

I love the Lemon Chiffon and Vanilla Custard flavors, but really everything is good here.  The ice cream is dense and rich, so a little goes a long way.  I like to get the "small double" size ($4.00 for 2 sizeable scoops) and see what interesting combinations I can come up with - contrast is the key, both in flavor and color.

Some favorites:
Sticky Chewy Chocolate with Banana
Blackberry with Mocha Chip
Peppermint with Chocolate
Mango with Vanilla Custard

Also good are the chocolate dipped cones - such a far cry from Dairy Queen.  

A nice place to bring guests from out of town.  Parking is what it is - a challenge.  Worth circling the block a few times for this dairy decadence.
author: Liz S.

description:
I grew up outside San Francisco, and my home town had two Swensen's.  As a child I got one flavor every time I went there, and that flavor was Swiss Orange Chip.  The two in my hometown went out of business, and it became a very tough time in my life, I never thought I would taste Swiss Orange Chip again.  

I practically wet myself when I found out that there was a Swensen's in North beach, and am transplanted to my dusty orchard childhood every time I take a bite.  

Please try it, I will hasten to say you shant be disappointed.
author: Ryan L.

description: Fresh Banana and Marble Fudge are my go to flavors here. Also I often pick up a container of their Hot Fudge to go. During each holiday they have seasonal ice creams.  I have tried other ice cream places including some of the newer gourmet ones around SF. But I always wish I had just gone to Swensons.
author: Cindy B.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a kid and one of my earliest memories is of me eating a strawberry ice cream cone. In my zeal, I licked so hard that the ice cream toppled on to the side walk. You know what I did? That's right, I picked that fucker up and put it right back on my cone and ate it. And you know what? It was GOOD!

When I was 16 this was also my first job. Yup, $4.25 an hour and 1/2 gallon of ice cream a week. I also got a sweet ass ripped left forearm from scooping ice cream all summer. But this isn't about me...

They make all their ice cream on site and you can actually see them making it from the storefront. Milkshakes and sundaes totally rule. This shit's so good it'll make you pick it up off the street and eat it!
author: Josua P.

description: An old-fashioned, family-owned ice cream parlor that opened in 1948, it has evolved into an international chain, with more than two hundred outlets throughout the United States, Asia, the Middle East, Australia, and South America. All ice cream, in a wide variety of flavors (frosted chocolate malt and pistachio almond are my favorites), is made on the premises, and is available in cones, cups, or containers to take home. Forget the diet just this once and indulge in a walkaway waffle sundae, a crisp waffle cone loaded with ice cream, sauce, and whipped cream. How anyone could think Blue Bell, with its odd texture and artificial taste, is superior to this is beyond me.
author: Gourmet G.

description:
Lychee ice cream.  Do not go to Swensen's without ordering the lychee.  Take a pint home if you need too.  While you're at it, mix in a little mango and take that home too.  Perfumey yet not intense.  Hidden in the lychee are little flecks of the fruit itself while the mango is smooth and creamy.  Don't forget the strawberry.  There's more ripe and robust fruit than there is ice cream.  Not to be out done, is the mint chip.  The chunky chips bite back with a fluorescent green force.  Wait marbled butterscotch too.  I've tried all these in only two visits.  You can see that I'm obsessed.  Next time I'm going back for mocha chip and Turkish coffee and whatever else i can fit in that pint.

A store owner specializing in sarcasm with an imperceptible smirk completes the small shop feel.  Oh, you flirty old man.  Right in front of my man.  Have you no shame?
author: Shelley H.

description:
My parents used to frequent Swensen's in Oakland during their dating years, and have taken me there for nostalgia's sake ever since I was a kid.

You can imagine my surprise and excitement to find one in Russian Hill.  It was fate.  My favorite ice cream had followed me from the hood to my hood.  Malted shakes, waffle cones and hot fudge sundaes were mine for life.

Why I don't give Swensen's 5 stars?  After a lifetime of patronage, never once have I gotten the little red star on my receipt that equates to a free ice cream.  I'm just sayin'!
author: Nicole G.

description: Its a little and cozy ice cream spot that has great ice cream and people who work there are super nice and friendly.
author: Anthony V.

description: My roommate had one of those scoutmob deals, so we trekked all the way here to get some free ice cream! I got the banana flavor in a cone, which tasted like very authentic, fresh banana. My roommates got the orange chocolate and the chocolate, which were also yums. I'm not sure if it's the best ice cream I've ever had, but I like their fun flavors!
author: Melody L.

description:
All right, let's be clear.  I don't care how old this place is, or how traditional, or how many famous people have been here.  All I want to know is: is the ice cream any good?  Answer: OMFG yes.  This place is so good, I'm not going to go into all the great things they do, I'm just going to offer a few suggestions, which (if carefully followed) would make this place the greatest store on the face of the earth.

1. Many ice cream stores drop a malted milk ball into the bottom of their waffle cones before they pack the ice cream in there.  Why?  Because it forms a leak-proof barrier that makes it unnecessary for me to occasionally fellate my waffle cone.  Which I like.  I mean, I like it to be unnecessary.  Not that there's anything wrong with that.  So, Swensen's should do this.

2. Let me throw out some flavor ideas: chocolate chocolate brownie; chocolate chocolate chip; fudgey chocolate lava; chewey chocolate chunk; chunky chocolate coronary.  You gettin this down?  This is gold.

That's all I got.  Keep up the good work!
author: Ben P.

description:
When I was little, my father would get us all Swenson's Hot Fudge Sundaes whenever he was in the dog house.  Nothing says MOM GET OVER IT AND GIVE THE MAN A BREAK like mint chocolate chip ice cream with loads of fudge and whipped cream all over.

Swenson's is the best ice cream in the city, better than the overrated Ghirardelli.  The servers are so friendly; I always feel welcome.  A must for tourists!
author: Daniela L.

description:
I dont know what it is about the winter, but I always get this craving for ice cream. Don't ask my why but that is just how it is. Anyway last night was one of those nights and thank god my boyfriend had it as well because as soon as we passed Swensen's we both just looked at each other and knew. It was ice cream time!

I have been to this place twice, and pass this place pretty frequently due to my bus route. It always has a long line. Granted the place is a bit small but a line every time. That has to tell you something.

If you still aren't sold on this place, go in and order. I have had my 2 favorite flavors in the world (Mint Chip and Old Fashion Vanilla) and both were amazing. Single scoop is more than enough for me. If you are standing on the right angle, you may just be lucky enough to see "medicine bottles" in the back where they make the ice cream. That took me back.

By far the best place in the city to get ice cream. For the portions, flavors, and price you won't be disappointed. I recommend taking a walk down Hyde with you ice cream in hand. There is definitely something nostalgic about it.
author: Diana R.

description:
been wanting to come here for a while. just a note, this place is actually a bit far from public transportation. my friends and i walked here from north beach and it was heck of a hilly walk. 

they have a good variety of ice cream flavors and i sampled several. my favorites were swiss chocolate chip, lychee, and mango bc i was feeling fruity that day. ended up getting the lychee. their ice cream is not like bi-rite or mitchell in the sense that they're not very creamy and overly sweet. for someone who prefer a lighter taste, this is a good place to try!
author: Joyce B.

description:
Move over Cold Stones and Baskin Robbins. Swensen's is the best! Freshly made by scratch.

There's always room for ice cream especially when it's Swensen's Ice Cream. Tasty and enjoyable all at the same time. 

Good old Rocky Road is to die for.
author: Stanley K.

description:
Oh my ice creamy goodness!  Full fat. Heavy cream. Buttermilk.  Whatever other bad/good deliciousness the put in this ice cream (or as I call it "Mommy's medicine") is worth breaking any diet for.  

You feel like you're stepping back in time when you come here and it's so great.  Lines get long on warm days and it's a nice place to come after a meal on Hyde.  

Cash only though!
author: Kathleen B.

description:
When I get cravings for hot fudge, there's only one place that I go. err, let me rephrase that, there's only one place that satisfies my cravings, Swensons! 

No where else can cure my hot fudge craving like Swensons. One small banana ice cream, hot fudge sundae. Hold the nuts, hold the cherry, hold the whip cream. It's all about Swensons' hot fudge, not too sweet, a little nutty in flavour, and mmm mmm good!

I only wish the parking was better in the neighborhood.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Come have the Rocky Road. Your mouth will literally explode. The end.
author: Aaron L.

description:
I must have set my expectations too high for this place... because my experience here was mediocre at best.

I came here after a Yelp Elite Event... letting my craving for frozen goodness get the best of me.  I was still sporting my snazzy Yelp name tag which basically read "Whitney H... nice to meet you, and prepare to be Yelped".  

After pondering which of the many flavors to try, I asked for 2 scoops in a cone, intending to have 1 scoop of Chocolate and 1 scoop of Cookies & Cream.  They refused to mix flavors on any sized order, so I got one scoop of chocolate and called it a night.  

First of all, what's with not letting you have more than one flavor?  And secondly, I should have gotten the Cookies & Cream, because the chocolate was below par.  I would have been better off stopping at the corner store and picking up a pint of Ben & Jerry's. 

I guess I expected more from a family owned place that's maintained such a stellar reputation over a number of decades.
author: Whitney H.

description:
Being a part of North Beach and being a child of North Beach, this is THE only ice cream that you know about. PERIOD! No if ands or buts about it. Swenson's is king! KING, I tell you!!!

I remember when I used to trudge up that god forsaken hill called Union St. all the way up to Hyde just to buy 2 half gallons of ice cream. One pineapple coconut for my mom and a plain chocolate chip for my dad. I didn't get to choose because I wasn't the one paying for it. Well, I was but it wasn't with my money. No money, no opinion. So that was the way it went for many years. Of course, I would buy a cone for myself whenever I save up enough change. Kinda cool when the red star is on your receipt, too. You get some money back or something. Can't remember that part too well.

Anywho, I grew up on their ice cream and by gum they made the best I have ever tasted! Always buy the hand packed containers in the freezer cases. They are the wide tubs. Never buy the pre-packaged stuff that looks like the tubs you get at Safeway. Nasty and gritty. 

For me, this place makes the best regular flavors anywhere. Basic and classic flavors are always good to have. If I wanted something exotic I would go somewhere else. But yeah, the memories will always be there with me...
author: Anthony L.

description: NOT open on Monday, the only day I was in the area on vacation.  My favorite restaurant as a kid, was so excited to go to the original location!
author: Windy S.

description: Great ice crem. Lucky to live up the street because parking is a problem here. Old fashioned vibe and often crowded. Sticky PB was wonderful.
author: Steven C.

description:
When I was a kid, and did something good, I got to come here and get an ice cream.   It still resonates nostalgically as the perfect San Francisco treat.  There is the cable car that comes by with grinning touristas, there is a nice view, and the whole time I am pigging out on some great ice cream Sundays.  

When I get old a need to die, I want my kids to fill me up with ice cream here, then let me go in my wheel chair down union street, towards Van Ness.  A little bit of heaven before I get to go there.
author: Kapeli M.

description:
One day when I was a kid (like 10 years old) a man cut me in line to buy ice cream.

Lame.  Just because I'm a kid doesn't mean you shouldn't respect me.

Thank god he cut in line.  When the clerk rang me up, I had a red star on my receipt!  If you get a red star on your receipt it means you get a $5.00 credit on your order.  (or $10.00 I don't remember).

So I got my ice cream order free!

Moral:  Don't cut kids in line and you might get a free ice cream!

Also, you shouldn't be cutting kids in line in the first place you insecure bugger.  If i saw you now I'd beat j00r a$$.
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
Swensen's, a review haiku:

old-timey looking,
so many flavors to try...
holy crap that's good!
author: Ryan L.

description:
This is the stuff childhood memories are made of. When we were kids, my parents would take us here as a treat after a long day of visiting relatives and buying chinatown groceries in the city. My dad would tell us about how, as a kid, he sold newspapers on the corner, and about how he would trade Mr. Swensen a copy of the day's paper in exchange for an ice cream cone.

Anyway, Mr. Swensen is gone but the ice cream still remains. And it's still gooood, so good, especially on a lazy weekend afternoon.
author: kennon l.

description:
homemade ice creams and sorbets!!!
the strawberry ice is amazing
the lychee ice cream is amazing
they also make sundaes
author: Christopher L.

description: This is a must-try for anyone in San Francisco. They have a simple menu of ice cream at a decent price but the taste is amazing! It is very rich and creamy and old fashioned. Get a double scoop cone and enjoy walking along Russian Hill!
author: Julio G.

description: In the land of Humphrey-Slocombe and Bi-Rite, you need to bring your ice cream A-game. I know Swensen's has nostalgia on its side, but I prefer more newfangled flavors, and descriptions that actually match what is written on the board. Like my vanilla custard, which was nothing like custard and everything like a bowl of low-budget grocery store ice cream. At the end of the day, its freaking ice cream, one of mankind's greatest inventions. I just prefer other, better iterations.
author: Lesly S.

description:
Swensen's is possibly my favorite ice cream shop in San Francisco. It's been around for decades, and is one of the most cherished spots in Russian Hill. I felt the same way after having a scoop of ice cream there. 

I always end up getting their Cookies N' Cream flavored ice cream, which is absolutely delicious! I have yet to try too many other flavors. I've had their mocha fudge, which is also delicious but not extraordinary like their Cookies N' Cream (which I believe is the original flavor - but I could be wrong).

There usually is a line out the door, but the wait is usually not too long. However, you do need to bring CASH! They do not take credit cards (so keep that mind if you decide to buy a pint to take home.) 

If you have not tried Swensen's, you're really missing out!
author: Vrinda S.

description: Nothing special but not bad at all. Perhaps its location is what makes coming here fun, on top of the hill where the cable car passes.
author: Jonas T.

description: Simply the best! It may not be a fancy organic joint but it has stood the test of time- literally! And they make their ice cream fresh on the premises. The Sticky Chewy Chocolate is a favorite of mine. Bring cash because they don't accept cards. There is an ATM across the street at the local liquor/market.
author: Liv A.

description:
A historic ice cream shop, this makes the perfect after dinner spot on date night. Conveniently located on Hyde street near all the cute restaurants, this place is the best way to indulge your sweet tooth. 

The flavors are great and will bring you back to the old fashioned ice cream shops of your childhood.
author: lindsey l.

description:
If ice cream is good enough to beckon you on a cold and blustery day, then it must be Swensens. 

Best. Ice. Cream. Period.

Double bonus: if you're trying to pull back on the calories, they offer several light ice cream options. The light thin mint is just as good as any mint chocolate chip ice cream around... you won't miss a thing, promise!
author: Amanda W.

description:
Went for some ice cream with three girl friends after a lovely sushi dinner at Okoze Sushi. (Sushi and ice cream, interesting combo right? But two of the best things in life!)

None of us were very impressed. First of all, you couldn't even see the ice cream so you didn't know what you were getting yourself into. Second the ice cream was nothing special, I felt like for the single scoop price I could have gotten the same thing in a carton at Safeway. There really weren't that many exciting flavors, just your standards mostly. I ordered Thin Mint thinking it would be similar to the Thin Mint cookie or something, but no it was just plain 'ol mint chocolate chip. 

One of the girls got a waffle cone, which was tasty.

Overall, none of us were impressed and didn't understand what all the hype was about. It was fine. Not bad, just nothing special.
author: Meghan D.

description:
the ice cream is so dense and creamy its awesome. It looks like everyone's childhood ice cream place.

My only thing was that the green tea didnt taste like normal green tea, and I should have gotten the banana. The banana was sooo good ;_; WHY!! and the peach that my friend got tasted very refreshing.
author: Candice A.

description: No one makes their own ice cream anymore! It makes SUCH a difference. I got the chocolate and the sticky chewy peanut butter which turned out to be chocolate peanut butter. If I'd know that I would have just ordered a giant bowl of that. The peanut butter was salty and so good with the rich chocolate. I wish I lived in Russian Hill so I could eat this ice cream every day. Best ice cream of the trip! (And I sampled a lot.) :)
author: Elena M.

description: Came here for the Scoutmob free ice cream cone deal during an epic night of cramming for finals. The Black Raspberry marble was fantastic. Great times!
author: Michael N.

description: i jut don't think it is that good.  I've never gotten anything exceptional, and have definitely gotten some pretty terrible flavors.  Also, I know it is an Ice Cream shop, but no sorbet?  Most frozen treat stands at least have one non-dairy option.
author: Katherine D.

description:
Swensen's is classic that will always have a special place in my heart. My parents, grandparents, aunts and uncles all have brought me here at one time or another and it's grown to be a family favorite. There's nothing like the taste of ice cream, as you wipe sweat from your brow after climbing the hills up to the corner of Hyde and Union streets. To add to the goodness, the water from the fountain in the shop has to be the most delicious tasting, ice cold water available on Russian Hill. 

Now onto the nitty gritty. My favorite flavors are these: 

Peach (only made during the summer months)
Pistachio (only made in March for St. Patty's)
Rocky Road
Pineapple
Mountain Blackberry
Sticky Chewy Chocolate

Hell, who am I kidding, there are no bad flavors. Try them all!
author: Christina N.

description: fun neighborhood, near Lombard Street and Cable Car Museum.  No credit cards which to me is no big deal. And it's real ice cream, no trendy flavors, with lovely staff.
author: Deb S.

description:
One word to describe this place, cute. Though not my favorite ice cream in the city, once I am loyal, I am loyal, this place has some great flavors. 

It is also a long-time establishment, where if you get the red on your receipt, your entire order is free. I think this concept is a lot of fun, it is like gambling, but you get ice cream.

The location is on Hyde Street, along the cable-car line. This means that it is in a cute neighborhood, where there is usually a line, consisting of both locals and tourists, making it a destination ice cream shop.

I really liked the flavors and the line moves quickly. If you are on Hyde Street having dinner or on Polk Street at Happy Hour, stop by for some great ice cream and great atmosphere.
author: Christopher W.

description:
You are definitely coming here for the icecream - which is superb. I sometimes replace dinner with a double scoop of mint chip and cookies & cream. Just what you would expect. 

But: the shop is old school. Not in a very charming way, just in an old way.

Parking is a nightmare. Come as a couple so that the driver can park illegally while you dash into the store. Avoid walking if you can. It's a hike even from Polk St.
author: David R.

description:
I remember, when I was growing up in Santa Monica, Swensen's Ice Cream was everywhere. Over the years, Swensen's kind of just faded away... So you can imagine my surprise when I, completely by chance, came strolling by this place:  the first -- and last -- Swensen's in San Francisco.

Man, it's still as good as I remember. Just the smell of those waffle cones won me over. And what better flavor to taste the nostalgia? Old-Fashioned Vanilla. 

Makes me wish Ben & Jerry's had flopped so I could still enjoy this stuff, down in LA. =/
author: Matt P.

description: this is my favorite ice cream shop.  it may even be worth the parking ticket (it is russian hill after all) to get a cone of pepermint dipped in chocolate or their famous sticky chewey chocolate...i'm getting hungry
author: nick g.

description:
I walked in thinking I wanted a milkshake, but one look at the extensive menu of flavors made me think twice. Caramel Turtle Fudge sounded so amazing that I figured I might just have to get a cup of that. As it turns out, it tastes even more amazing than it sounds.

In the end, my desire to add another notch to my milkshake bedpost won out and I went with a Sticky Chewy Chocolate milkshake. Despite my asking about it, I'm still not sure what makes it sticky or chewy, but it sure did make for a delicious milkshake. Plus, it put me in an excellent mood that only got even better as I skipped merrily downhill (milkshake in hand) past the hoards of post-Lombard Street tourists.

Edit (12/29/09): The milkshakes are still amazing, and what's even more exciting (to me anyway) is that they will mix two flavors in a milkshake. I stepped up my previous order by mixing the sticky chewy chocolate-y goodness with thin mint. Mmmm!

Milkshake scale: All the boys to the yard. (http://www.yelp.com/list_details?list_id=quuUwlD01pr7A2ilWll59g)
author: Katie I.

description:
Best. Coconut Pineapple. Ice Cream. Ever.


Can be a little icy, though (and don't tell me it's "ice" cream -- you know exactly what I mean!).
author: Audrey J.

description: I can simply say, I love it!. When I am driving I stop by here many times a week just to get a treat for myself. The staff is always friendly and love the ice cream. If you are around Union and Hyde I would recommend stopping in for a treat too.
author: Dean C.

description:
It's ice creamily good.  Arghhh ..drool.   You know a place is good when:
1) You have to stand in a line extending out onto the street
2) A fire trunk pulls over, firemen get out and also start standing in line.  
3) The line is long enough that the firemen get called away before getting any ice cream.
