4) The firemen come back 20 minutes later with their truck, only to still not get any ice cream because they couldn't get in the door by closing.

I would had let them take my spot in line but I really wanted my ice cream.  It's damn tasty!  For people watching their waistlines, they've also got 97% fat free chocolate fudge brownie and fat free chocolate fudge.
author: Naomi N.

description:
Very very very good ice cream! 
Their French Vanilla Custard is sooo creamy and it has the perfect custard flavor-- a not too overwhelming, delicate custard taste. 
$2.50 for the perfect size small. 

The Bordeaux cherry I tried was also very good. 

I'm rarely this impressed with ice cream (i'm a self-proclaimed dessert connoisseur..)

Go for a Friday night fixing right before they close at 11pm. No line at all!
author: Saori E.

description:
Man alive! This is some of my favorite ice cream around. It's super creamy, super rich in flavor and super fresh. Its reputation precedes it. The scoopers are friendly. You really can't do much better than Swensen's in my opinion.

The peppermint stick ice cream is super sweet and has chunks of peppermint stick candy in it. The bittersweet chocolate ice cream is also good. The prices are great as well; it ran about 8 bucks for 2 mediums and a small. Much better than other places I've been to. If you're in San Francisco and you don't visit this place, you cannot call yourself an ice cream lover or fan (you don't HAVE to like it, but at least try it).
author: Martin B.

description: Love and hate relationship! I love this ice cream and hate how close it is to my house! YUM!
author: Honest Y.

description:
Flashback to 1988, when I used to visit my Aunt Nancy in Washington D.C., we'd go to one of the old Swensen's franchises across the street and I'd get a little cardboard cable car full of french fries and a hot dog drenched in butter.

Fast forward to 2004 - Swensen's franchises are no more in the US (but apparently popular in Singapore.)  I finally visit SF, see a cable car for the first time, and during a random walk up Russian Hill I spot this place. Could this be the original? It is - and the ice cream is amazing.

The ice cream is definitely fantastic but what really makes this place cool is the fact that it hasn't changed much in 60 years. A must visit for both tourists and locals.
author: Colin T.

description:
brings me back to old memories of when my mom used to bring me to swensons for a treat in Hong Kong! ha, because the decor and everything is original, delicious creamy yum.

i got the turkish coffee and my friend got a toasted almond dipped in chocolate. the scoops are huge and friendly service. place was busy even on a cold sf weekday afternoon.

thumbs up: for keepin' it real
thumbs down: might be hard to find parking.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
I'm a little upset that I live so far away from Polly Ann ice cream now, but after a date at the Hyde Street Seafood restaurant, we walked up to Swensen's for some dessert.

The bad thing about me is that I can never decide what I want to get.  It's like an extreme ADHD-ed kid in a huuuuge candy store.  I finally decided on the raspberry chocolate chip, and while my friend was deciding, the guy behind the counter was like, "We don't have that flavor yet!"  My friend was like, what??  And the guy said, "You're still thinking of a flavor.. We don't have that flavor yet!!  HAHA!  It's a joke!!"

When we went to pay, he was like, "$10 for each of you.  HAH!  She said it was okay!" and pointed at a random, unsuspecting older woman next to me.  She kind of gave me a very withering look, and I'm thinking, what did I even do to you?!

Anyway, the ice cream was excellent.  I wish they had more unique flavors like Joe's or Polly Ann, but the raspberry chocolate chip was om nom nom status.  Hooray for a new ice cream discovery!
author: Tori S.

description: ended up here twice. kids loved it - heard it was best in the city. right on the cable car line, too
author: chris m.

description:
They let you sample! Family-run place, feels old-timey and like the no-frills corner store that's been there forever.

I got the Swiss Orange Chip and Lychee in a cone.
You know how ice cream flavors can disappoint you when you can't taste what they're named after? Not so here. The Swiss Orange Chip has bits of hard chocolate for texture, amidst orange chocolatey ice cream. Not too sweet so you won't get tired of the large scoop before it's up. Probably the best fresh lychee ice cream I've had, with chunks of fruit every few bites. More mild than the orange chip, but just as filling.

Beware, your eyes will be bigger than your stomach but it's the latter that shows. I'm coming back anyway!
author: Amy N.

description: I consider myself a bit of an ice cream snob, and hate all the new age flavors like cotton candy and the like. This place has basic flavors (they still have variety, with over 20 flavors when I was there) that are delicious. The ice cream is very smooth and creamy with a great texture and flavor. FYI: Its cheap, has no indoor seating, and only accepts cash.
author: Josh O.

description: Seasonal spomonte just left us until next year, so opt for coconut or cookies and cream on the homemade waffle cone. Don't mess around with samples- they are all good but they do the classics 'oh so' perfect. Go now and bring cash. just simple, homemade icecream! nothing more is necessary.
author: Danica S.

description:
There is a red parking zone, right before the store. That's where we would always park, run in, grab some ice cream, and it outside (so we could watch our car).

This is the ORIGINAL Swensen's! First one to EVER open up, and I guess the original owner, sold the chain, but made a deal. He kept this one to himself, and never changed it. Yay!

The ice cream here is ridiculous! I love it. Come try it for yourself! Oh, the neighborhood is so beautiful too.
author: Charles K.

description:
Who doesn't give this place 5 stars? 
Great service, great ice cream, fair price, cool location. Watch the cable cars go by and see the people try and decide on the fly, "do I get out? well, do ya - punk?" 
Seriously, the Cherry is the best I have had so far. It is a very creamy ice cream, comparable to frozen custard (ice cream w. egg). For those of you who remember "Happy Days" I grew up on frozen custard from Al's (yes this place really existed and was the foundation of the show's creation) - Ok I am sidetracked. 

There really is no better ice cream solution in this town! I know there are the gelato faithful, but this is a true treat.
not 4 stars - but 5 for sure...
Enjoy
author: The Man M.

description:
A really cute neighbourhood ice cream place, I came a few weeks ago on a hot saturday afternoon and ordered the root beer float but unfortunately the root beer dispensor was not working. 

It has a nice traditional feeling to it and they have tons of different flavours to try, I will definately come back again.
author: Nina K.

description: Great ice cream, lovely family run shop. Rocky road is out of this world, get the hot fudge sundae! Enjoy!
author: Claire W.

description: This place is awesome.  I have come a couple times and the ice cream is always great.  It is very creamy and with great simple flavors.  I got this marble swirl ice cream this time.  It had a ton of fudge in it which was great.  I used the scout mob deal so I got a free scoop.  No hassle, the staff was super fast and I was in and out in under 2 min.  Great neighborhood ice cream parlor.
author: Mark M.

description: Went to Swensen's for the first time last night and had such a great experience! The man who helped us was super nice and cracked all kinds of jokes, and we even got the special lucky receipt with a red star on it, so he gave us $5 off! The ice cream was delicious and it was nice to go to an old fashioned ice cream parlor amidst all the trendy new ice creams places popping up. Will definitely be going back!
author: Shannon D.

description:
Love this place enough to stop here every time I go back home to San Francisco. Managed to get a $250 parking ticket some time ago by parking in front of the fire hydrant for less than 5 minutes. Don't do it!! Double park instead!

The store front isn't big and unlike other ice cream joints you can't SEE the ice cream. You have to read from the menu. But, my fave which is the Swiss Orange Chip, is delightful sight unseen. The walkaway sundaes are what dreams are made of.

I'm assuming they still do it... but if you find a red star on the back of your receipt, your order is FREE! Yahooooo! I won once.... after like.... 50 visits..... :9
author: Allison J.

description:
YUM!  We had ice cream at Swensen's after a delicious dinner at Zarzuela.  My boyfriend got peppermint, I got sticky chewy chocolate (it was chewy, strangely enough!  And yummy!), we both got sugar cones.

The selection is great, the ice cream is fantastic, and we hoofed up the hill to a little park near the Vallejo Steps to finish it off.  

I want more.  Right now.
author: diana s.

description:
Ice cream tops it off after good pizza at Za's. I can't remember which flavor I like, but I think it's all of them! ;)

You'll be in luck if you receive a red star, I haven't yet, but my friends' have but they weren't so lucky.... Kind of ironic, because they'd get free ice cream but then be punished by the DPT! WTF?!
author: Lester L.

description: I'm not writing a recent review, I'm writing this in dedication to a place that was a favorite treat from my grandparents when I was a child. My grandmommy and grandfather both and separately brought me here on many occasions and I grew up loving Swensen's original Ice Creams. My favorite flavors were the strawberry, lemon sherbet and turkish coffee. I have not been there since 1981 but I will make it a point to visit it this month in dedication to my grandmother who passed last Halloween.
author: Sakkara C.

description:
"Lemon Custard"

Even on a chilly San Francisco day, nothing pleases your palate like creamy lemon custard. 

Even if I do my routine Hyde-Green-Larkin-Union lap and "temporary" parking job, and were to come back and see a $75 parking ticket on my windshield (this has never happened), it'd be worth it for that lemon custard.

Even if I have an at-the-time grumpy person with me, I am convinced that lemon custard will do the trick.

Even if I were lactose-intolerant, I'd strap on some Dependz and do the darn thang.

Even if I were a tourist who came through on the Hyde cable car, had my wallet snatched by a pick-pocketer, and had only $#.## left, and got myself a lemon custard, it would surely bandage the wound. 

But especially following a bomb-ass ZA pizza session on a beautiful day in the city, there is nothing more San Francisco you can do for yourself than hit this institution. 

-NCM
author: Chiu Man N.

description: Great place. Can't find my "perfect ice cream" though and I don't think they have it here. You know what I mean? Trying to find that perfect desert place or perfect flavor you can have over and over again? If I find it here next time - I'll give it 5 stars.
author: Tony L.

description:
Swensen's and Mitchell's compete for the best ice cream in the city.
Swensen's gets my vote because they make the best chocolate ice cream I have ever tasted (and I make it a point to try a lot.)
Sticky Chewy Chocolate is the perfect chocolate ice cream.  There is no way that it could be improved!
author: Greg J.

description: Simply the best ice cream in San Francisco.   The place to go for real ice cream in San Francisco.
author: Robert D.

description:
I love Swensens Ice Cream!! 

I recommend: Pineapple-Coconut, Turkish Coffee or the always dependable, Strawberry.
author: Sarah Z.

description:
Would I be lying if I said I hadn't, on occasion of a desperate Sunday spent toiling away on grad school applications, hopped across the street to Swensen's for a dinner of... ahem... a chocolate milkshake?

Yes, yes I would be lying.  Damn you Swensen's.  If only I couldn't see you out my bedroom window...
author: Sarah J.

description: You must try this place.  Ice crean is still made the old fashion way here.. Oh BTW their double will feed at least four people..
author: George V.

description:
So it's 81 degrees and what better way to cap off the night with my girlfriend than getting some ice cream. Holy crap is their ice cream soft. After orderning all of a sudden there's a HUGE line behind us. They get served and then it's empty. Then another HUGE line emerges (one of the people standing in it happens to be Gavin) and while some tourists are walking by debating about where they should go some random dude just goes "Hey! You can't just walk by! Where ya from?" 
"Minnesota" 
"You can't come all the way from Minnesota and NOT get Swenson's!" 
I agree.
author: Mark G.

description:
Here is the deal.

The new flavor they got going, chocolate sticky chewy- something or another I can't quite remember the name- is out of this world.

Hands down, this is a great neighborhood joint. Nestled on the corner of Hyde and Union, you can't go wrong coming here before or after dinner.

Atmosphere:
You order  and take it with you. Most just step outside and enjoy their ice cream mingling amongst the ambiance of Hyde. 

It's old school in there. This place is one of the originals. 

Service:
These guys are quick. But they are not friendly and don't particular like dealing with customers who are unsure of what they want. Just put it up with it because the place is worth it.

Price:
you can get a cup or a cone- and it all ranges around $3.

Tip:
If you live close by and want to enjoy your delicacy in the comfort of your home. Ask for a cup with a lid and then the cone on the side. It's perfect.

Parking:
There is a garage right next door : 1945 Hyde St

You've just been yelped in.
author: Aaron A.

description: Give me a scoop of vanilla chocolate chip in a sugar cone and I'll love you forever.
author: Cary Elizabeth L.

description:
Yummy. We walked past some poeple on our way there and they had just come from Sweson's. My boyfriend said "How is it?" And the girl said "GET THE CHOCOLATE. IT'S AWESOME." 

By the way ,it's not open on Monday. We made that mistake already.
And it's expensive. $6 for a single scoop.
author: Meredith K.

description:
I once read an article comparing the different brands of ice cream.  The only thing I remembered from that article is that Swensen's ice cream is one of the ones with the highest fat content - and that's why it tastes so good.  Who cares about fat!  I grew up on this stuff and recently went there one night after dinner.  Somehow there's a different stomach for desserts.  This is my all time favorite ice cream place.  Highly recommended flavors include Toasted almond, Turkish coffee, Strawberry and Coconut pineapple.  

A word about the strawberry ice cream - it comes with chucks of strawberries.  If you decide to take a pint or a gallon to go, make sure it's hand-packed.  You will not find the strawberry chucks in the already packed ones.
author: Uimuim B.

description:
Rushed over here before they closed a few weeks ago and was so happy to try Swensen's!

They boys who were working were kinda in a hurry and pouty because I kept asking to try flavors so minus 1 for them...

I went with the rocky road and it was very yummy..not too sweet at all. I just think there were too many marshmallowd (mini ones) and not enough nuts.. but overall I liked it. The BF got cookies and cream and that was super yummy too..big chunks of cookie. 

Will definitely come back. :)
author: Joy A.

description:
After eating some puff pastry, sharing some risotto balls, a Jamba Juice drink, and downing a pretty huge slice of pizza, would I be in the mood for an ice cream dip?

I really wasn't until I took a look at the flavors this place had.  Man, if only we came here before everything else we could have had a bit of ALL the flavors there... but alas, I settled for the banana ice cream dip, which was freaking amazing.
author: Allan C.

description:
The lady and I will walk from Pac Heights for Swensen's, probably the best ice-creamery in the city. But no-credit cards? C'mon, is it that hard? Charge me 35 cents. 

However there is a little hidden park down the street on Hyde to sit and enjoy your ice-cream since there isn't any seating at Swensen's.
author: Chris B.

description: Parking is hard to find but their mocha fudge, cookies 'n cream, and chocolate chip are good!
author: Yvette N.

description: What's better than ice cream for dessert? Swensen's ice cream for dessert! I've been coming here ever since I moved to the city and I luv luv luv it! Pricing is ok. Please don't argue that their scoops are more expensive than a pint of Safeway ice cream. Hell, that's like saying beer is cheaper at Safeway than your neighborhood bar. Come on - it's the experience my dear! I would give one more star if parking was easier. I hate walking far to get what I want.
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Ice cream is a major weakness of mine. Most sweets are, but I've been eating ice cream on a regular basis ever since I can remember.  What I love about Swensen's is first of all the ice cream. But I also love that it's close to home!  And there is no where to sit inside (or outside I think...) which forces you to enjoy your ice cream as you stroll along my favorite street in the city: Hyde. (Especially on a warm night!)

Ok last thing I love about Swenson's is they have my two favorite flavors in light! Cookies 'n cream and sticky chewy chocolate :)
author: Julie B.

description: Best traditional ice cream that I've found in the city. The store is very small and small town/old fashioned/homey feeling. They offer 3 different kinds of vanilla; I've tried two of them and they were both AMAZING (old fashioned and regular vanilla). Besides the classics, they also have some more unusual flavors like lychee.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Delish.....if this place had seating, it would get 5 stars....

What a great area too. Although I am a yogurt lover, there is nothing that beats the yummy goodness of ice cream. When you walk in and smell that lovely aroma of the waffle cones, you know that you are in a great place.

When we arrived there on a Friday evening I was happy to see that this little corner store was doing a great business. They have a great variety of flavors and best yet, they have the chocolate dip that hardens into a lovely layer of pure chocolaty goodness.
author: Christine S.

description:
You know how the best part of making cookies is eating the cookie dough? Well, eating the light* sticky chewy chocolate is like picking up the bowl by two hands and licking up all the batter. I introduced Mupp to the light* sticky chewy chocolate last night and all we could do was obsess the whole way home about how...sticky and chewy it was. It tastes like batter...but better.

*Best part is, flavor does not taste, look or feel light.
author: Carolyn C.

description: I just moved down the street from Swensen's so it didn't take me too long to get myself over there and try it.  The shop itself looks so cute and retro, and I love that it's surrounded by hills so you can try to walk off some of the guilt after you've eaten it :) I'll definitely go ahead and agree with the other reviews-- the service is pretty lousy in comparison to the reputation of their product...my questions were met with grunts rather than helpful answers. Service aside, the ice cream was the perfect amount of creamy (I got the swiss orange chip per the 7x7 recommendation) and prices were alright (2.70 for a single cone), but I can't help but feel that it is a little overrated as it wasn't as flavorful as I had expected.  Regardless, I'm sure I'll be going back to satiate my (terribly frequent) ice cream cravings.
author: Laura C.

description:
One warm summer day, I dropped by to see a friend in Russian Hill. We walked from his place, right by Gary Danko, up hill to Swensen's, got a double-scoop ice cream cone each, and walked back down to Ghirardelli  Sq and down to the beach, people watched and then went back to his apartment. It wasn't a date but, as we were sitting by the beach, I was totally thinking.. Man, this could be so romantic!! So I am throwing this romantic date idea out there :) 

Anyway,  Swensen's has an old ice-cream parlor feel to it, which makes their ice cream even tastier than it already is. It is a small shop and I don't remember seeing any seating area there. But the place smelled so good.. like it's vanilla heaven of some sort. We could even smell the cones from blocks away. I had vanilla, my all-time favorite flavor, of course, and it did not disappoint me.  

I heart ice-cream :)
author: Kwan H.

description:
Swensen's... man, I remember growing up with Swensen's in the South Bay. There were two locations that I was a die hard fan of, one in the old Town & Country that has been torn down into the strip mall extravaganza that is El Paseo de Saratoga, and another at the end of downtown Los Gatos. Both are gone now, much to my utterly bitter dismay. A number of my finest ice cream memories belong to my youth and in the old booths at Swensen's, coveting my strawberry sundaes decked with extra almonds and a Neapolitan set of flavors... and those vanilla scented waffle wedges that I always saved for last. 
Good times.
I was (to put it lightly) ecstatic when I saw that the original Swensen's was still in business on a quiet corner of Russian Hill. When I got there, it was nothing like the franchise I remember--there was no large space for tables or booths, there weren't full lunch menus or crazy sundae concoctions that could easily rival and best Ghiradelli's monstrosities... there was no more strawberry sundae, just an small L display corner store basking in the weekend sunset glow.
But, they still had really, really good ice cream. I went for the banana flavor, something that I don't remember being on the flavor list when I was young but still a bit traditional--wow, it was so delicious, real banana blended into vanilla, creamy but not too whipped, packed into thick scoops on my cone. It evoked food thoughts of the banana milk shake from the Falafel Drive-In, another bit of hazy California nostalgia.
Well... we have a slew of other boutique frozen dessert venues--but for modest, straight-forward flavors with great crafting... Swensen's.
It's bliss.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I am one of the few people who does not adore ice cream!  I like it OK, but have to be reminded that it exists~
 
I get that reminder when I have my fave pizza at Za on Hyde Street 'cause Swensen's is just half a hill away from The Best Pizza. 

 It really is sublime ice cream.  They don't have any outrageous flavors, but what they offer is just fine.  

The cream.  The cream...  it must have a high percentage of butter fat because it is sooooo creamy.  Heavenly, I must say.  My fave flavors are Bordeaux Cherry, coffee and in the summer they make peach ice cream.  Peach!!!!  

This peach has a special place in my heart;  I returned to SF from a month of traveling in Europe and was simply glad to be home.  I grabbed a peach scoop in a sugar cone and walked up to the park on Russian Hill that has the beautiful view of the GG Bridge.  I just sat on the bench and let my pretty city welcome me home!
author: Karen W.

description: Tried to come here on a Monday - boooo they're closed!! To be noted.
author: Christina L.

description: Got the Scout Mob deal. Free ice cream! Besides getting it for free, the ice cream was very creamy and smooth. I got the Sticky Chewy Chocolate, my brother got the Mango, and my other brother got the Spumoni. The Sticky Chewy Chocolate is great for chocolate lovers. Mango was nice and Spumoni was different, the first time I had Spumoni. Overall great place, it has that old fashion feel and the staff are very friendly. The prices are decent too, not over charged.
author: Juk M.

description: When I was a wee little boy in Florida I had my birthdays at Swensons and then they mysteriously closed one by one. Now, it has come back into my life. Their gooey-chewy chocolate is a dream flavor -- and it comes   in a light variety. Get it chocolate dipped with a seltzer water to cleanse your palate and you have the ice cream version of ecstacy. Strange fact: we polled all the workers there about their favorite flavor and they all said it was vanilla. Weird.
author: Andrew K.

description: I had a sundae with cookies-and-cream ice cream.  Delicious!  It's so nice to find a quality ice cream joint that  doesn't cost $5 for a small scoop.
author: Nicholas N.

description:
Sunny Day in San Francisco equals Stop at Swensen's for an Ice Cream Cone. 

Deeeeeeeee-lish!

Rocky Road, French Vanilla Custard, Black Raspberry Vanilla, Banana. You name it, it's SO good.
author: Anna S.

description: It turns out that Swensen's is on the way home from the gym. A small scoop of rocky road  was the perfect size for the 10 minute walk home, and definitely hit the spot. After experiencing Maggie Mudd and Bi Rite, Swensen's just had too much to live up to. The orange chocolate chip ice cream reminded me of Triaminic (remember taking that when you were a kid?) and I wasn't blown away by any of the other flavors. I've lived here just long enough to be able to distinguish tourist traps from the good stuff, and this is definitely for the tourists. Hyde is so beautiful and picturesque, so it's worth it to stop here if you're out and about and enjoying the neighborhood.
author: Merrilee T.

description:
This was my favorite ice cream place growing up.  Perfect old fashioned ice cream, no fancy schmancy sundaes or crazy shakes, just plain ice cream on a cone and a few basic shakes.  Every flavor I've ever had has been great though I mostly stick to: strawberry, cookies n cream, mint chocolate chip and french vanilla.  

I don't know what else to say, go get one and try it out yourself!  This is GREAT ice cream, seriously.
author: Denise B.

description:
One of the oldest ice cream parlours in San Francisco.  This is the original location.  I remember when they had a another shop in Ghirardelli Square, which eventually became a Ghirardelli ice cream shop.  

I can only compare this to Ben n Jerry's, Mitchell's, Baskin-Robbins, and Haagen Daz.  This place has mostly traditional flavors and a few  tropical flavors like lychee, mango, and pineapple.  

I ordered the sticky chewy chocolate, which tasted like a fudgesicle or ice milk.  Not very chocolatey at all.  With a name like sticky chewy, I was expecting fudge pieces, but it was plain chocolate ice cream.  I had a taste of banana, and it was just as bland.

If you're in the neighborhood, it's not a bad place to have ice cream, but I prefer walking two blocks down to Loving Cup and having a frozen yogurt.
author: Naomi N.

description:
I'm craving for one of their sundae's right now just thinking about them!  It's the perfect place to go on a hot day (even on a cold night), after a hearty meal, or if you just want to satisfy your sweet tooth.  The ice cream is decadent and creamy, and the hot fudge is to die for!

My favorites:  Banana hot fudge sundae, Bordeaux cherry hot fudge sundae, vanilla hot fudge sundae.  Shoot, just serve me up a cup of hot fudge!

Anyway you go, Swensen's the best!
author: Rhoda A.

description:
Now that I live near this neighborhood, I'm in big trouble.  This ice cream is really good -- not too sweet, creamy and great flavors.  Even though I walked uphill to get here, I'm sure I need to walk ten more miles to walk off the fresh banana with chewy chocolate (many thanks to Liz S. who suggested it...!) that I just ate. 

Life is short. Must eat ice cream.
author: Melissa G.

description:
After eating a so-so dinner at Nick's Crispy Tacos nearby, I decided I wanted something really tasty to end the night well. All in all, this ice cream hit the spot. There are just enough flavors to feel like you have a variety, but not too many, that you feel overwhelmed and want to try all of them.

The ice cream was tasty. I ordered the mocha chip and got to try my friend's cookies and cream. It was creamy and delicious. The small is only $2.50 and its already pretty big. 

The only downfalls of this place is the service. Although the ice cream scooper people are efficient, they are also the unhappiest servers ever. They looked super bored and definitely acted like they didn't want to be there. Word to the wise, smile some time and you'll make more sales!
author: Katherine F.

description:
Pop quiz... am i aloud to dock a star for an establishment if they have a "slippery sidewalk" right out front?

you see, we had just made it in the door before the 10pm closing.  We loaded up with scoops of ice cream as big as grapefruits stacked on top of the sugary cone.  Juggling a conversation with the "leaning tower of Pisa" scoops was just too much for one person... she'll remain nameless because it just wouldn't be fair to let the world know she's not much of a multi-tasker... and i think one leg is a bit longer to boot.

So we can blame the slippery sidewalk or an invisible banana peel.  Arg!  And worst of it all is that i've been told the 5 second rule doesn't apply for ice cream on a sidewalk?  really?  just because it melts?  i believe the 5 second rule should be universally applied to all foods...  end discrimination!!!

Ok... now for the good stuff.  Even though Swensen's had locked the door behind us and were closing up shop, they were kind enough to offer a replacement cone and scoop for the person that'll remain nameless.  They even switched out the flavor to peppermint... who the heck gets raspberry anyway?

conspiracy theorists might advance that she subsconsciously took a dive to trade up flavors... although the bloody palm and a bruised ego are quite a hefty price.
author: Kevin F.

description:
Every time I go to Swensen's I think of The Goonies. Chunk would be proud, this ice cream shop guarantees to put you into a lovely food coma.

Warning: even the small cones are HUGE. 

My last visit I had my cone dipped in chocolate. Oh yes, they'll dip your cone in that yummy chocolate shell.

Good times.

And good eats.
author: M O.

description: There is a reason this place has over 500 reviews, mostly high marks. After a treacherous walk up the many hills of San Francisco to get ice cream, was so happy when I reached this place. It has the feel of an old ice cream shop and the number of flavors there is absolutely terrifying - you will need to take a few minutes to look through the menu to decide what to get. I got a mint chocolate and my friend got the sticky peanut butter. Both were delicious. I will come back here when I'm in the area or when I feel like making the walks up the hill (to make the trip even more worthwhile)
author: Jason B.

description: Get the orange chocolate chip. It was delicious and had a unique flavor!
author: Amanda L.

description: Came here on 2/3/10.  A great spot for ice cream.  I've been coming here for as long as I can remember.  My favorite is their coffee milkshakes.  There's a green zone out in front which makes it easy to pop in, in an area with hardly any parking.  Check your receipt for the famed red star for your opportunity to get your order free.
author: Stacey L.

description: The ice cream was good, but nothing extraordinary. It's basically a to-go place, no seats or tables anywhere. Not really worth it for the price. Cash only.
author: 偉文 W.

description:
Ice cream!  Yum!  $2.50!  I'd take it over a Baskin Robbins or Coldstones whatever any day.  Marble fudge is simple (vanilla w/choc swirl) but good.  Crowded on any night I presume such as the Sat night before dinner.

I'd take this over Diddy Reese as well
author: Yosie G.

description: Their ice cream tastes chemical. I was not impressed. I like the signage but thats about it. Seems like a tourist trap to me!
author: Lauren A.

description: I love this place. I grew up with Swensen's Ice Cream. It's nice to know there is still an old fashioned ice cream parlor that makes their product on-site. Great selection and friendly service. I used to come here as a kid. It's comforting to know that this true San Francisco institution still exists. When I'm in the area now, I always try to stop by for a scoop.
author: Sean H.

description: Ahhh....A trip back to my old neighborhood.  Swensen's Ice Cream is one of the stores I grew up with and is still around.  This place still does the Ice Cream as I remember it to be.  Yum!!  I had the French Vanilla Ice Cream today....you can't go wrong with that.  If I'm in the area this is my Ice Cream Shop.  Keep in mind no tables, no seats....go in order your favorite Ice Cream and take a stroll and enjoy the Ice Cream as it melts in your mouth......
author: Alan L.

description:
Haven't had Swensen's in years and it hasn't changed that much. The ice cream was good, but not fantastic, out-of-this world type of great. It's also a bit over-priced, all things considering, although this is SF so it's probably in line with that.


We are vacationing around the corner so parking wasn't an issue, but I could see how it could be if you don't live in the neighborhood.

I had a "small double" which was supposed to be 6 oz. On the bottom, Rocky Road; on the top, Coconut (one of my favorites). They were both tasty, but not particularly rich or extra-creamy and certainly not better than other ice creams I've had before.

My wife had Sticky Chewy Chocolate and Swiss Orange. I tasted both of hers. The latter reminded me of one of those cheap milk-chocolate "orange chocolate balls" that you can buy and break into wedges. Not my thing, but my wife liked them both and thought they were unique at least.

All in all, if you're in the area and don't have to park, it's better than B&J's or HD ice cream from 7-11, but if your'e going to make a special trip, there are probably other alternatives to consider.
author: Tim G.

description:
OK I know Swensen's has a million reviews. But if you're pondering whether to order the mocha fudge or the turtle fudge. Go with the turtle. 

If you question yourself about the cookies and cream or the turkish coffee...  get both in a Swensen's pint...it's only 25 cents more.
author: Johnny H.

description:
As a responsible Yelper, I must admit I was wrong: Swensen's does, in fact, have chocolate dip. It's been awhile because I have been busy hanging out at Mitchell's, ordering Grasshopper Pie. My opinion is still the same, just need to get the facts right.

Plus, now my best friend won't have to make a Yelp account just to refute my last post. I wouldn't want to put him through any unnecessary trouble... As a side note, our friendship of almost 20 years may now be in jeopardy after my discovery of his stance on the ever-so-critical Swensen's vs. Mitchell's issue.
author: Derek S.

description: Great ice cream, made fresh on the premises. Recommend the Turkish Coffee and the Almond!
author: Josh K.

description:
Oh hell, this place is a-freakin'-mazing.

Nostalgia for my elementary school days aside (when I'd walk here with my mom for a sweet treat), the quality of the ice cream was fantastic.  The serving sizes look small, but they'll hit your stomach like a stone if you're not careful.  The flavors are all rich and ultra creamy.

My favorite flavors include the peppermint and seasonal egg nog. Mmm.

The one draw back?  The scoopers looked like they had died a little bit, on the inside.  I can understand, I have had my fair share of sticky elbow days.  Yes, you inevitably get ice cream all over your forearms when you dig in those big tubs.  Parking around here is a drag, so park far away and walk.  I suppose the exercise can't hurt, after all of those calories.
author: Cat W.

description: Ice cream is good, not great. Prices are reasonable for San Francisco.
author: Juan R.

description: So I walked all the way up Russian Hill and found an ice cream shop.  In my eyes, I earned it.  I got the lychee ice cream - it was sweet and lychee-ish, but it didn't knock my socks off.  The place had plenty of flavors and good service.  Maybe lychee just wasn't the right flavor for me...
author: Melanie M.

description:
My treks between NB and the Marina are always fun knowing that I may potentially stop at Swenson's on Union. Yes, it's sad but true. I'm definitely an ice cream freak and this place is the s**t. A double scope of rocky road and I'm good to go. Sad thing is, stopping once on the way to the Marina and then again on the way back to NB is definitely tempting. 

Drawbacks? None. Ice cream rules!
author: Jonny Bobby G.

description:
I've been to Swensen's twice now, and ironically on nights that were a little cold.  Despite the cold weather, I persevered and still got ice cream.  So far I've had the chocolate cookie dough dipped in chocolate (yes, you read that right!) and the lychee ice cream.  The lychee ice cream was good, pretty light and tasty.  

Even though the ice cream is good, I wouldn't say that it's mind blowing - though having the choice to dip your ice cream in chocolate for a chocolate shell is pretty awesome.  

I think that the definite perk is having the experience of going to a quaint little place on the block on a warm day/night (warm night...hahaha....right...) with some friends.
author: Shay F.

description:
Disclaimer: I have only visited this place after walking around for several hours and being VERY hot - just when ice cream sound like the best idea! 

The first time we found it was completely by accident - my boyfriend was thrilled as he remember Swensen's from his childhood in CA. I didn't know what to expect, as this place looked ANCIENT, but I decided the old signage was charming and not creepy. 

I'm not sure I remember what flavor I picked last time, but the beauty of Swensen's lies in the details: ice cream is hand-mixed, packed and frozen right there in the little shop, and they have some pretty interesting flavors. This time I got the "mocha chip" - a very strong coffee flavored ice cream with perfectly-sized chocolate pieces. 

It's not fantastic ice cream, but it is VERY good. Definitely worth it if you happen to be in the neighborhood, or if you just need an excuse to explore the Nob/Russian Hill area. :)
author: Amie S.

description: I was just having a conversation yesterday about how there's not that many ice cream shops in San Francisco. Well, I have Swensen's near my home so I don't notice! Thin mint is my favorite but everything is delicious.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
Family's frequented Swensen's since the 1970s, at this same location.  Back then, everyone knew who worked there and the other customers (except the tourists from the cable car) and of course the 'cute' ice cream server (classmate of older sib) gave extra large servings.  Now we're just too old, ha.

Overall they haven't changed much.  A rewarding ice cream treat no matter what flavor.  I just stick to the old standbys of chocolate or strawberry.  I love that they're a real SF, home grown company.
author: Ye W.

description:
I've got longstanding memories of Swensen's, ever since my dad took me there when I was little, showing me where he grew up.

I love it, but to be honest, I'd rather go to Bi-Rite or Mitchell's. However, If I were in the area, I'd totally be here in a jiffy for the fabulous bittersweet chocolate ice cream. I approve wholeheartedly.
author: Amy L.

description: I honestly had not been to this Swenson's since I was in high school, but the ice cream is exactly the same as I remember it. Creamy and very nicely stacked on my cone. the price tag has changed though. $3.25 is kind of high for one scoop, but I guess it has been like 19 years since I was last here. The service was the only reason I would give this 3 stars instead of 4. They were not busy on a December night, but still kind of rushed us to decide on what we wanted before we were ready. I had my standard of chocolate chip, while the husband had french vanilla custard. Both were good, but not as great as I once remembered.
author: Erin M.

description: Its the second best ice cream I have had in the bay area.  Scoop is a touch above in quality, but the selection of flavors here is VERY good.  The sticky chewy chocolate and banana flavors go GREAT together!  And the Brazillian food across the way is incredible! Hit that, and then top it off with some incredible ice cream for desert!
author: Patricko O.

description:
A nice little neighborhood establishment that has been on Russian Hill since 1948.  There is something to be said for a shoppe that makes its ice cream on-site and has the traditional flavors, in addition to, a long rotating board full of inventive flavors.  

Parking near Swensen's, or in the neighborhood on the whole (I lived in the area for 3 years) is a nightmare.  My suggestion, have a driver and a runner, or, if you are daring, park illegally or double park.  Yes, it is that good.

If you are visiting the area from out of town, hop on the Beach Street Trolley, you can't miss it.  It is one trolley stop away from  the world famous Lombard Street.  

My favourite is the dark chocolate.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
So maybe it's wrong, but I tend to review ice cream parlours based on their mint chip ice cream flavour...

So be it.

I've experienced the jam packed chocolate chips of Mitchell's mint chip ice cream... and I've savoured the clean/fresh taste of Bi Rite's mint chip.

I enjoy Swensen's but when I have a craving and it comes down to it I am willing to drive to Bi Rite or Mitchell's (even though Swensen's is closer...).

Still Swensen's IS good and easily earns 4 stars.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
Thank god I live 4 blocks away from this place.  Just far enough that I won't get ice cream from here a little too often.  Old school home made ice cream is AWESOME.

I am embarrassed to say, one of my favorite flavors is the chocolate fudge brownie, also a fat free, sugar free option!   Oh but it's all about the toasted almond.  That's the shizit.  Sticky chewy chocolate is awesome.  And also the Swiss chocolate (think that's what it's called, the orange chocolate flavor).  Oh and the waffle cones.....
author: Jenny S.

description:
When you see "Swenson's Ice Cream" from across the street of Zarzuela, you anticipate an old-fashioned ice-cream and perhaps perky or giddy workers but we got someone who was probably not related to Mr.Swenson. He showed no enthusiasm or part of smile whatsoever. 

Emily: MMmmm do i want rocky road or pumpkin?  Mr. Scooper, can you just surprise me?

Scooper: No.

Emily: oh ok. I'd like rocky road then (psst, he just killed my mood)
author: Oanh N.

description:
I know more about the ice cream flavors at Swensen's than I'm happy to admit.  Prime Excuse: I used to live a block and a half away.  Now that I moved to the other side of town, Swensen's is the chief reason I like to go back on a regular basis.   This is supposedly the original Swensen's ice cream that was not sold along with the chain and is still independently run.   The ice cream is so yummy and I love to bring home hand-packed quarts.  Though it's not organic, the prices are much better than Bi-rite.
Favorite flavors: banana, rocky road, coffee, oreo cookie, mint chip, lemon custard, strawberry.  Actually the banana tastes really good with the chocolate :-).

Once when I was really upset (I think my garage space was blocked and I was unable to get my car out to go to some event outside the city), I went over to swensen's really upset and cried and they gave me a free ice cream. No kidding.
[FWIW: This wasn't a simple block-in. My car was parked in my rented extra-long spot in the Valencia Garage nearby, and another car had completely blocked me in, as it were parking tandem behind me.  It was not possible to get a tow truck into this space. I had to cancel my plans for that afternoon.  Yes, I left a note.]

This is a favorite spot with people from all over the city, especially cab drivers and police officers.

To avoid disappointment: don't forget, they are closed on Mondays.
author: Meredith G.

description: LOVE LOVE SWENSEN'S. I always stop by when the bf and I are taking our digestion walks...(I make him eat vegetable and foods that him gassy :D) I usually stick to my favorites...Bordeaux Cherry, Toasted Almond, Mint Chip, Fresh Banana, Strawberry, Green Tea, French Custard. I recently tried the Almond Malt or something like that and was quite good. oh yea Always on a sugar cone and dipped in sprinkles. YUM!!
author: Trang P.

description:
Had the Mint Chocolate Chip!  

Excellent choice by me!  

Next selection: Rum Raisin!
author: Alan T.

description:
This place is what got me to love ice cream. I used to live right across the street from them, and my grandmother would order gallon tubs of ice cream for me and my brother. Our favorites were always the rocky roads and vanilla ice cream. Over the years, we moved from that location into the Sunset district, and I still gaze upon fondly of the prospect of eating that good ol' ice cream again. The location and atmosphere totally makes this place what it is. 

Tips:
1. Do not even think about trying to find parking here. Just bus/cable car it here. Better yet, have a friend drive you there, and get them to pick you up. Parking is horrendous, and you'll always swear to god that the people driving here are tourists.

2. There's no seating inside. No tables, nothing. You can most certainly eat inside the parlor, but don't expect to rest your weary feet.

3. Bring some cash to tip your scooper. Also bring cash period. There's no credit card machine here.  The kids that work here are usually low-income students from the local high school, and trust me that they need every penny they can get. I haven't gotten bad service from these guys ever. But if you're a jerk, don't expect a smile.

4. Avoid Za-Pizza. I hate that place.
author: Clinton L.

description:
I have NO idea how this is considered civic center/tenderloin, but.. I love having an ice cream place in my neighborhood. 

They've recently hired some new kids, who haven't quite figured out the ropes yet, so you have to be patient, but it's totally not a big deal. 

Favorite flavors include: bittersweet chocolate, lemon custard, toasted almond, sticky chewy chocolate. I really don't think there is a bad flavor though.. however, for the City Slicker die hards, you will be able to find the perfect match to your dinner here.
author: Heidi L.

description:
I lived a block away from Swensen's Ice Cream store for about three months and their late opening hours could had proved to be a real danger to my waistline if I had stayed any longer...

I'm not a super fan of ice cream - but I do love milk shakes and I think I invented quite a few combinations there during my visits. All of them tasted great though.

It's a quite place and the ice cream is good. It's however not amazing in anyway and I wouldn't drive across town to have ice cream there but if I was in the neighbourhood again and the craving came over me - sure :)
author: Rich S.

description:
Dude! Ice cream and milkshakes!
and I'm spent!
author: Anita C.

description:
Whenever the weather is nice, the urge for Swensen's always comes up. I love the local shops that make all their own ice cream. There's just something really great about that. 

So I go here whenever it's warm and so does everybody else. But the people behind the counter work fast. 

I try to experiment and try different flavors but I like what I like. I always order the Turkish coffee with chocolate sprinkles. Yummy. I've not had choclate sprinkles like their's anywhere else. The sprinkles here are very fine and don't have a waxy aftertaste.
author: cyndi L.

description:
Have the cable car drop you off right out front.

The flavors, the nostalgia, and the milkshakes...mmm good stuff.
author: Dpb T.

description:
Two words:

Lemon Chiffon

I drool just thinking about it! YUM YUM YUM! 

All in all, I am actually not an ice cream person. I can take it or leave it, but wow. Their Lemon Chiffon is out of this world! It's fairly close to home and it's one place I'll miss after I move to another neighborhood. 

This place isn't trendy and it leaves a lot to be desired as far as ambience, but you don't come here for any of that. You come for the ice cream. No frills, but very good. Highly recommend.
author: Anita B.

description:
The ice cream is above par, but the real secret is the exclusive eggnog they slang during the holidays.

Sprinkle with a little fresh ground nutmeg and maybe a splash of cognac,  you're really in for a treat.
author: Isaac L.

description:
The Perfect Date Stop #4:

This is my favorite ice cream shop in the city and boy do I love the frozen cream. I prefer the mint chip or peppermint in a cone. Make sure you buy your dates ice cream as well, maybe you will be rewarded with the special red star. Take those ice creams for a walk up Hyde to the second to last stop on the date... The top of Lombard Street.
author: A W.

description:
BEST ICE CREAM EVER!!!*

*pretty good ice cream, friendly service, but the 5 stars is heavily based on the fact that my g/f who LOVES this place, and would give me a hard time if I gave anything less than 5 stars =P
author: Eddy N.

description:
best ice cream i've ever had probably.. O_O 

my bf used to work here and told me how great it was. so i've been wanting to go for a while.. finally got to go this past summer and OOMGGG.. i was thinking "WHY DID I NOT COME TO TRY THIS YET!!!" 

yes. it was freakin delicious. i had banana ice cream.. which made it even better because how often do you find banana ice cream??? well.. i don't find it anywhere... SOOO this was a major plus for me :D 

sometimes you can watch them make the ice cream through the windows. pretty cool i think.
haven't been able to go back yet, but definitely will SOO hopefully.. even though it's been freezing lately.

but anyway, i recommend! yes, there is little parking and huge hills to get to it... but it's worth it :)
author: Sachiko K.

description: Real icecream. Living on the east coast all my life, I hardly ever saw frozen yogurt. Then I move to California and all of a sudden I can't find real icecream (besides Coldstone... ugh). And I thought California had those happy cows? I digress... anyways this place reminds me of the good old icecream places back home, plus some interesting flavors like lychee. And the guys working there are nice and funny.
author: Melissa H.

description: walked about 2 miles to find this little gem on top of a hill. got coffee and caramel turtle fudge and it was absolutely delicious. their green tea was not that great, didnt really tasted like tea.
author: Martin L.

description: This is a San Francisco institution. It's been around forever. Tourists and locals can enjoy moderately priced ice creams and frozen yogurts. Need I say more?
author: Tash T.

description: Swensen's reminds of me of asia, cause there's swensen's all over HK and singapore....totally random, yes I know. But in any case, the atmosphere here is super duper kitsch ice cream parlor and what with the array of flavors, this place is hard to resist. The ice cream is pretty good here, nice and creamy,  although I am spoiled by the mitchells and bi rites and humphrey slocombes in my neighborhood. Overall, a decent choice over in the russian hill neighborhood.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This place would've gotten a five but...they stopped making my favorite ice cream. The Lemon custard! Ever since I was born I loved this on my waffle cone and love getting the chocolate shelled dipsy do on top. But, no longer so the next ahh best thing the Banana or Cherry or Coconut is cool. Cookies and Cream with the choco shell is my ish now and love this place whenever I'm in the neighborhood. Parking is a B so if you have relatives and are fortunate to find parking in Nob Hill then take a hike up the hill to enjoy this frozen goodness.
author: graham c.

description: Neat little place to stop when you're looking for some ice cream and want to take the cable cars  (but dont bring your ice cream ON the cable car).  They have about 20 flavors - including some "lite" ones.  Overall, not bad.  Although $7.50 for 2 ice cream cones was a little steep...but you are in SF.  NO indoor seating at all.
author: H G.

description: I would say this is the best ice cream place in the Bay Area, but it's really the only ice cream place I frequent!  On top of that, the only flavors I get are Sticky Chewy Chocolate and Black Cherry.  They are absolutely delicious after a slice of pizza at Za's Pizza down the street on Hyde!
author: Chris F.

description:
I wish I could give this place 4.5 stars rather than just 4!  Swensen's has some amazing ice cream and true Americana charm; when you walk in you can smell the sweet deliciousness ready to titillate your tastebuds on first lick, and just walking by the old school store front makes me nostalgic (and I've only known about Swensen's for about 2 months).  

The portions are immense--I ordered a one scoop cone of mint chip, and am loathe to find out what the double scoop looks like!  My tum was filled to the brim with ice cream, and I'm one of those girls who can eat a pint without blinking an eye!  

The mint chip was delicious--sweet, minty, big hunks of chocolate, creamy... My only complaint is that the chips didn't have my preferred ice cream texture.   (I've found that if you use the real deal, 100% chocolate chips in your ice cream, the cocoa butter content gets super hard and crunches in your mouth rather than melting and yielding under gentle pressure.  It's when you use chocolate chips that have been augmented by coconut oil or some other fatty substance that the frozen guys maintain an appropriate room-temperature-chocolate-like feel... but that's just me)

BF had the seasonal pumpkin flavor, and he was in heaven.  You could taste the pumpkin pie spice with each lick!  Not to mention it was amazing the way the pumpkin ice cream texture resembled the mild grittiness (for lack of a better word) of real pumpkin pie.  Dee-lish!

My one hope is that when the warm weather comes there will be outside seating, because walking home while trying to both hold a huge scoop of ice cream precariously perched on a cone and simultaneously hold Alex's hand brings about torturous memories of that perfect double-scoop cone I ruined at the tender age of 7...  Ice cream on the street never tastes as good as on the cone.  :(
author: Ashley S.

description: I can't believe it's so small. No chair, you can't sit or chilling here. The ice cream is very creamy and milky. I ordered green tea ice cream. It's really good, but it didn't make me go WOW like those authentic japanese ice cream stores because japanese people make the best green tea ice cream. I was wrong to order it here. Next time i'll order something else :))))
author: Suvida N.

description: After the extremely hot weather in SF this weekend,  I needed a treat..  Come to Swensons to enjoy a delicious ice cream cone, sundae, or shake .  You can choose from many delicious flavors and they are all good to the last lick.  The staff is great!  Come here anytime whether you are down and out,  too hot, or you just want to take care of that sweet tooth, & bring your family,  friends, date, or take your animals for a walk here........come here and have a great pick-me-up!  Yum Yum.  The neighborhood here is very cute too!  SCREAM FOR ICE CREAM .. Yeahhhhhh!
author: Dayna C.

description:
Swensen's is great but only on a seasonal basis.  I've gone when they've had some great exotic or different flavors, such as pumpkin or licorice.  But then sometimes their selection of flavors really isn't that special.

But it's great ice cream and a good stop for a refreshment if for some reason you're hiking up the Russian/Nob Hills.

And should they have pumpkin on the menu, get it, it's awesome.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Years ago I lived around the corner from Swensen's. Thank god it was an uphill walk.

If you find yourself in Russian Hill at night make the climb up union. I prefer the cherry. Around Christmas time they make an eggnog even a noneggnog person like myself could enjoy. The vanillas (yes plural) and lemon custard are also worth mentioning. If you love hot fudge run don't walk. 

It's even possible to take a cable car to the front door. How could you resist?
author: Angela K.

description:
I'm super biased towards Swensen's because of the fond childhood memories of having to choose between peppermint stick, caramel turtle fudge and "motherload" sandwiches at our store back home. 

The fact that this is the original Swensen's makes me like it that much more. Just typing Swensen's makes me want a hot fudge sundae RIGHT NOW. 

This is no Bi-Rite, but it doesn't need to be. It's got the views, the cable cars whizzing by and the richest chocolate milkshakes EVER.

**FYI **Mom just told me the ole Swenson's back in Jackson, Miss. closed its doors last month. :(  I just shed a tear in my milkshake.
author: BroSauce J.

description:
How can you possibly beat this place? 

The friendly nerds behind the counter, the ghostly figure creating a batch of ice cream inside an observation chamber like a mad, bored scientist...this place has it all. 

Old School. Perfect place to have dessert after a slice at Za Pizza down the block.

Rocky Road forever!
author: Phil W.

description: I had forgotten about this place, but when we finished dinner next door, luckily we decided to pass on dessert there and instead headed to Swensen's. They're fully-staffed with like 4 ppl, so even though it was packed, we were licking our scoops before we knew it. Their ice cream is really good, can't wait to go back. Good selection, I went with sticky chewy chocolate, which to be honest, would be better if it had some sort of chewy chunk in it like brownie or something, but is still so good.
author: Lauren M.

description: I'm a sucker for their Black Raspberry Marble ice cream dipped in chocolate.  They have the traditional flavors with a few unique ones.
author: Lisa L.

description: I typically want to recommend every place I try- from falafel to doctors to makeup- but Swensen's was hugely disappointing!  I was really pumped up to try Swensen's, as I am new to the area and have heard many rave reviews.  And who doesn't love ice cream parlors?! I tried a scoop each of peppermint and cookie dough and both tasted like the freezer and probably would have been just "okay" without the ice particles.  I can usually ignore below average food if the service is great, but I was (again) disappointed.  My husband and I were the only customers, but every employee treated us like a huge inconvenience.  I reaalllly want to like this place, but I can't find anything too positive to say.
author: Kate W.

description: The last of the old time IceCream Parlors (almost). Swensen's had a huge expansion in the 70's and 80's then contracted back to the original location. Back in the 60's in SF there was Swenson's, Mitchell's, The St. Francis on 24th St., Garrett's on Alemany, and Shaw's, are the one's I recall. Swensen's is the only one who makes lemon ice cream that I LOVE. (Garrett's used to but is long gone). They don't always have it, but it is my favorite. Whenever I have an excuse to drive by, I dash in for scoops of lemon, banana, or rocky road.
author: Joe B.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco! The thin mint is divine. The sticky chewy chocolate is great for chocolate lovers. The strawberry has delicious chunks of strawberry. They have so many flavors, you can't go wrong! They also have fun seasonal flavors. It's definitely small and no-frills, the guys behind the counter are no-nonsense, and it's cash only.
author: Amanda L.

description: Delicious ice cream and great service!
author: Galit B.

description: I grew up on the east coast where we had simple flavors.  And then I moved to SF home of freak a leek flavors found at Humphreys and Bi Rite which are very good.  However, sometimes I want something more traditional and I crave that Ratatouille moment where after my first lick of ice cream I am transported to the 5 yr old version of myself.  I think Swensens is this place.  The only thing missing is a card that is punched after every order and your 8th ice cream is free.  Just a suggestion :P
author: Sarah C.

description:
After one year of living a block away form Swensen's, I finally decided to get an ice cream cone on a hot October night. The cash register rung up a little red star on my reciept - making my purchase free. Not only did I get a fresh cone and deliciously creamy ice cream, I didn't have to pay anything.

Vanilla Caramel and Mint Chocolate Chip are my current favoirtes. I Will have to update this after trying out all the rest of the flavors.
author: Asheem M.

description:
It's good ice cream, but i agree with LaShanda G. about the raving about it. I lived 2 blocks from Swensens this summer so i went there a few times, but being from the south (texas also) we have been spoiled with good ice cream like Blue Bell. I couldn't imagine ice cream being better. People in the north order it online so much because it's a southern treat. Swensens is just a normal ice cream place with a small history. It's ok, go there if you want, but I have a few other places in mind first.

What I Ate:
I had chocolate one day and cookies and cream another day. Also Vanilla at one time.
author: Preston B.

description:
The best - PERIOD!

Strawberry, mocha fudge, mint chip, on a cone.  

No tables, long lines, on the top of the hill... WHO CARES!

Not to be confused with the former chain of ice cream stores, this is the original.
author: Collin W.

description:
Best ice cream in town, but customer service is usually aweful.  They act annoyed with everyone they serve.  One of the guys just starts shouting "NEXT, NEXT, NEXT", but the ordering area was too crowded and the girls in front of me couldn't get up to him in the 2 seconds he allowed.  So he just walked off into the back room while the other two servers kept working.  You better know exactly what you want, cash only, and say it fast, or else they act like it's the end of the world.
Just watch them as you wait in line. Its too bad they treat customers like that, the icecream is so good.
author: Nate B.

description: I love this place. This small ice-cream shop is very cute, old-school type. It looks like just another old ice-cream shop, but do not be fooled by its appearance. I will say that this shop is one of the best ice-cream shops in the city. They have a great variety of flavors and all of them are so yummy! Although I live in completely the opposite end of the city, I would sacrifice time and gas to drive all the way to Swensen, because when it comes to ice-cream i like the real creamy-yummy ice-cream in crunchy waffle cone. I usually end up getting at least 2 cones of ice-cream- all for my dear self.
author: Yuliya B.

description: I love Swensen's like a fat kid loves cake
author: Alex H.

description: Quality ice cream!  YUM!! I'm glad I convinced hubby to drive back to get some cones.  After walking up and down Lombard, I was beat.  Dropped the friends off at the Pier and wondered, do we have the energy to go back and wait in the line?  Glad we did!  First off, Swensen's is smart!  They don't show you any of the ice cream until they open the lid to scoop it.  So, they don't waste ice cream on giving crazy amounts of samples or have people holding up the line, debating what to get.  The culture is: you look at the wooden menu, you go for a flavor..they unveil the ice cream for just 5 seconds and present you with the cone.  I got the chocolate turtle fudge and hubby got mocha chip.  I had no freaking clue what the chocolate turtle fudge was but it ended up being a wonderful gooey mix of chocolates and nuts.  Seriously, I savored every bite.  Swensen's has now been added to one of my fav ice cream spots in the city.  Yum Yum!!
author: Steph W.

description:
It's hard for me to decide which is better between Swensen's and MItchell's (haven't tried Joe's yet)...so I'm just not going to!

The variety of flavors at Swensen's isn't quite as extensive as Mitchell's, but the consistency might be a tad better.  And I like the surrounding area better at Swensen's, whereas Mitchell's seems sort of out there.  Although parking in Russian Hill sucks.

I wish there were more in the Bay Area though - all the old Swensen's I've known have closed!
author: Karen L.

description:
Swenson's is addictive. It makes me feel like a grown-up (I can eat ice cream whenever I want) and a kid all at once. It's old school and very delicious. I always went for mocha chip, sometimes cookies n cream and rarely strawberry, but recently have discovered and fallen madly in love with their toasted almond flavor, which is like those yummy cookies on clement st. but better because it's ICE CREAM.

Last night we ran into none other than Mr. tall dark and sleazy hot Gavin Newsom, by himself, waiting and leaning against the counter doing some paperwork. (Glad to see San Francisco's finest was still working at 8:30 p.m. my tax dollars at work ).  My sister-in-law cozied up next to him and coyly in a high girly voice said "so what's your favorite flavor?" to which he cocked his head and responded "Rocky Road of course," then did a wink without winking and strode out. It was really funny.  We agreed, though both of us are married, that he was sleazy and a little greasy but still totally charming and hot in that Bill Clinton way.

Anyway!!! Go for the ice cream -- even though dessert like chocolate bread pudding at Frascati's is hard to resist -- Swenson's provides a perfect dessert topper for all the neighborhood restaurants or just a nice after-work treat.
author: Ashley S.

description: I loved coming to this place as a child and now I am actually bringing my children to eat here. Too bad they do not make the lemon custard flavor anymore. Any of their home made flavors are a treat to the palate. The kids love having the cone dipped in chocolate. Try this place out and you will not be disappointed.
author: Marty M.

description:
after picking up our last ice cream groupie in north beach...we skipped the gelato and headed straight for the creme de la creme... REAL ICE CREAM! 
  1 scoop of FRESH BANANA
+1 scoop Sticky chewy chocolate
_________________________
 =BEST COMBO EVER!!!!!

the chocolate was thick and sweet...which was subdued by the amazing refreshing, FRESH BANANA...oh bananas. so real, so fresh...and so clean clean!
author: Lynn T.

description: This is the only place in the city that serves real pink peppermint ice cream (not the crap you find at Safeway) year round. (Mitchell's serves it during Christmas only.)
author: Sharon W.

description: Simply delicious!!!!!! The toasted almond is to die for. I love that the ice cream is rich and creamy and unlike the chain ice cream stores, the ice cream isn't airy. The service is also awesome!!
author: Minie J.

description: came in when it was really crowded so i didn't have the luxury of trying many flavors. compared to other places, ice cream is pretty sweet. more old-fashioned.
author: Ann B.

description: Yummy ice cream!  It tastes fresh which is the best part, not like a 31 flavors, but real delicious ingredients.  I got the sticky chewy chocolate or whatever its called and it defiantly satisfied my chocolate craving.  I can't wait to go back and try more flavors!
author: Cara D.

description: For some reason this past weekend I was obsessed with banana ice cream. It all started with Swensen's! We were walking back to my friend's place and decided to get ice cream. I'm SO HAPPY we did. I got a scoop of the Fresh Banana ice cream and a scoop of the Rocky Road. I could not shut up about how tasty it was. Seriously, seriously tasty.
author: Tatiana J.

description: My yummy neighborhood ice cream joint.  It's no Bi-Rite, but it's still a goodie.
author: Jen Z.

description:
I love ice cream and it doesn't get much better than Swensen's. Not only do they have a delightful selection of flavors, but the experience! Ah, the experience. I just love this little place. 

Sugar cone please. And with sprinkles. Oh yeah.
author: Aimée G.

description: This is one of the hardest reviews to write because what more can I say apart from my opinion that this is the best ice-cream place in San Francisco - and perhaps the best I know in the US. I just absolutely love coming here and just love the swiss chocolate orange. I'm a creature of habit and I don't think I would ever get sick of this flavor, it's just wonderful.
author: Sharon H.

description:
With all of the trendy, unique flavors in San Francisco now, old-fashioned, classic ice cream parlors get lost and forgotten, like this one. How does this place only have 400 reviews and other ice cream places have 1000+, it's crazy to me! My favorite flavor is mint chocolate chip and I have to say Swensen's has probably one of the best I have had. It's so creamy and tasty. 

I have been coming here since I was little because it's a few blocks away from my grandparents house and I always liked it's classic, old-fashioned charm. I hope we don't forget about places like this.
author: Kimberly N.

description: The absolute best ice cream I have ever had!! HOmemade ice cream at its best and very nice to just grad some and take a nice walk down the windy road :)
author: Nessy N.

description:
this is the best ice cream in town, when I go to Thailand and or Singapore they have these Swensens stores all over. They have the best sundea's for the money. The ice cream is rich and creamy like HD or BJ but without the extra 50 cents for the one scoop cone. see you at the Russell Hills location.

highly recommended and will see you there for some killer ice cream.... try the sticky chewy chocolate...by far the best of the best.
author: rasaka s.

description: Best Ice Cream in town!!!!!!!   YUMMY .. What a great San Francisco treat.
author: Michelle W.

description: I write this review with the fresh article from sfgate.com in mind. Swensen's used to be an out the way treat, sought out whenever I was in the area. Many flavors have resonated but none so much as the Lemon Custard. That flavor (along with the short lived Grape Ice from Baskin Robbins - anyone remember that?) was a strong part of my childhood and the go-to flavor as an adult. Why oh why have you discontinued it, dear Swensen's? If it was because of slow sales I would have organized a Facebook rally or something. I would have personally gone there to buy a gallon or two a week! *sigh* Yourotherflavorsaregoodtoo.
author: Erick K.

description: There are two places in San Francisco that are "the" places to get great homemade ice cream. This is one. They are both neighborhood joints and on opposite sides of the city, so I really don;t see them as competitors. That being said, the other one is Joe's in the Richmond district.
author: Robynne W.

description: I bought into the hype of Swensen's. When I moved to Russian Hill, I was told I had to go. So I went. And now I can say I have been, and probably won't go back for a few reasons. The Green Tea ice cream...not good. And light on the Matcha. I want real Green Tea ice cream, and thus far have only had good Green Tea ice cream at Japanese restaurants. It is a little too pricey for the lack of flavour. It does have a nice old creamery feeling, but that is about the only thing this place has going for it. Not to mention the epic trek up Union, the ice cream was not worth the hike.
author: Jessica S.

description: I used to live across the street from Swensen's. D A N G E R O U S! I've been here multiple times for dinner. Thank god they have low fat ice-cream. Sometimes I would get that if i was feeling particularly hefty on that day, but obviously the real shit is where it's at. I would eat ice-cream everyday if I could. This place rulez.  The walkaway waffle sunday is the best.  It comes in a waffle cone with whatever typeS of ice cream you want plus whipped cream, nuts, and a cherry.  It's so large, they have to place the cone inside a cup! It's amazing. The staff is super friendly too. They're closed on Mon/Tues (I can't remember - but it's definitely one of those days) and sometimes the line can get long around 8 pm!
author: Jenny W.

description: Best cookies n cream hands down.  Usually get a pint and some cones to enjoy all week!!!
author: Dermot M.

description: My grandma was very close with Earl and Nora Swensen who founded Swensen's ice cream. They were the sweetest couple and so in love with each other. As a kid I'd go in and Earl would serve me the biggest ice cream cone you can imagine. I swear it was bigger than my head! At the time I just thought - yum!! Ice cream!! But now as an adult going to Swensen's is not just for the fond childhood memories but also for the great ice cream! This place is a quaint little ice cream shop for anyone but it's old style gives kids a magical feel of being in 'real' ice cream shop.
author: Ali R.

description: You have to try this place!  Tons of flavors to choose from and great location!  A walk away from Lombard and farther in the distance is Coit tower or Chinatown...My favorite?  Mocha Chip!  drool......!  =P****
author: Brian Y.

description: A good neighborhood ice cream shop.  Has an old-time feel but is grab-and-go.
author: jay w.

description: Wonderful childhood memories wrapped up in this place. Great staff, great quality, great favors. Old fashioned, like going to the ice cream parlor should be.
author: Gina M.

description: What a great place to grab some ice cream after walking up russian hill! I stumbled upon this place during my meander around the nob hill neighborhood. Great selection of ice cream, classics with some unique flavors as well. True they don't have any seating, but it's in such a fantastic location, you can just stroll along enjoying the architecture, views, and delicious ice cream.
author: Jessica R.

description: There's always room for Swensens!  Try the Swiss Orange Chip--a classic!  It hasn't been retired, unlike the Coconut Pineapple :(  My parents have been taking us here since we were little, and I view this place as a true San Francisco landmark.   Note: CASH ONLY!
author: Ali C.

description: Thank you, Swensen's! Whenever I visit, my cramps don't hurt as bad, my bank account doesn't seem that empty and I'm completely okay with my jeans not fitting the way they used to before we met. You're dreamy!
author: Esme W.

description: Thank god for the hill between me and this dreamy sweet shop! LOVE IT!
author: Dee C.

description: Considering I've pretty much lived in S.F. for most of my life, I can confidently say that this place is completely overrated!  Not creamy and tasty enough for my liking.  Hit up Ghiradelli Square or get a pint of Haagen Dazs instead.
author: Danielle V.

description:
After eating the cookies and cream ice cream here, it's really hard eating another brand.  Huge chunks of oreos, rich creamy ice cream, makes me want to get some right now.

Favorite 3 flavors:
1.  Cookies and Cream
2.  Fresh Banana
3.  Sticky Chewy Chocolate
author: Cal H.

description: A taste of history! Ice cream and sherbert, plain and simple, in one of San Francisco's oldest sweet shops. This is the store that Earle Swensen opened in 1948. No seating. Cash only, but there is an ATM across the street . Go on a warm day, then stroll down Hyde and watch the cable cars rumble past.
author: Gregory M.

description: The only place I know of where you can still get Sticky Chewy Chocolate. My favorite flavor as a kid.
author: Jason R.

description: All of my friends are dairy free, so I don't eat ice cream nearly as much as I'd like to.  Swensen's reminds me of my childhood.  I lived near one down south, and they had great banana splits.  This Swensen's is just as good.  Very nice to see they're still around.
author: Jin W.

description: Walked by this area on a rainy Sunday and decided to stop in for some frozen delights. Settled for the Bordeoux Cherry with sugarcone! Delightful...with lil bits of cherries and the sugarcone was fresh and crispy!
author: Yan M.

description: I am in love with Swensen's lychee ice cream! If you crave lychee ice cream that's not sorbet, come here, and you'll be very satisfied :)
author: Han C.

description: I love you Swensen's I do. I'll happily walk up Hyde just to get a scoop of you!
author: Liri R.

description: Thank GOD they are still around. I had my first non green pistachio ice cream cone here many years ago. When they had a store down near the wharf.Oooo I coming over to get me some real soon... THE BEST...period
author: Jay E.

description: This place is an original.  As a little girl, I grew up in this area and bought my ice cream cone for  12 cents and 15 cents back then. I am really dating my self.   Of course it has gone up with the times but it sure looks the same.  They even gave out ice cream cones for Holloween (trick or treat) vanilla flavor only.  My favorite flavor to this day is "Thin Mint"  Their scoop is quite generous.
author: Gloria H.

description: My favorite Ice cream is at Bi-rite...but Swensons is my favorite Ice cream place by far. Danny makes the best Mocha Fudge Milkshake in the city!!! I drive across town for this...I really do!!!
author: Terry O.

description: By far the best place to get ice cream because they have been established, they have friendly servers, prices are great, and THEY HAVE THE BEST ICE CREAM, maybe in SF (to me). And it also close by to my house, another good thing, but parking is not good if you are driving from afar. If you're coming to the city, try this place.
author: Q W.

description: Go to Ghirardelli, laugh at the prices and jump on the cable car up Hyde to Swensons.  Better prices and better ice cream that Ghirardelli.  The staff are jokers and occasionally generous with the scoops.  Get a cone and walk down to lombard at night (or day) for a great view of the city.  Best ice cream stop I've been to so far in the city. CASH ONLY
author: Owen S.

description: 1st time trying Swensen's this past sizzling hot Sunday.  I was disappointed with the Green Tea ice cream.  It tasted like butter pecan and I swear I tried my best to taste the green tea.  The lychee was not bad, but I'd rather go stand in line at Michell's!
author: Jason A.

description: I occasionally wander by Swensens after eating nearby and find it to be the best ice cream in SF.
author: Sven S.

description: I love cute, simple, old school ice cream parlours. I got the Caramel turtle fudge, I think that's what it's called, with the recommendation from the scooper. There's nothing too unique about the flavors, but I just felt so homey and loved as I was eating my huge, cheap scoop. And it's not because the scoopers were all Asian. On par with Mitchell's...and that's a bold statement. Too bad there's no place to linger afterwards...we ended up finishing our scoops in the car haha.
author: Hana J.

description: Old-school ice cream. It takes you back to the 1950's when ice cream eating was a family-bonding affair. From traditional flavors like Rocky Road (my absolute favorite) to green tea, the ice cream is delicious. There's no place to sit, but you can kick it in front of the store or walk off the ice cream around the hood.
author: Karen L.
