description: Simply the best ice cream, and a San Francisco institution.  My favourite is the fresh banana ice cream with hot fudge and nuts.  Luckily it's a 2 block walk up-hill, if I'm feeling extra naughty, I'll walk up Union instead of Green for a sweet reward after a hellish uphill battle.
author: George K.

description: My families gone here for decades and I was introduced to it a few years ago when I moved up from Hawaii. I've been in love with it ever since!  Banana and Turkish coffee rule!  Service is usually good and the ice cream is made in the store.  I always have to stop there after a great dinner in the city.
author: Kale T.

description: No other place has Cookies n' Cream with such enormous chunks of Oreos...they throw entire cookies in there and it's just fantastic. I like walking home with a huge cone of Swensen's in my hand!
author: lindsay w.

description: I've been to Swensen's ever since I was a little girl. I always got and still get Swiss Orange Chip flavored ice cream. THE BEST!
author: Gina P.

description: If you like good ol' American Ice Cream.. then Swensen's is the place for you!  I used to work here when I was a kid, so I might be slightly biased (haha).  All the ice cream is hand made to perfection.  A thumbs up to them for staying true to the nostalgic ice creamery look and not selling out by selling fro-yo!
author: Alan N.

description: There is NO frozen yo gurt here contrary to the label on my mobile yelp.
author: June C.

description: I love ice cream and I'm on a hunt to find the best ice cream in the city.  Was recommended to try Swensen's and I believe it's pretty good, but not the best I've ever had.  Their chewy sticky chocolate is probably the best - very creamy.  I also tried the strawberry slushy ice cream and it does taste just like a strawberry slushee, but a little weird as ice cream!  It's not really their fault that there's no parking in the area and I had to drive around 10 times to try this place out, but it still had an impact on my ice cream experience.  Also, I am sad that they do not have the Chocolate Earthquake available since they're not really part of the "franchise".  I would've given another star if only they would accept credit card - at least for a minimum charge of $10!  Or I'd even be willing to give another star if I could try that Chocolate Earthquake....it looks AMAZING and I'd eat it all day.  Sucha fatty!
author: Dee H.

description: First of all, this location should be declared a landmark in San Francisco. This ice cream shop has outlasted any ice cream parlor in San Francisco with the exception of Ghiradelli, but Ghiradelli is in the touristy area and Swenson's is not. I used to work here when I went to high school at Galileo in like 1982. Loved it. I have always been a fan even before that. Yeah there's Birite Creamery who boasts about being unique with flavors, but when it come down to your traditional gotta have my sticky chewy chocolate, Swenson's rocks. Maybe that's why they have succeeded where those who haven't...they keep it simple and try not to be trendy. So if you're ever in the San Francisco area, especially on Hyde/Union Street, drop in and have a cold one. Also, they have a killer water fountain. The water is nice and cold. The service is what you get...their high school kids. Give em a break and tip.
author: William M.

description:
Im lactose intolerant but the stomach ache and sickness later are well worth it for the delicious taste of Swensens. I live across the street so it can be dangerous, but nothing beats a scoop of fresh banana ice cream, or even a banana milk shake made with a real banana AND fresh banana ice cream! it's a tiny place, but on a really good corner so, even though you can't eat inside, standing on the curb, while waiting for the 45 on a Saturday afternoon is pure bliss. The cable car stops right there as well so it's not a bad idea to hop off at Swensens, get ice cream and work it off by walking the rest of the way up Hyde on your way to Lombard St. ;)

HOWEVER, they only accept cash, which I HATE, but i'd gladly go to the ATM for Swensens.
author: Sarah I.

description: Their ice cream is amazing! I don't come here often as I'm trying to get buff for an upcoming cruise but when I do, it's a real treat. Total cutie local SF favorite.
author: Sadia J.

description:
All the reviews on here are the same: 4s and 5s. So I'm gonna go with a 2. Why? Simple:

1) They don't take credit cards. Coming from Berkeley, where no one takes cards, its really annoying having to constantly carry cash all the time and be Swensen-less when you don't have cash. I thought I was finally moving to civilization when I moved to the city. 

2) They are closed on Mondays. WHAT?!? For what reason? But why a 2, you say? Yesterday was 93 degrees and all I wanted after a day at work and a long ride on an overcrowded stuffy bus was some damn ice cream. Too much to ask for? I live a block away from one of the best ice cream spots in the city and I had to settle for Ben N Jerry's ice cream from Walgreens. 

Get it together, Swensen's! If you want a 5, you're gonna have to keep up with capitalism, and that means helping us dig ourselves into debt with the plastic stuff and staying open 7 days a week -- especially when the weather is so hot BART rails are breaking and manholes are exploding.
author: Hash Z.

description:
Swensen's  makes delicious classic and new classic ice cream flavors on site!  I love this ice cream joint for many reasons.  

1. No terrible lines like at Mitchell's or Bi-Rite
2.Delicious low-fat options that still taste amazing
3. Big servings for the price
4. My fiance took me here on our first date.

Sometimes you just want a classic pecan praline,  or mint chip.  No one does it better in the city than Swensens!
author: Maya C.

description: Pretty good ice cream but there's definitely better in SF . The cookie dough was alright . I didn't like the lychee . I LOVED their light cookies n cream . It really impressed me . It was not too sweet but semi sweet and it made me feel less guilty about indulging . I give Swensen's an extra star for carrying light flavors . It's cool and I don't see that anywhere else .
author: Eileen L.

description: Great. Homemade icecream! Lychee and Green tea!!! I will be back. Plus, as the cherry on top to this place, I won the $5 off deal. This means that when you get a red star on the back of your receipt, you get $5 off. It rocks! Saw that they had half gallon icecream for $10. Just go for it.....
author: Elizabeth L.

description: More and more I'm finding that I just don't like full-fat ice cream that much, unless it has something really interesting going on (humphry slocombe, etc). Regular ice cream just usually leaves me feeling like I have a thin, residual layer of cream coating my mouth, so I prefer pretty much any kind of frozen yogurt. But even putting that aside, Swensen's seems to have much less interesting flavors than Mitchell's, let alone Bi-Rite or HS, and even the standard flavors didn't seem that -good.- I got a caramel turtle flavor and there was a smattering of fudge and some nuts, but not much else. Sure, maybe I just don't appreciate traditional ice cream - but I think I do enjoy better versions of it. Also, they used to have yogurt but don't seem to any more, and their lower-fat selection seems pretty limited. I will give them that their prices seem reasonable ($2.50 for the smallest non-child size, which was pretty decent).
author: Lisa K.

description:
although this place is owned by asians (i think, b/c this old man and this teenaged kid were behind the counter) this place is so old school.....  its kind of run down, but its like that old ice cream parlor where save up your left over lunch money and you get ice cream and you go out and play with your friends as a kid. 

i'd have to say i like the ice cream here just as much as i like the ice cream at bi-rite creamery, but without the long ass line! so i will give it equal stars. 5 stars!

prices are good for what you get too!

i don't come here often though, parking is so hard to find. last time i was here i had my bf park by blocking a driveway, and i ran in and got ice cream for us and ran back out!!!!!
author: Irene C.

description: Quality ice cream. Great prices. Cash only. Loved cookies n cream, has real chunks of cookies!
author: Margherita S.

description: great family owned joint. always has cool seasonal choices
author: NB K.

description: I'm not really sure how you can find anything wrong with this place. Great ice cream (bittersweet chocolate) in a delicious cone at a decent price (2.25). It also doesn't hurt that they've been around for 50 years (I remember going as a little kid to the one in my hometown that had the little train traveling around the top of the restaurant)...
author: Nicolas H.

description: The two stars is primarily based on the green tea ice cream.  It was green but that was about it.  Didn't even taste like green tea.  What's the flavor of just ice cream without any flavor?  You know, just like cream?  That's what this tasted like, just with green coloring added.  I ended up throwing it away.  Still looking for something better than Polly Ann's or Mitchell's green tea ice cream....
author: kiwi l.

description: Oh, I'll be back, that's for sure.  Swendsen's was refreshingly old-fashioned and unremodeled, and not one of those tiresome over-emphasized ice cream meccas that every city seems to have.  It's small, actually.  Major bonus points for having some nontraditionals: mango, turkish coffee, lychee come to mind.  The peach was creamy, slightly icy, but full of peach chunks... more than acceptable by my standards, but I thought I detected a hint of artificial flavoring.  I am, however, planning several more evaluations.
author: MScott S.

description: excellent home-made ice cream. Their banana is killer. Every time I go I always order too much because I can never decide on just one flavor. I took away one star because of the consistent tummyaches I get from eating too much swensen's. maybe it's their fault for being so close and so gooooood.
author: Melissa C.

description: The orange chocolate favor is unbeatable.  I only wish it was across the street from my house!!
author: Freda P.

description:
all i have to say is YUMMMEEEEEEEE!!!

Love the milk shakes!
author: KAT E.

description: I scream, you scream, we all scream for Swensen's ice cream ...  Best milkshakes in the City!  Another classic hit: chocolate dipped cones ... I'm a kid all over again.
author: Gavin M.

description:
I remember Swenson's used to have more locations in the East Bay, particularly El Cerrito.  Later on, the business downsized, almost all of the stores closed and low and behold, one Swenson's remains (or a few others across the country).

I cannot tell you how much I miss Swenson's every time I go there.  The prices are great and unlike that Chinese reviewer who said the service isn't good, the service IS good.  I always get what I want and no hassle.  And I've lived in the Bay Area my entire life and Chinese workers CAN provide good service.  

Forget Ben & Jerry's, skip Baskin & Robbins (which isn't real ice cream) and hell, Cold Stone Creamery is OK.  

But if you like Mitchell's or Lapert's ice cream, you'll love Swenson's.

And besides, any fuss over seating in Swenson's is pointless.  Everyone in Russian Hill orders and quite simply has no problem standing.  They all enjoy it!
author: M B.

description: OMG- if you love vanilla ice cream you will love Swensen's. Four different vanilla's and let me tell you they really do all taste a tad bit different. AMAZING!
author: Sarah S.

description:
I have been coming to Swenson's for ice cream since I was a wee babe.  Literally.  My parents first house was blocks from this place, so I remember when an ice cream come here was $0.45! (A cone is a little more expensive now, but still...) I used to come here for trick-or-treating Halloween vanilla cones, and grew up on the orange sherbet. My tastes run to mocha fudge now, but they have zillions of flavors.

So maybe I gave this place 5 stars for nostalgia's sake, or maybe I just have a weakness for retro places that make their own ice cream.  All I know is that I can't get mocha fudge ice cream (no nuts, hooray!) anyplace else on Earth, and I don't want to!
author: blooregard q.

description: I've been eating their ice cream for three years now. I decided to do this review after trying their chewy chocolate. I don't know how they do it, but it is simply amazing. Anyone who says otherwise don't know a thing about ice cream.
author: Janne K.

description: swensen's definitely has a great selection of ice cream...from green tea to lychee...to old fashion vanilla and chocolate....tastes great...i've got the golden ticket...goldenvticket...reciept with a star!...$5 off..
author: Hen A.

description: 5 stars for the yummy ice cream and for being the same place grandpa loved going to back in the day. He's got good taste!
author: CHERiE Y.

description: Another great place for ice cream. I like how you have to walk up that big hill to get up to the place if you were to be walking up from Larkin st. They really make you work off those calories before you consume some more! Butterscotch marble, Turkish coffee, and coconut pineapple are my favorites.
author: Juliane N.

description: I had to try it b/c so many consider it the best icecream place in SF and I see why.  Lots of flavor choices, I wasn't expecting to see flavors like Mango, Green Tea and Lychee there but they have good taste.  Never in a million years did I think I would order Vanilla but I did and no regrets, it was so good!
author: Debbie Y.

description: This is the perfect place to go on a date after dining in one of the many quaint restaurants along Hyde St.  They have malt milkshakes, sundaes & awesome flavors.  My personal favourites: coffee mocha & bordeaux cherry...
author: Mahogany G.

description:
mmmmmmm sticky chewy chocolate on a sugar coneeeeee mmmmmmmm

(psst - get the low fat, it's still super sweet and chocolatey and you can feel better about indulging!)
author: Alice H.

description: Swensen's is a cute ice cream parlor with a friendly atmosphere. There isn't any seating so if you want to eat your ice cream expect to stand outside or sit on the curb. Swensen's is a great place to hit up after dinner and they had lots of flavors and different ways to enjoy ice cream. The sundaes looked so good. Def. a Fan and will go back.
author: Leslie C.

description: My favorites are sticky chewy chocolate and the chocolate chip cookie dough flavors.
author: Ryan C.

description: I'm not really sure why people rave about this place.  I know it's homemade and all, but it's "ok" ice cream.  I'm from Texas where we have the best ice cream in the country, Blue Bell.  And I'm serious, that's really their advertising slogan, and I have to agree.  You can read the testimonials here:  http://www.bluebell.com/folkssay.htm  It's so good, that I'm actually thinking about ordering some on line, where you can get 4 half gallons for $89.  But back to Swensens...I sampled about 5 flavors at Swensens before settling for my standby, cookies and cream, and it was just ok...nothing to write home about.  I also tried a shake from there as well and it was ok, but a bit too sweet, so I wouldn't get it again.  If I happen to be navigating the hills of Russian Hill, I might stop by there again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit.
author: LaSha G.

description: Its ice cream. I'll give it that.  Swensens is really nothing special though. Ok, its homemade, the place looks like it is right out of the 50's and they have interesting flavors and isnt completely disappointing. Seriously though, it should be a lot better than it is.  I actually prefer Ben & Jerry's to this place pretty much any day - even out of the freezer.  The service is nice and they have a pretty good rocky road. But come on people, its just average.
author: D S.

description: The people who work here are very unfriendly, but who cares? They serve good lemon ice cream.
author: Faye S.

description: Up a very steep hill and another less steep hill, you arrive at Swensens. I came tonight at around 9 p.m. and there was a line out the door. They were quick to serve and I had the light thin mint small sized cone for $2.50.  I tried the waffle cone (an extra $1.00) with the Turkish coffee...it was also very good. I enjoyed my cone all the way down the two hills and 5+ more blocks to my house. They don't accept credit cards but are willing to break a $100!
author: Natalie S.

description: I don't even like chocolate ice cream but the sticky chewy chocolate was fabulous!!! I'm not sure about the regular flavors, but their light flavors are really good and not overly sweet.
author: Mary P.

description: It's a nice spot, great SF neighborhood, and the old-fashioned store is pretty sweet. My favorites are: (1) cookies n' cream, (2) chocolate chip cookie dough and (3) strawberry. Make sure to get this in a waffle cone... it's amazing!
author: Brian B.

description: Why mess with success....these folks still have it going strong.  The seasonal favorites of Egg Nog and Pumpkin are solid additions to the varsity squad of flavors they've been offering since before you were born.
author: J. R. H.

description: We love Swensen's hot fudge sundaes so much, we will drive across town, risk parking in the bus zone to run in and order.  No place to eat in the store, but no problem.  Just go back to the car.  Their hot fudge is the BEST.  No kidding.
author: Janice P.

description: not to be mean,  but this was just another ice cream place. i liked it but i didnt love it
author: Nick S.

description: Being from the midwest, I miss the ice cream parlour on every street.  It really is the great American pasttime.  Went here after another fantastic meal at Frascati.  Delicious and totally hit the spot.  I got the pineapple coconut, husband got mint chip and mom got sticky chocolate.  All delicious.
author: Janet L.

description: Yes. It's that good. Everything is good.  The chocolate chip is full of real chocolate bits, for example.  They also do chocolate dipped cones, whereby the ice cream portion is dipped in a hard chocolate shell.  I've never seen that done outside of the world of soft-serve.  Yay, Swensen's.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Homemade ice cream at the top of Russian Hill. All the other Swensen's get their ice cream from Phoenix, but we got the special location!

After a fairly long and warm day at the North Beach Festival, the two hellions (my twin girls) wanted to ride the cable car and get ice cream. Not in that order of course. So I dragged them up the big hill, purchased some ice cream.

Nice to know that I can order a 1/4 or 1/2 lb of ice cream, as denoted on the menu as one or two BIG scoops. Great choice of flavors, and I was buzzed from my 1/4 lb of Turkish Coffee ice cream. 

The girls meanwhile managed to spill most of their ice cream on themselves, me, random strangers, side walk and cable car.

Great ice cream in a classic location with incredible views.
author: David B.

description: I love ice cream - if I could eat only one type of food for the rest of my life it would be ice cream.  Swenson's makes one of my top 5 favorite flavors - Swiss Orange Chip.  Yum!  It is just like a frozen, creamy chocolate orange.  Thankfully Swenson's is a big uphill walk from my apartment so I don't feel quite so guilty indulging.
author: Julie P.

description:
having paid 3 parking tickets, and not to mention, having my car towed in russian hill last year...i've come to realize that the DPT meter maids are out to get me...and that my 2 hrs of parking are up!  time for me to run out into the cold and check for chalk marks on my tires!  checked all 4 tires...whew!  nothing!  ...but...right across the street...there's a Swensen's!  i guess i'll make up for this hike up the street by treating myself with a small lychee ice-cream...or mango...or pineapple coconut!  

so i hear this is the ORIGINAL Swensen's ice cream, which makes the visit even more special!  everytime i pass by this place; day, night, cold, rain, snow, blizzard...there's always folks outside the corner of union and hyde enjoying their scoop of yummy-ness!

Things you might need to know before you come here is that they take CASH ONLY.  also...be prepared for the parking craze!  ...if you see a parking space...be quick to steal it....or else...there goes another 30 minutes of driving 'round!
author: Nancy T.

description: Not a huge ice cream person, but theirs is really good.  I had the Banana flavor and it was fantastic.
author: sara r.

description: Sometimes when I feel the need to have a sundae, I waltz down to Swensen's.  It's not really cheap ice cream, but it's tasty and it's open until 10 every night.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Swensen's is a San Francisco institution. There's nothing better than grabbing a cone of cookie dough ice cream on a (rare) sunny SF day and strolling/climbing Russian and Nob Hills while admiring the views of the bay as cable cars pass by to provide the perfect background noise.
author: Natalie T.

description: There used to be a Swensen's next to my orthodontist's office, so every time I'd go there to get my braces tightened, my mom would take me into Swensen's afterwards for an ice cream  (I kid you not).   I must've been into that Swensen's a hundred times. My favorite flavor then--and now-- is the German Chocolate Cake ice cream-- chocolate ice cream with coconut, walnuts, and little globs of caramel. . . order a double scoop, and you've got yourlsef heaven in a sugar cone.
author: shoba d.

description: After 3+ years of living downhill from Swensen's, I finally made the journey uphill to check this place out.  I really thought my little heart was going to explode as I climbed upwards, but I can tell you it was well worth it.  If I had collapsed and died after the first lick of my cone, it would have still been worth it.  Their banana ice cream is unbelievably tasty.  It actually tastes like bananas - imagine that!  On our walk home, we ran into another couple walking a 10 week old chihuahua.  It was the cutest thing I have ever seen in my entire life.  The whole experience made me feel like a 10 yr old girl in some happy, magical land of sunshine, ice cream, and puppies.  If only every day could be so delightful!
author: Squirrel L.

description: YUMMY! Great place to get dessert after eating a nice (and hopefully light) meal at one of the Russian Hill area restaurants. I got strawberry in a waffle cone, single scoop, and it was still a HUGE serving for me. Next time I will try one of the more eccentric flavors like Mango or Blackberry.
author: Orie M.

description: There is nothing bad about Swensen's except going up that goddamn hill. Their peppermint ice cream is so heavenly!
author: Carson H.

description: I love this place been coming here since I was a kid. Last time I came here was a few months ago after a break up... I guess childhood comfort foods call back. The French Vanilla really hit the spot. Another good thing, I got the red star so the cone was on them. I always recommend this place to tourists, if they're looking to get some ice cream in this semi-non existent San Francisco summer.
author: Christopher T.

description: It invented the perfect food group...and it's called sticky chewy chocolate. They make it on premises, will dress it up in standard Sundae attire, and transform it into the best shake ever. My only wish is that Swen was open 7 days a week...sigh. But ,if they have to be closed, then I suppose Monday will just have to do...at least they're open past 11.
author: Julia C.

description: My roommates and I used to have a ritual of stopping here to get ice cream on our way back to Sacramento for the weekends. How long ago? Too many years to mention. Their ice cream has a rich creamy texture that has been consistent. My favs are the Turkish Coffee, Strawberry Sorbet, Coffee Mocha, Lemon Chiffon, Bordeaux Cherry and the Swiss Orange Chip!!! Yes they are a chain, but one of the few that makes their ice cream in house. Mitchell's is great too, but there's something about this place and it's history for me.
author: Arlene C.

description: Unbelievable. I tried the blackberry, the mango and the thin mint flavors. So delicious. I'm definitely going back. The mango was just to die for.
author: Anand I.

description:
I actually really like the people behind the counter. Sure they're not what you think of "ice cream shop people." They don't make you feel like you are eating rainbows and sunshine, but why should they? They are serving you the best ice cream on Russian Hill. And they know it. 

They also care in a way that actually matters: if you are short a couple of cents (I am always short 2, maybe even 5 cents, without a hitch) they have no problem saying, "don't worry about it" in their seemingly apathetic way. I don't care if they don't have an extra bounce in their step. I don't care if they don't always smile. I like their sincerity. 

For a month straight I would come here twice a week to buy a quart of marble fudge, mocha fudge, and/or cookies and cream. Turns out there is a glass case of half-gallon containers filled with all my favorite flavors for a dollar more. Who told me? The seemingly apathetic people behind the counter who really care about me. I love Swensen's.

In honor of how this wonderful place makes me feel, I have written a haiku in honor of my favorite flavor:

Swensen's Marble Fudge!
Brilliant swirls of chocolate,
Make my heart happy.
author: Franc S.

description: DELICIOUS!!!!!!! I had a yummy scoop of mint-chocolate chip light and it was awesome.  Just be prepared to take it on the road..no where to really sit or stand inside.
author: Heidi B.

description:
Definitely the best ice cream in the city.  Move over Mitchell's, Swensen's owns your ice cream.  This is straight clod your arteries, heavy cream, goodness.  Damn tourists always get in the way though.  That is the only downside.  Too many people taking too long to order their ice cream.  I WANT MY CHOCOLATE CHIP, GET OUT OF MY WAY.  

Other than that, great ice cream, great atmosphere, great workers, great ice cream machine maker (in front of the store), and great water fountain.  I would give it  10 stars if it went up that high.
author: SAS Z.

description: This part of Hyde Street, north of the Broadway tunnel, is really outstanding, especially at night. You could totally put together an amazing experience to really impress a date, the sort of evening which the movies would have us think can only be had in Paris. You have these subdued storefronts, the kind that don't loudly call; they are discreet, refined, confident in their own arrived-ness, as calm as the 15th-generation scion of a family which landed with the Bradfords on the Mayflower. You have these fine restaurants whose dim lighting bathes the nighttime sidewalk under the canopy of leafy trees which one imagines were probably planted before the Golden Gate had a bridge. The conclusion to your magical evening, the ideal setting in which to seal the deal, the perfect place to strike the coup de grace, when your date is waiting for your invitation back to your place, is to get ice cream from this place, whose outside and interior appear to be preserved in amber from the early 1960s. The ice cream is top-notch, but the place is really special because of how it fits in to this extraordinary neighborhood - a gracious bit of uptown Manhattan (think 5th Ave around 70th or 80th).
author: Michael E.

description: Seriously fantastic ice cream.  I know this place doesn't need any more reviews, but when it is freezing and windy out, about to rain any second, and this place still beckons my patronage, you know they are doing something right.  Flavorful and creamy and bonus: lots of SF history there.  Yesterday was my first visit in a long time, so I don't have a lot of precise suggestions on the flavors.  I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong with anything, but Rocky Road rocked my world yesterday.
author: Lauren H.

description: The Old Fashion Vanilla was delicious! I was bummed that they ran out of the waffle cones though. Hopefully next time! Cute Neighborhood too!
author: Melinda Q.

description: Turkish Coffee, Cookies & Cream, & Sticky Chewy Chocolate are my all-time favorites.  I've been coming here ever since I was a little girl. Even now, Swensen's is still my destination for ice cream cravings and after Giants games with the family.
author: Stephanie W.

description: The neighborhood changes, but Swenson's doesn't.  It still makes the best ice cream in town. The French vanilla is the best.
author: Bibi R. R.

description: If you can score a parking spot, you should indulge in a mint chocolate shake.  Divine.
author: Kelly J.

description: The cookies and cream malt is my favorite. While I try not to indulge too frequently, Swensen's is a great ice cream joint and a convenient location on Hyde.
author: Marielle C.

description: They have lychee ice cream!  It's so good.  Lychee ice cream is hard to find, but Swensen's has it.
author: Wakako U.

description: Three little words that changed my life forever: Swiss. Orange. Chip.
author: Ben R.

description: Their pumpkin ice cream is phenomenal. Would never have thought about ordering it, but wow!
author: shadi m.

description: I grew up going to the Swenson's restaurants in NY, who knew I would end up living a few blocks from the original.    Any cool SF night calls for a walk to Swenson's, some vanilla with hot fudge?  Game on.
author: Dan G.

description: Bring your throwin' elbows, kids, because you need them here. Everyone crowds in this little corner shop of awesomeness to get to the yummies, but that's evidence of it being completely worth it. They even had my new favorite, pumpkin--though not my ultimate, bubble gum. After you get it, walk along the tree-lined cable car tracks on Hyde Street with your cone in hand and feel like you're in some rad new Norman Rockwell painting.
author: Shannon V.

description: Oh my stars, one of the best ice cream sundaes ever. I got the hot fudge with toasted almond ice cream and I was in heaven. The only thing is they have nowhere to sit inside so it's kind of a grab and go place. I kind of like it though since it's at the top of russian hill I feel like I'm burning all these calories just getting there and going home so I don't feel as guilty about my delicious creamy treat.
author: Cathy T.

description: Great location atop Russian Hill, but feels very quaint and low-key. My boyfriend took me here for some old-fashioned ice creamery romance and told me about how his native San Franciscan parents went on dates here themselves years ago. Apparently Swenson's still holds the same charm as it did back then, and hopefully will for many more years. (cue soft romantic music....)
author: Christy M.

description: When it's warm, and sometimes even when it's not, I take a short walk to Swensen's. Get yourself a scoop or two and take a walk along Hyde St. and check out the people as they ride along the passing cable cars.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I swear that this is the best ice-cream in San Francisco. It's made by them, and it's open late. It made my evening to hear that they also sold it by the Quart!!! A sigh of relief to the Marina area. It's not just for rich people anymore.
author: Liz L.

description: My parents used to take us to Swensen's when I was a kid. My favorite ice cream flavor is Mint Chip, but at Swensen's it's Swiss Orange Chip, which is less-than-super-sweet chocolate ice cream with a subtle orange flavor, plus chocolate chips. I was in the neighborhood yesterday, and it was just like I remembered. I like Swensen's ice cream better than Mitchell's, which sort of makes my tummy hurt.
author: Bowen D.

description: Tried Swensen's for the first time tonight. I always get coffee ice cream everywhere I go and thus ordered the Mocha Chip. It was good, but not amazing. I did sample the Sticky Chewy Chocolate (really, just because it has a funky name... I don't prefer chocolate ice cream) and it was VERY good. Overall a good solid ice cream place, but on first impression not anything more.
author: Hanna L.

description: When it comes to desserts I'm pretty much all chocolate all the time.  But I will walk a mile for Swensen's Peppermint Stick.  Hot pink heaven.
author: Deirdre C.

description:
The place looks exactly the way it did when I was in high school (1964-1967) and the ice cream is still one of the best. I haven't had a flavor that I did not like.

Swensen's is very San Francisco.

Biggest drawback is no seating to enjoy your ice cream.
author: John C.

description: One of my favorite ice cream places ever. It helps that it's near my house...or may not be helping my belly. Eessh! All their flavors are sooo good; however, I did have a bad run in with the green tea. It still doesn't tinge my love for this ice cream shop.  I've been going there since I was 5 and it's still as good as it was back then. Mmm....writing about it makes me want to trek over for a cone or a giant waffle sundae. It's a must try.
author: Dolores L.

description: Nothing better than a scoop of chunky strawberry ice cream on a hot day, except maybe a scoop of dark chocolate when my womanly hormones take over..
author: Carrie S.

description: I've mostly only ever had the Lemon Custard because I only rarely have the chance to visit. When I moved to the peninsula I went to the store in Palo Alto and was so very disappointed (that store has since closed), nothing compares to the real one on Hyde.
author: Melissa W.

description: Oh yeah! Unlike most ice creams, the ice cream here tastes fresh, is super creamy, and is simply delicious. Great waffle cones. Russian Hill is a great place to enjoy an old-fashioned ice cream cone.
author: Joyce G.

description:
hi !
my name is sherly
and i am a swensen's addict !
author: sherly A.

description: There are seriously no words to describe the ice cream at this place.... okay there is one word... AWESOME. The store is very small. There is a large selection of flavors. Awesome shakes and the BEST Banana ice cream ever! It's definitely worth the long walk up those horrible hills. :)
author: Christiana R.

description: I love this place. Their sorbet is unlike any other I've had. Its got almost a magical texture that I haven't found elsewhere. I'm starting to salivate thinking about it...
author: Emily A.

description: This place has the best ice cream in the city bar none. I love it. I've been coming here since I was a kid and have always found it to be excellent.
author: Erik S.

description:
growing up, my favorite ice cream used to be strawberry.  as i've gotten older, i've found that i'd rather go for black cherry, pistacio, vanilla, coffee, etc (basically any flavor other than strawberry).  that was until my visit to swensons.  after taking my first lick i was amazed!! the ratio of actual strawberry pieces to ice cream was great! since that experience i try to bring swenson's over to bbq's, dinner parties, etc!  

the only downer to my strawberry story was the last time i bought one of their pre-packed 1/2 gallon tubs of ice cream.  when i brought it home to eat, i was disappointed that the ratio of strawberry bits to ice cream was severly lacking.  do i dare say that swenson's puts fewer strawberry bits in the 1/2 gallon tubs b/c they're cheaper vs. their hand packed quarts?  i can only ponder this thought.  until i figure out the answer, i've since bought hand-packed quarts of strawberry.  this way i can watch with enjoyment as the frozen strawberry pieces are jam packed into the container! 

does anyone have any thoughts on my 1/2 gallon strawberrry ice cream theory? does swenson's purposely add fewer strawberry pieces to cut costs? or did i just get a "bad" 1/2 gallon of strawberry that day?
author: Russ N.

description: OMG! This place is amazing! Can't get enough of it. If you like Cold Stone, you will fall in love over and over with Swensen's ice cream!
author: sierra s.

description: My grandfather lives right around the corner from Swensen's, so this place has many fond memories for me.    As a big ice cream junkie, Swensen's mocha chip is the pinnacle of good ice cream in my book.. very creamy, rich, sweet and gooood.   My only bad experience there was having a stale cone but other than that Swensens is top notch for me.   Their strawberry flavor is really good too - there's nothing that compares.
author: T M.

description: I eat so much ice cream that its ridiculous!  This place is awesome...  I can't live without at least one pint of Sticky Chewy Chocolate per week.
author: Cameron M.

description: I love the fact that they make their ice cream on the premises, I love the old building that has been there forever, and I love the guys who work there who are kind of too cool to be ice cream servers so they have a bit of an attitude to save their rep.  Delicious flavors, even the low fat ones are absolute heaven.
author: Em S.

description: Something about a scoop of Swensen's just makes you happy. Kinda like kissing your girl. And if you take your girl to Swensen's....
author: Nigel E. S.

description: I grew up lapping Swensen's.  SF, and Monterey.  To be clear, I grew up lapping LEMON FUCKING CUSTARD at Swensen's.  Then, they decided to discontinue LEMON FUCKING CUSTARD.  Now, they just have good ice cream...but so does Safeway.
author: keith k.

description: wow, the ice cream here really is good!  If it wasn't for that huge hill I have to walk up to get to it, id b here all the time! but thats probably a good thing.
author: Molly C.

description: Some of the best ice cream in the Bay Area. Some might disagree and say MItchell's is the best, but I think both are in the same area of greatness considering that Mitchell uses a higher butter fat content, thus creating a creamier product. If you happen upon Russian Hill, I suggest hiting Swensens for cookies and cream, coffee, mocha fudge. Better yet get Swensens signature sticky chewy chocolate. Egg nog(ice cream and drink) is great also during the holidays.
author: Kendrick D.

description: I should have an account here. While the service can be hit or miss - the icecream is always fantastic. my favorites- raspberry chocolate chip  and green tea. It's a bummer they're not open on Mondays.
author: angela g.

description: Ok, this is simply really decently made, fresh ice cream.  There's nothing especially special about this ice cream, but that's the charm.  It's good ol' american ice cream, well made.  Tons of flavors, with fat or with none or just reduced, or with whip cream and hot fudge in a waffle cone, or not.  My favorite is any flavor just dipped in chocolate so that it has that nice cripsy shell on the outside that melts when you pry it off with your very happy thirsting tongue. (And the location makes for a nice mid afternoon or early evening stroll.)
author: Today Y.

description: Everyone raves about Swensen's - and I have to admit that I've risked getting towed while illegally double-parking in order to buy a few tubs of ice cream for an ice cream party - but I just don't think that the ice cream is that great.  It's good, but no better than Breyer's, although a bit creamier.  I still think that Haagen-Daz and Ben and Jerry's are better than Swensen's.  They have some interesting flavors, and it is one of the few ice cream places in the city - but the parking situation is a nightmare and makes it less of an appealing option than some other places.  I want to love this place, but I just can't for some reason...
author: Christina S.

description:
Simply the best.  Next best Mitchells, after that Fentons, then Gunthers in Sacramento.  I KNOW MY ICE CREAM.  

Swenson's has a high butter fat content...combined with wonderful vanilla flavor makes it the best!
author: Roby R.

description: LOVE IT!! So tasty and so many flavors, any ice cream lover will want to get back there all the time. Young staff is nice but can be a little stiff, but who really cares when you are getting great ice cream. Salivating now!!
author: Bowen P.

description:
I love eating ice cream when it is cold. 
The fresh banana ice cream was yummy.
author: vernice l.

description: Other reviewers have noted it's service without a smile, but nice ice cream.  Agreed, and that's fine.  Unfortunately today I had someone serving me who conveyed deep unhappiness with their job and therefore the customers.  It was very unpleasant, and this customer has decided that their ice cream is not worth it.
author: Alan D.

description: Their low-fat mint chip was REALLY YUMMY! I'm not so sure I ever really believe that stuff places claim is low-fat really is, but regardless, I really enjoyed it. An actual posting of nutrition facts on the stuff would have put up the last star...yeah, I'm a food geek like that.
author: Diane S.

description: J says: They've got great flavors here like turkish coffee, bittersweet chocolate and of course the famous sticky chewy chocolate.  The ice cream sundaes are the way to go, gooey hot fudge, chopped nuts and a perfect maraschino cherry to top it off!
author: Jen Ken H.

description: Oh my GOD! This is one of my favorite places in Russian Hill!  I love the coconut pineapple and the swiss orange chip!  A small definitely handles the sweet tooth but if you feel like splurging a single and double will do.  A pint also works perfect as a contribution to a potluck dinner as I never get anything but "ohhhs" and "ahhs" come dessert time.   You can buy sugar cones too.
author: Michelle F.

description:
i have been frequenting this place for the last 30 or so years & it has not changed, which is not a bad thing, why mess with a good thing.  the ice cream here is is made fresh & is delicious.  

i recently shared this little gem with my son after spending a long & tiring evening in chinatown lion dancing.  he loved every last bit of it.  we also picked up some hand packed ice cream (french vanilla & caramel swirl) to take home with us.   

the place is wonderful, it is a old time ice cream shop & for me a bunch of memories of a much simpler time.  you can see the machine set up in the window & watch them make the ice cream.  

parking is a bit of a hassle here, as there is very little to no street parking.  they only accept cash here so be aware.  if you get a red star on your receipt your purchase is free for up to 5.00.  enjoy... :)
author: larry s.

description: Fresh, delicious, locally made ice cream located atop a steep hill.  YUM and good for you.
author: Scott W.

description: Great ice cream and charming location! It's right on a scenic corner in Russian Hill. Great place to take a date or to just grab some dessert after hitting one of the nice local restaurants for dinner. The staff is super friendly and it's fun to see all of the locals out getting their fill at night.
author: Carter F.

description: The best place in the neighborhood for fresh ice cream.... Delish!
author: H.A. ..

description: After moving into the neighborhood, my friend got me hooked onto Swensen's...first it was just for your ice cream cone, then it quickly became a pint...then a quart...then let's go for the gusto and get the half gallon, baby!!  They have the best coffee ice cream ever--and the lichee is also dreamy.  Whenever I drive by there on my way home (from anyplace), if there is a parking space in front, I take that as a cosmic sign that "you must stop for ice cream, earthling!"
author: Nancy H.

description: Best ice cream ever...you can watch the guy making it..my fav is the butterscotch it just oozes out of the ice cream...I love it!!
author: Gloria ..

description: I've been going to Swensen's since I was a kid. I love their ice cream and their milkshakes. There is no better place. This place has been around since my mom was young and she came here when she was a kid. Parking's hard but it's worth it.  The scoops are huge and the ice cream is nice and creamy.
author: Tiff L.

description: Warm day (in June??),  mocha chip ice cream (heaven), friendly service (from a teenager)= 5 stars.
author: Carlos C.

description: Walking into Swensen's is like taking a trip back in time to the local ice cream parlor that I frequented as a child on hot summer days. So what if the sun doesn't always make an appearance in this city, some days you just need a classic cone. Living down the street from this creamy goodness is certainly dangerous for my health, but ohhh so good.
author: whitney w.

description: I love this place! I grew up going here for ice cream all the time! even though i move out of the neighborhood, this is the only place i come for ice cream. ***marble fudge*** =)
author: Lynn P.

description: I must admit that i'm not much of an Ice-cream eater, but if there was a place, this should be it. Still in it's original architecture, this swensens serves the most delicious ice-cream i've ever tasted. It certainly got me addicted.
author: benjamin c.

description: Milkshakes here are very yummy and they have lots of different flavors of ice cream to choose from.  Total hole in the wall, but definitely worth going to if you want a milkshake.
author: Kristin W.

description: Swensen's great for any day of the year.  For me personally, I love eating ice cream when it's cold and rainy, I don't know why, I just do.  Service is always great, at least, it always has been for me.  My favorites are green tea, mocha fudge, lychee, and vanilla bean. The BEST thing about this place is that they give you more than what you pay for.  My scoops are always huge!
author: Skye C.

description: Stopped by on a Saturday afternoon for a quick treat. The 10 minute parking in front was open so we took advantage of that. There wasn't a line and we got in and out very quickly. I had a small pumpkin, hubby had cookies & cream and mocha fudge in a waffle cone. The pumpkin was perfect, tasted just like frozen pumpkin pie filling-I wanted much more! Tried hubby's-both were excellent. Mocha flavor is very strong, make sure you like coffee for this one. Waffle cone was also great. Service was efficient but not very friendly. A bit on the pricy side...for both of ours it was $7.50 (my scoop was very little, too...)
author: Heather I.

description: I still can't tell if living next door to this place was a good or bad decision.  It has made for a quick meal many nights though.  And, i have tried nearly every flavor.  I love the banana, as it reminds me of my favorite ice cream as a kid.  The cookies and cream is definitely the best I have ever had...they put just the right amount of cookies in.  and the sticky chewy chocolate is wonderful as well.
author: Chris M.

description: After eating in dorky ice cream joints in the city, I am glad I found this place. They offer a wide variety of flavors, I love the thin chocolate mint flavor well I tried six different flavors in one hour. Too bad they don't have a place to sit but the pavement outside will do just fine.
author: Robie G.

description: This place is so damn cute I have to give it 5 stars.  Location is excellent -- on the beautiful shady part of Hyde atop Russian Hill complete w/ cable car.  This is a great place for a neighborhood stroll and some ice cream or a yummie milk shake.  I tried a peach milk shake and it was awesome.  They also have some low-cal / low-fat options.  We've been there a few times and are always happy customers.  The smell of fresh made waffle cones pulls passers-by in and I can't blame them one bit.  I would definitely recommend this place, especially on a warm day or after a nice dinner out and you want to stop for dessert on the way home.
author: ardian b.

description: I grew up in Southern California addicted to Swensen's Swiss Orange Chip ice cream. The SF location is a truly old-fashioned ice cream shop. There is a Swensen's in the food court at the Luxor Las Vegas as well, but it just doesn't have the same atmosphere. Both locations serve Swiss Orange Chip and are a must stop for me when I'm in either of these cities. The SF location is a great neighborhood ice cream shop that is consistently packed even in the coldest of SF weather. Beware they are closed on Mondays, as I learned the hard way!
author: Claire S.

description:
I live nearby, and I am a reqular to Swensens.  Great Ice cream. There's a guy who sometimes likes to try and have fun with people, and makes the atmosphere better.
Get the coconut pineapple.
author: Mark Q.

description: Swensons Ice Cream is great but the customer service is the worst I've ever had. This is not the first time, its everytime. I would have made tonight my last night if it wasn't for Danny:) The only employee that smiles (and talks) not only that but Danny makes a mean sundae:)
author: Tesha S.

description: Swiss Orange Chip!! Open 'till midnight on the weekends, closed Mondays.
author: Kevin D.

description: PLEASE PLEASE bring back the lemon custard. ice cream..it is my all time favorite and i am sooooooooooo disappointed.  Okay, I am begging!
author: Peggy M.

description: I don't know if this is a relic of a dwindling chain or if this was the original that inspired others but there used to be a Swensen's Ice Cream store near Main Beach in Laguna Beach when I was growing up - I get all nostalgic when I see the sign and they do chocolate as good as I remember...
author: Quartknee K.

description:
i was having quite a grumpy day and to cheer me up, he figured that ice cream would do the trick ... question is, did it? =)

hahah... 

yea, it did do the trick momentarily until i got fussy all over again. hahaha..

ice cream is // will always (be) a delightful treat... the rich creamy texture ... i swear, whether you like it or not, swensen's ice cream will just grow on you.

=]

good luck in parking...
author: Jennifer S.

description: For my 200th review, I decided to pick something recent that hasn't even been shelved on my "crap you haven't gotten around to reviewing yet" list (a.k.a. yelp bookmarks). After a killer dinner at Zarzuela, we forced ourselves across the street where the Swensen's crew tried to close the door in our faces but were kind enough to let us in to try and make a quick order. The man running the show was quite animated and we spent more time cracking jokes with him than we did talking about how many pints of what kinds ice cream we wanted to leave with. We ended up with a pint of mocha chip and a pint of (yummmm) thin mint. We paid and left and I turned to my mom who was carrying the bag and asked her to check that he had put the lid on the second pint of ice cream since to me it looked like he just dropped it into the bag like it was a laser-guided bomb. She said he definitely put the lid on and off we went. Of course, later that night when we broke out the pints to put them in the freezer she exclaimed, hey, the lid isn't fixed on this top pint of ice cream! S.h.o.c.k.e.r. On the bright side, he had filled that pint over the top so I guess he couldn't get the lid on. Warning us of this would have been a nice touch instead of letting us walk out with a melting mocha chip time-bomb. As Homer would say though ... it's just a little melted, it's still good, it's still good.
author: Todd F.

description: If you've read any of my other reviews, you may have guessed that I like ice cream. Surprisingly I had never tried Swensen's which is in my neighborhood and easily accessible by cable car (random note: you cannot eat ice cream in a cable car). Swensen's looks like an old fashioned ice cream parlor, and indeed it is. While there are not as many exotic flavors as Mitchell's the nice thing about this creamery is that they have a decent selection of light ice creams so even though I do a lot of walking up hills to get there, I won't be turning into a blimp. I've had the light cookies and cream flavor all three times I've payed a visit. Maybe I should broaden my horizons and try something different, but it was just that good. Almost more cookies than cream. Real oreos too, not fake hydrox or other imposters. I also sampled the sticky gooey chocolate or whatever it is called which is not bad. I'll be going back to Swensen's especially if the weather gets warmer.
author: Kate A.

description: Great milkshakes and better-than-Breyer's ice cream.  I feel bad for the workers.  The look like they don't get paid enough and the owner is kind of an annoying, money-hungry guy.
author: Trinh N.

description: This place is okay (I never turn down ice cream, even bad ice cream) but the rude staff are a bit of a turnoff.  Which is good, since it keeps me from going there too often.
author: Sally A.

description: oh how i love ice cream!  swensen's is such a great old school ice cream place.  it definitely gets crowded on a nice day, so you kind of have to know that going in if its sunny.  but its worth a little wait - my favorites include peppermint stick (its like candy canes!!) and mocha chip.
author: Carolyn B.

description: Apparently Swensen's used to be a fairly common chain in certain parts of CA. My best friend rattled on and on and on about one being in his hometown of Arroyo Grande and how much he missed it once they closed down. Well a few years ago I found the one here in the city. I planned and plotted and after taking my friend out to North Beach for lunch I drove him up Russian Hill where we proceeded to fight ! Finally at the last crest of the hill I told him to look on the corner. Smartie snapped and asked what am I looking at (he was looking at the wrong corner)? I told him to look the other way and saw tears spring up in his eyes. He turned to look at me and said,"There's really still a Swensen's?". Yes Jakey there really is still a Swensen's. As we walked along chowing down on our ice cream cones (mine vanilla and his cookies and cream respectively), giggling and chatting along I realized that there is something magical about a good ice cream cone (creamy, sweet goodness) and that sometimes it's worth hunting down a piece of childhood for your friends.
author: Veronica G.

description: swenson's reminds me of my childhood, b/c they used to be all over the bay area, including newpark mall in newark, of all places.  after a dinner at okoze two doors down, i felt the need to get swenson's for old time's sake.  good selection of flavors, and they also have lite and fat free selections for those who are health-conscious.  they also have a couple frozen yogurt flavors.  i also like that they have a 3 oz sized cone/cup, so you aren't stuffed after just having pigged out at dinner.  i had the caramel almond swirl or something, which was delish.
author: Helen T.

description: Some people choose Bi-Rite, other's Mitchell's.  For delicous San Francisco ice cream, I choose Swensen's.  There are several factors at play here.  First of all, it is only four-and-a-half blocks from my house.  The North Beach gelato joints are slightly closer, but swamped with tourists, and a bit gimmicky.  Second, they have wonderfully creamy ice cream that hits the spot on a hot, late summer day.  Third, their French vanilla custard is just a delight.  Look, I'm not a vanilla person -- I don't like it as the individual flavor in ice cream, as it ends up being to bland most of the time.  But their French vanilla custard has become my stand-by because it is just so fantastic.  Other favorites of mine include their pink peppermint, the seasonal egg nog and pumpkin ice creams (very apparently made with real egg nog and real pumpkin), and Turkish coffee.  My advice will always be to skip the crowds, and come to Swensen's.
author: Nick B.

description: i have to say, i was underwhelmed here.  i had pretty high expectations, but how does the place fit on the bi-rite scale?  around par.  i would say the style here is pretty creamy and very much like tuckers in alameda, but tuckers is definitely better.  i tried cookies and cream and it was good, but nothing spectacular.  bi-rite, three twins, humphrey, and now polly ann's are all better.
author: Robert S.

description: minus 1 star for absolutely ZERO parking. and that they're closed on some random ass weekday. otherwise, the black mountain raspberry is to DIE for. my boyfriend turned me on to this flavor .. and this flavor.. well.. it definitely did it for me. in fact.. get a handpacked pint. or the biggest size they have.
author: Mel L.

description: I've known about Swensen's since the summer before my senior year in high school when I was hired at one which was opening in my hometown.  I can't tell you how many flavors I taste-tested (we got a free scope after every shift as a perk of the job)!  I liked them all, but the ones I remember most were Sticky Chewy Chocolate, Swiss Orange Chip, Strawberry Banana, Chocolate Chip (with toffee chips!!) and Love, which was chocolate ice cream flavored with cinnamon, nuts and cherries (yes, we made Love at Swensen's!).  I took my son to SF this summer and had to stop at the original Swensen's (and one of the few remaining in the US). I wasn't disappointed! He had the sticky chewy chocolate and I had the Swiss Orange Chip (my all-time fave), with a scoop of Lychee, which I'd never seen before. WOW!!! I have another reason now to head back to SF as soon as I can arrange another trip!  If you love old-fashioned, home-made ice cream without gimmicks and frills, this is the place for you!!
author: Kim W.

description: Closed on Mondays?!?  Why??  I had to trek it over to the corner store to get a pint of Ben&Jerry's instead.  Yeah I love ice cream..but other than that, this place serves gooood ice cream, it tastes old-fashioned and REAL.  So if you're not feeling like going to a touristy crowded place for good ice cream like Ghirardelli Square, go to Swensen's instead and get some simple ice cream in a cone.  Oh, and when I ordered a single scoop, the guy gave me two scoops for the price of one..really nice, I'll come back!
author: Trisha H.

description: Bleck. Ice cream is wayyyy overly sweet....it's loaded with sugar. If you're into that, this is totally your place. I do love the interior (the extra star), reminding you of a lovely mom  & pop type of ice cream parlor, but the ice cream is horrible. Had the mint fudge & turkish coffee ice cream. I'm now wishing I had opted for the crema catalana for dessert at Zarzuela. But instead, I saw the line and was drawn to this place. What a mistake!
author: Jeannette L.

description:
chocolate and rum and raisin are my favorites. 

it is unbelievably soft, fluffy, cream ice cream.  not sickeningly sweet.  just right.  it is cruel that i can walk there.
author: tc h.

description: my friend got me half a gallon of lychee from swensens... i have to say thats its really really really f-ing good.. haha the lychee pieces in the ice cream are big too! my little nephew is addicted to it
author: JUDY L.

description: my childhood and forever favorite ice cream stop!  hearts for a single scoop of mocha chip on a sugar cone!  perfect dessert - it's not overly sweet that you can't finish.    but why did you discontinue lemon custard=sadness.  bring it back!
author: Meredith K.

description: The best part of my search for Spanish tapas in this city...  After diner at Zarzuela we went across the street for a dessert: ice cream from Swensen's.  The best idea of the evening.  I had the old-fashioned vanilla and the chocolate chip ice cream, and both were very good.  The ice cream isn't cheap but it's totally worth it.  We walked home across the city with our ice creams on this perfect spring evening enjoying this beautiful city and sparkling conversation...
author: Marijke D.

description: let me tell you something i dont really like ice cream but after eating here?! I LOVE ICE CREAM! soo i went yesterday night  and i read the sign eggnog and pumpkin in the window! i was like wow two of my favorite things in one bowl? its a must! so i got one scoop of each and put a cone on top! the eggnog was to die for and the pumpkin was bomb! i was so sad when i finished it!I i love ice cream thanks to swensens!!!!!
author: Jessica W.

description: totally worth walking to the top of the hill for. and then you don't have to feel guilty about eating ice cream since you did all that walking! come on, you deserve it. once a guy in line told me to try the lemon custard and boy, was i satisfied!
author: Oleya P.

description: Short walk down the hill to have creamy ice cream is heavenly.  Their Lemon custard, Coconut pineapple, Swiss orange chip are good.  Last night I tried Black rasberry marble and it was awsome!
author: Su Kyeong K.

description: mmm, toasted almond ice cream with a scoop of chocolate. for a very adorable day, ride the cable car over to swensen's and get yerself a waffle cone!
author: Jacqui M.

description: on that rare warm summer day, i trevailed across our scorched 7x7 to have me a scoop of that sweet lollipop called swensen's, something in this life i can count on for, dependable, fond memories of my childhood, tasty, and satisfying treat!   twenty year rule warrants ****
author: tim y.

description: This gem at the top of Russian Hill serves delicious ice cream that's made fresh on-site.  Try the Swiss Orange Chip if you are looking for chocolate with a little extra something.  A 2nd store is open in Palo Alto.
author: Mary C.

description: This place is a simple ice cream parlor. No frills. The ice cream is good, but as far as a neighborhood ice cream joint goes, well, it's the ONLY ice cream joint in the neighborhood. It could use a little bit more individuality. Nothing special about it. But when you need ice cream....can't complain.
author: Jenna F.

description: why would you have an ice cream shop where you can't actually see the flavors? beats me but makes choosing a flavor that much harder. beware, the waffle cones are huge! also the light flavors are delish and super creamy.
author: elissa w.

description: great ice cream, nice service. the workers there are really friendly and that have a varies of favors and drinks
author: Lu G.

description: I love old school ice cream places!!  Swensens rocks....
author: Richard C.

description: this place is super good. i know that its just ice-cream but its so good and not expensive. but would it kill them to make it just a little bigger so more than 3 people can stand inside
author: Mike L.

description: we were walking along hyde, getting the lay of the land and looking for apt. for rents signs when we saw this oasis on the horizon - an ice cream shop! there was a line and we were like hell's yeah! we'd just walked up a  huge ass hill and we deserved something for it. shoot. anyhow's i have no idea how this place is famous, it was the WORST ice cream i've had in a long time! first, it was so hard, we couldn't get the damn spoon into the paltry overpriced portion and when we did it tasted all frostbitten. needless to say, we threw it in the first trash can we came across.
author: Toisha T.

description: Not so great.  Their hot fudge tasted... well.... strange.  I consider myself somewhat of a hot fudge connoisseur so this was a big ding against them.  My banana and blueberry ice creams were good but I can easily get similar quality elsewhere, and closer!
author: Chris C.

description: I have gone here forever. I believe this is the original location for Swenson's.  Many flavors are excellent, but I recommend the "cookies in cream", or "mint chip" is great as well.  The sundae's or packed pint are great deal and you can get two flavors. People in SF give Mitchell's high marks, but I have to disagree. I think the ice cream at Swenson's or Joe's on 18th and Geary is excellent.
author: Niko P.

description: I too grew up in so cal addicted to swensens, every summer my grandpa would keep in stock huge containers of strawberry and sticky chewy chocolate, when they started shutting down all the stores I never found a replacement until I moved to the SF area and found my old fav is in town.
author: Thomas W.

description: Fabulous taste and great price. I paid $2.50 for a scoop in a sugar cone.
author: Danielle S.

description: ADORABLE ice cream shop in the middle of Russian Hill, selling ice cream made right in their shop!  Fantastic, cozy little place, and yummy ice cream.  Great flavors, too.  You can tell the ice cream is great because the rest of the clientele is also so happy and excited to be there, even standing in line.
author: P L.

description: Swensen's is the best!  I have been going here since I was a kid.  The strawberry ice cream is the best that I have tried anywhere.  I like the ice cream better here that Mitchell's (way too long of a wait) or Bi-Rite.  The prices have gone up a bit, but it is so worth it.
author: Brian L.

description: Yummmmmy! Totally worth the walk up the hill, and that burns the all the calories you will consume.
author: M B.

description: So, I'm visiting SF with my wife.  We're at Pier 39 and we get a hankerin' for ice cream.  There are a couple of spots there close by, but I pull up swensen's on the old mobile GPS.  We both have a sentimental, nostalgic allegiance with Swensen's and I assure her it's worth the hike up Hyde.  "Besides," I tell her, "we'll burn off the ice cream calories before we eat it!"  Well, she had to use the restroom half-way up...and I mean HAD to use it.  When we finally arrived, I was disappointed.  The place was looking pretty bad.  The help was not friendly.  The menu was not as good as the places at Pier 39.  And the help wasn't very helpful and cheerful.  So much for nostalgia.  We wanted a banana split and they didn't have one.  What kind of an ice cream shop doesn't have a banana split?  What kind of an ice cream shop that doesn't have it on the menu, doesn't offer to make it anyway (one without bananas I guess, but I digress...).  How about when we ask if there's a restroom nearby, the response is, "Uh, the only one I know of is really far away."  As opposed to, "Well, we don't have a public one, but considering the fact that your legs are crossed, you're sweating, and pronated at 45 degrees...and doing the dance, go ahead and use the one back here behind the counter."  That would have been nice.  Oh well.  I mean, maybe I'm setting my standards too high.  I guess you can be the judge.  In the meantime, I'm going to relax my allegiance to Swensen's and go with something in a more convenient proximity next time. ;-)
author: Mike F.

description: swensen's has the best damn ice cream i've ever tasted in my life! aahahahahaa. it's so scrumptious! it's so natural and it does not taste artificial at all.  the banana ice cream is the best. i'm salivating just thinking about it. hahah. seriously, people need to check this place out. i give it five stars cos it might just be a little hole-in-the-wall, but if you take it to go, it goes well with a nice stoll in sf. After walking up that huge hill just to get there, swensens ice cream is the best reward anyone could ask for after an exhausting walk. oh yeah! and their milkshakes are superrrr yummy!
author: Jasmine T.

description: how can you not give the original swensons 5 stars?   old school ice cream excellence, no fancy flavors, just good cream, sugar and flavor
author: p v.

description: grew up on this place.  love the old fashioned style ice cream not the foo-foo stuff.  take my kids here and they love it too.
author: Kevin J.

description: favorite ice cream spot in the bay!! I havent been in a while but always get it dipped in fudge with a side of nuts!
author: Lake R.
